review: Игровой процесс "защиты башни", который был в основной части игры приключений Ван Хельсинга дополнительной активностью, сам по себе не тянет на полноценную игру и уж тем более не стоит этих денег. Сюжета нет, а значит и прогресс героя ради возможности пройти тот же уровень на более сложном режиме не имеет смысла, количество же карт-уровней очень мало. Однообразие быстро надоедает. Брать эту недоигру лучше по большой скидке и довеском к Хельсингу

author: {'steamid': '76561198029842418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1742, 'last_played': 1711220695}
review:
解锁最后一行的“传送门陷阱”和“布雷陷阱”的方法：
由于汉化文件这个位置的描述有些模糊，很容易导致以为是要5个机械塔各升5级！其实只需要第一列的地面陷阱塔随便选一个在升级列表里面把I、II、III三项都升满，然后在一个关卡里面造5个这个地面陷阱并且每个都升到满级（即塔的I、II、III三项都升满三个红点），在这个状态下过关就可以了，难度及关卡都是不限的。
同理，“布雷陷阱”就是在第二列的地面陷阱里面重复前面说的操作就可以解锁了。这游戏讨论的人太少连攻略都不好找，有帮到你的话请给个赞吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198030840424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1710542948}
review: Played to 100% completion on console several years ago, and was delighted to find the game on Steam recently.  Simply put, it's Tower Defense and old-style Diablo, and it's incredibly rewarding for fans of either genre.  This is also a perfect starting point for new Tower Defense players, who want to be able to start on Easy, and slowly increase their difficulty when they're ready.

author: {'steamid': '76561199087242242', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1709509745}
review: Got this accidentally ( essentially free with the cheapo van helsing bundle sale ) and was pretty surprised overall. Theirs skill trees for individual towers, a character you can move around and click and use skills with aside from your normal towers, and certain gear drops actually change your character cosmetically. Their is a bit of grinding this game will have you do, but no complaints.. its pretty cool and grinding just means more entertainment. Only thing i dislike the most is you cant pick and choose where to place towers, they are premade per map and you can just build them where the devs allow you to, but each tower has skill trees and you get skill points from leveling up so its not as bad as it sounds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017647925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 7868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4584, 'last_played': 1709932366}
review:
Hello. 

Ce jeu à 5 tag pour moi Tower Defense, Hack and Slash, Rogue Like, Stratégie et Coop.

Vous pouvez jouer en coop jusqu'à 3 joueurs ce qui n'est écrit nul part. Chaque mapes changent en fonction de si vous jouez à 1, 2, ou 3 joueurs. Un mode Versus existe aussi.

Très bon jeu dans sa catégorie. Difficulté présente mais le jeu vous laisse un bon temps d'adaptation. 

Si vous aimez ce type de jeu n'hésitez pas. Petite info, sur le bon timing vous pouvez l'avoir à très bon prix sur Instant Gaming.

Have Fun !

review:

I wish the upgrades came faster though. After many hours, I still didn't unlock many skills.

If Deathtrap 2 comes to life, please optimize something.

review:
Awesome co-op that keeps you coming back. Rewarding progression across weapons, armor, and skills. Devs did a great job  adding variety to each tier of the campaign, making the same map play completely different each time. Bosses also present difficult surprises right when you think you're safe.

I recommend WASD for movement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124365969', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1706640482}
review: Проходил еще на пиратке на какой -то GTX 550 на работе. ТОгда комп пыхтел и все равно выдавал смачнкую порцию удовольствия от смеси защиты башенок и РПГ. Кампания здесь очень коротка.Проходится за пару часов.Сам же контент -в отбивании волн бесконечной различной нечисти, бестиарии оной здесь приличный. Так доставляет лут и развитие своих башень.Часть которых нельзя даже открыть после компании- нужно проходить карты еще раз, с повышением уровня сложности и выбиванием условии.На мой взгляд-крайне приятная и залипательная игра,в которой даже не на требовательном железе можно залипнуть

author: {'steamid': '76561198052315038', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1259, 'last_played': 1707037420}
review:
Ein guter Mix aus ARPG und Tower Defense. 
Die Wege und positionen der Fallen sind vorgegeben, man hat Punkte um die Fallen zu aktivieren, im Verlauf bekommt man durch das töten der Monster weiter Punkte und kann dadurch mehr Fallen aktivieren (man kann die Fallen auch deaktivieren und bekommt die Punkte zurück).
Es gibt mehrere Wellen an Gegnern und jede Welle eröffnet weitere Wege denen die Monster folgen.

Jedes Szenario hat drei Schwierigkeitsstufen,  es gibt also genug zu tun und das Spiel hat auch genug Tiefe um fordernd zu sein.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203370568', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 995, 'last_played': 1707248231}
review: Залипательная игра. Ставишь ловушки с умом, крошишь мобов, защищаешь базу от вторжения, параллельно какие-то задания можно выполнить. Улучшаешь экипировку, улучшаешь ловушки, улучшаешь пассивные навыки и активные умения, чтобы пройти каждый уровень на 3 звезды. Потом бесконечный режим, можно с друзьями играть, если они есть. Если нет, то просто влететь в сеть. Много очивок, связанных с игрой по сети. Особо так-то и без развития игра, но чисто пораскинуть мозгами, придумать стратегию защиты - это да. За полную цену не стоит наверное покупать, у меня же игра была в комплекте с ван хельсингами, да за 95% скидку, так что ок.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960851652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2644, 'last_played': 1663532332}
review:
Gioco di difeda della torre ambientata in mondo dark/ciberpunk dove orde di demoni e simili cercano di rubare anime. Si devono piazzare trappole e cercare di costruire combo. Il nostro personaggio è armato ed ha un interessante sviluppo delle skill.

—{ Grafica }—
☐ Dimenticherai la realtà
☑ Bella
☐ Buona
☐ Decente
☐ Scarsa
☐ Non guardare troppo a lungo
☐ MS-DOS

Lo ho giocato prima su Xbox e poi su PC ed in entrambi i casi la ambientazione è uno dei punti di forza.

—{ Gameplay }—
☐ Molto Buono
☑ Buono
☐ Sufficiente
☐ Beh
☐ Come guardare il muro
☐ Inesistente

Molto bello a livello normale. Salendo di difficoltà diventa frustrante. 

—{ Audio }—
☐ Piacere per le orecchie
☐ Molto buono
☑ Buono
☐ Così così
☐ Male
☐ Sono diventato sordo

Bella la musica e la voce narrante.

—{ Audience }—
☐ Per bambini
☐ Per ragazzi
☑ Per adulti
☐ Per mia nonna

—{ PC Requirements }—
☐ Se parte a malapena paint
☐ Minimo
☐ Decente
☑ Veloce
☐ Hai speso la paghetta
☐ La NASA ti ha chiesto di prestarglielo

—{ Difficulty }—
☐ Premi Spazio… vinto!
☐ Facile
☐ Facile da iniziare / Difficile da finire
☑ Usare il cervello
☐ Difficile
☐ Dark Souls

Dato il tipo di gioco è ovviamente impegnativo per quanto riguarda la pianificazione e le mappe vanno giopcate piu'volte per farle bene. Purtroppo è stato messo un sistema di rigiocabililità dove di possone settare degli handicap molto complesso che alla fine fa passare la voglia di rigiocare le mappe oltre un certo numero di volte. 

—{ Grind }—
☐ No grind
☑ Solo per attacchi di completismo
☐ Medio
☐ Troppo
☐ Devi avere un clone che lo fa a posto tuo

Per avere tutte le stelle su tutti i livelli si devono ripetere le mappe molte volte, ci si stufa dopo un po'.

—{ Story }—
☐ Niente storia
☐ Un po’
☐ Media
☑ Buona
☐ Adorabile
☐ Rimpiazzerà la vostra biografia

Per essere un tower defence la trama non è male.

—{ Game Time }—
☐ Il tempo di un caffè
☐ Corto
☐ Medio
☐ Lungo
☑ Infinito

Per attacchi di completismo, se si vuole fare un run solo allora è quasi breve (12 mappe se non ricordo male).

—{ Price }—
☐ Aggratis
☐ Vale il prezzo pieno
☑ Solo se in sconto
☐ Solo se hai soldi da buttare
☐ Non raccomandato
☐ Piuttosto manda a me i soldi

Per gli amanti del franchise vale il prezzo pieno.

—{ Bugs }—
☐ Non registrati
☑ Minori
☐ Possono essere fastidiosi

author: {'steamid': '76561197962092557', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 478, 'playtime_forever': 2417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2417, 'last_played': 1697163433}
review:
[h1] Review[/h1] 
I received this game due to purchasing the neocore franchise pack. I did not really look into this game prior but apparently its an evolved version of the absolutely boring tower defence mode in the van helsing games.

[u]Gameplay[/u]
You pick between 3 classes who can all build the same traps on specific spots or upgrade them. Those classes have own perks and abilities. Like enhancing specific traps or endorsing a specific playstyle. The sorceress seems to focus on slowing down enemies so you can kill them with your magic, hunter focuses on ranged combat and poison damage while the mercenary is supposed to be the guy who actually stays in the line and attacks the enemy.

This works to a certain extent really well. With also having a coop mode you can improve and synchronize certain playstyles. Ontop of that you can enhance your abilities with level ups and equipment you can find. In that regard it plays like a very regular arpg. In the earlier levels I feel the difficulty is just right. You can adjust difficulty and add new mutators etc. Levels itself are all different due to their setup therefore one tactic won’t work for every map and every character. In order to make it not tedious you can speed up time in increments making enemies walk faster, slower or pause.

There are some issues as some of the lategame maps tend to drag on, especially map design wise it’s a lot like van helsings “ink” world which I absolutely hated, felt unimmersive and uninspired. There is also no kind of storyline to bind these levels together so gameplay fatigue can hit in if you are absolutely not having a blast with the gameplay. Also it can be a bit buggy, many achievements don’t work, internet connection can be sloppy and a last enemy in a wave can stop spawning.

[u]Story[/u]
There is none really. Defend the monster gates and don’t let the monsters reach yours. There is supposed to be some kind of story which is loosely connected to van helsings canon due to recycled enemies and the ink but it doesn’t offer a storyline per se. 

[u]Sound[/u]
Your characters shout some voicelines but not too many to make it interesting. The music is okay, sound effects and whatnot but it does not matter as its one of these games you play while having a podcast or youtube video on your second screen.

[u]Conclusion/TL;DR[/u]
It’s a decent game. It has a unique arpg + tower defence idea and pulls it off. It doesn’t have any memorable story to set it apart. Its just a simple neat game nothing more and nothing less. There are better TD games out there but if you specifically look for an ARPG and TD mix this one is alright. Plus coop.

Decent Tower defence with arpg elements that is held back by its very average design and a few bugs here and there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993210208', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1704250633}
review:
This game isn't *bad* and certainly for $3 I'm content with my purchase, but the maps aren't very interesting, the enemy pathing is very strange (zig-zagging around rather than taking shortest-path on occasion), and you can't build defenses anywhere: you're very limited both in where and what defenses can be placed there.

Controls are also less than intuitive and tutorial information lacks some details (for example, that in order to upgrade towers you have to purchase the upgrades, which are a not-an-obvious-button sprite on the traps-skill screen).

All in all I'm just going to go "that was neat" and uninstall without finishing the "campaign."

author: {'steamid': '76561198285123392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1703994430}
review:
This could be a hidden gem, but: 
While the general mechanics of its genre mix are good, there's too limited choice, because the locations and variants of the towers are predetermined, so are the enemy paths. So there is little to no player agency besides slowly walking or awkwardly teleporting from one map side to the other. The user interface and controller support make this viable for (inhouse) remote play, but it still feels a bit dated. 

If you have the means for 3D combat, play Orcs must Die, and the best isometric tower defense RPG hybrid certainly is X-Morph Defense.

author: {'steamid': '76561199261152415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4158, 'last_played': 1703817755}
review: ARPG+塔防，初始陷阱种类少级别低需要自己帮着打怪，中间有一段时期比较轻松，陷阱为主自己打打下手，从大约Tier 3后半段开始，强制自己打怪，陷阱全建满也只能帮到一点小忙，打怪打得手都酸了，自己等级不够攻击力不强的话就只能眼睁睁看着怪群涌进门。打无尽模式升级很快，但是无尽模式后面给怪加血太逆天了，第一回合我一个闪电能杀死一群小怪，到了20回合三四下都杀不死一个最普通的小怪，心累啊~然后懒得继续玩了的主要原因是掉率太低了，打了这么久都没出过一件神装，普通装备又没法升级，我觉得这个游戏在针对我……

author: {'steamid': '76561198119733171', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1496878638}
review:
Comprei este jogo em meados de "2016/2017 pois curto Defesa por Torres!

Entretanto, infelizmente veio acompanhado de muitos crash e erros de inicialização. 

Não consegui adequar nenhuma correção encontrada e de tão chateado que fiquei, removi por completo da biblioteca.

As vezes penso em comprá-lo novamente mas não tenho certeza se recebeu alguma atualização depois deste período.

Caso alguém que tenha ele e ler minha análise, deixarei opção de comentar em aberto e ficarei muito agradecido em me dizer se foi corrigido.

Nota: --/10

Não recomendo até saber se houve atualizações de correção dos problemas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198818949325', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1655603240}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198925342911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1704735802}
review: Gra Deathtrap okazała się rozczarowaniem na wielu płaszczyznach. Interfejs użytkownika jest nieintuicyjny i często prowadzi do frustracji. Rozgrywka jest monotonna, brak innowacyjności w mechanice gry, a misje są powtarzalne, co prowadzi do szybkiego znudzenia. Problemy z balansem sprawiają, że gra staje się niesprawiedliwa i frustrująca. Dodatkowo, wsparcie techniczne jest niewystarczające, ignorując często zgłaszane problemy. Deathtrap obiecuje wiele, ale dostarcza niewiele. Nie mogę polecić tej gry, zwłaszcza wobec bogatej oferty na rynku gier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255128029', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1702925203}
review:
Recenzja gry "Deathtrap": Gigantycznie rozczarowująca.

Giga chujowa – to jedyny adekwatny opis, jaki przychodzi mi do głowy po spędzeniu kilku godzin z grą "Deathtrap". To, co miało być emocjonującym doświadczeniem, okazało się jednym wielkim nieporozumieniem.

Na pierwszy rzut oka, grafika może robić wrażenie, ale po chwili zaczynasz zauważać, że to jedyny pozytyw tej produkcji. Mechanika gry? No cóż, to jakby ktoś wrzucił do miksera wszystko, co złe w gatunku i zmieszał to w jedną niezgrabną całość.

Giga chujowa fabuła jest tak przewidywalna, że można ją odgadnąć po kilku minutach grania. Bohaterowie są jednowymiarowi i bezduszni, a dialogi są tak infantylne, że czasem trudno uwierzyć, że są adresowane do dorosłych graczy.

Co do rozgrywki, to nawet słowo "monotonne" to za mało. Powtarzalność i brak oryginalności są tu na porządku dziennym. Nawet najbardziej zagorzali fani gatunku będą mieli trudności z przetrwaniem kolejnych, niewiele różniących się misji.

Nie wspominając o ogromnej ilości błędów technicznych, które sprawiają, że gra staje się niemal niegrywalna. Częste zawieszenia, problemy z optymalizacją, a także masakryczne czasy ładowania – to wszystko sprawia, że trudno znaleźć jakikolwiek powód, dla którego warto by było inwestować czas w "Deathtrap".

Podsumowując, ta gra jest giga chujowa. Jeśli szukasz czegoś, co dostarczy ci prawdziwej rozrywki, omiń "Deathtrap" szerokim łukiem. Jest to po prostu strata czasu i pieniędzy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327010547', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1703684178}
review:
Gra Deathtrap to niestety rozczarowanie pod każdym względem. Od momentu rozpoczęcia gry do jej zakończenia można odczuwać jedynie frustrację i brak satysfakcji. Przede wszystkim, grafika wydaje się być przestarzała i niezbyt atrakcyjna w porównaniu do nowszych produkcji na rynku.

Rozgrywka również pozostawia wiele do życzenia. Mechanika gry jest niewyważona, a kontrola postaci sprawia wrażenie sztywnej i nieprecyzyjnej. Poziomy są monotematyczne, co prowadzi do szybkiego znużenia, a brak różnorodności w przeciwnikach sprawia, że walki stają się monotonne i przewidywalne.

Największym problemem jest jednak brak odpowiedniego wsparcia ze strony twórców. Gra jest pełna błędów i niedociągnięć, a zgłaszane problemy nie są szybko naprawiane, co wpływa negatywnie na ogólne wrażenia z rozgrywki. Ostatecznie, Deathtrap to produkt, który nie spełnia oczekiwań graczy i nie zasługuje na ich uwagę.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272253385', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 3861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3861, 'last_played': 1702206461}
review:
游戏断断续续游玩68个小时，后期因为自己菜修改器通关了。
游戏是类暗黑破坏神加塔防的类型。
游戏有三个职业：女巫（法师）；雇佣兵（战士）；神射手。三个职业技能不同，但是用的陷阱相同。
游戏有三个模式：
单人模式：关卡有十三个章节（地图），每个章节分：战役模式；剧本模式；无尽模式。
          章节：
          战役模式：四个三星小关卡，难度依次递增，关卡1可以选择休闲普通困难，关卡4只能选择困难；
          剧本模式；可以修改敌人血量，技能伤害，陷阱费用......等去游玩本地图；
          无尽模式：一波又一波，玩过塔防的都懂。
合作模式：支持四人合作，可以与好友游玩，局域网游玩；
对决模式：线上匹配模式，可以选择进攻方和防守方，但是没人玩了。
游戏自带编辑器：自己做地图。
游戏有排行榜。
游戏陷阱种类25个：陷阱可以升级。
人物技能分为：战斗技能（人物输出），陷阱技能（陷阱加强），世界技能（全图性针对陷阱，怪物）。
我射手63级全通关了。没有查到游戏顶级多少。

游戏优点：
1，游戏有创意，暗黑破坏神加塔防，刷词条装备加布局陷阱，趣味十足；
2，游戏画风黑暗，UI建模不错，技能华丽；
3，自带编辑器，可以玩出花了。

游戏缺点：
1，角色培养成本问题，如果我拿一个角色通关，想好好玩另一个角色，只能从头练，毕竟只是塔防，陷阱都一样；
2，游戏无明确的交易系统，可能因为游戏游玩人数不够，无法验证能否交易，我刷到不属于我职业的图纸或者装备，难道只能分解出售吗？

游戏总结：
一款创意趣味十足的塔防游戏，明明可以继续深度开发挖掘的，可惜，可以拉着自己的小伙伴一起游玩，大力推荐！

review: The concept of this game is kind of "Kingdom Rush meets Diablo", with the emphasis on tower defense but some action RPG elements thrown in. I like that idea, and for the first few hours of this game it works fairly well. However, I wouldn't call this game 'complete' so much as just abandoned. There just isn't that much to it after beating the first cycle through of about a dozen stages, I think that, for a more enjoyable experience in the long-term, it would be best to stick with something like Gemcraft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188411526', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1692808327}
review: Хороший таур дифенс. Лет 10 назад наверное бы подзалип. К сожалению поиграл только сейчас. К 2023 игра устарела. Из откровенных минусов: невнятная графика, кривой интерфейс, и в целом вроде стиль есть, но такой бедный и жеваный. Если фанаты жанра таур дифенса с возможностью управления персонажем - то наверное  вполне зайдет. А так можно проходить мимо.

author: {'steamid': '76561199386268326', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 12958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12950, 'last_played': 1705254040}
review:
Неплохой сын брака жанров RPG и TD, но если бы родители как следует взялись за его воспитание, то получилось бы золото, а не бронза затерявшаяся среди других игр. Из мира RPG у нас прокачка героя, шмот, кое-какие спеллы и активное участие в бою. Из мира TD, собственно, сами башни и их раскрутка. Любителям классических TD такое сочетание не понравится, ибо придется привыкать к активному бою, быстро перемещаясь от одного конца карты к другому на ножках героя. Паузы и свободной камеры для постройки башен тут не завезли.

Основные плюсы:
- Сочетание RPG и TD на тонком уровне. Очень тяжело пройти уровень ориентируясь только на что-то одно, приходится находить тонкий баланс.
- Относительно приятный графон, отдает чем-то мрачным, готичным. 
- Есть всякие усложняторы уровня в виде испытаний, заданий на карте, а еще бесконечный режим.
- Есть 3 разных героя, с каждым из них немного меняется основной стиль игры. Но реиграбельности это не дает.
- Есть мультиплеер. 
- Есть маленько русского перевода. Хватает для комфортной игры, но не без косяков.

Основные минусы:
- Главный минус игры - багули. Они достаточно редкие, но могут заставить переигрывать сложные карты вновь и вновь. И закрадываются они в висяках игры, когда ты уже победил на уровне (а сохранение результата идет не после победы, а после выхода на карту, что бред, но да, если ты победил, а потом игра забаговала, твой результат на ноль), Еще есть багуля, что башни стреляют по монстрам, но будто не попадают, насквозь идут выстрелы. Такое тоже редко и не так сильно мешает.
- Мультиплеер есть, а вот онлайна нет. Если нет друганов для игры, то и мультиплеера в игре нет.
- Сломанные достижения. Если любите собирать все ачивки, то готовьтесь смотреть руководства и мудрить, чтобы их собрать. Для некоторых приходилось даже ставить более СТАРУЮ версию игры. Сетевые достижения при мертвом онлайне вообще жопа.
- Корявый перевод. В некоторых местах русский перевод выполнен с ошибками. Например, в паре мест вместо "Атака Льдом" вы увидите "Атака Ядом" или наоборот. Вроде фигня, но когда ты собираешь шмот на атаку ЯДОМ, чтобы качать атаку башен, а потом выясняется, что башня бьет не ЯДОМ, а ЛЬДОМ, и ты зря всрал деньги на шмот, то горит маленько.
- Полная цена. Игра не стоит 710 рублей (на момент написания). Это не серьезно, с учетом багов, ошибок, онлайна, малого контента, отсутствием толком сюжета. Ей бы стоить 300-350 рублей. Берем только по скидке.
- Ну да. Сюжета тут мало даже для галки. Что-то там говорят в начале, что-то там в конце. Тю.

В целом рекомендую, хоть негативные стороны тут более яркие, А рекомендую взять по максимальной скидке и просто ознакомиться с тем, какие бывают TD игрули. Есть шанс, что Вы, как любитель TD, втянетесь и пройдете игру, не смотря на косяки. Я так и поступил.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263754645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 3261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2712, 'last_played': 1694805595}
review:
Összességében ajánlom...

Pár dolog amit jó ha tudsz. Ez egy Tower Defense RPG játék. Viszont a legtöbb esetben az általad irányított karakteré a főszerep. Sajnos elég sok olyan pálya van ahol a tornyid és csapdáid konkrétan semmit sem érnek. Helyenként emiatt túl nehéz... Emiatt pedig inkább idegesítő. Egy vereség után találhatod ki, hogy mit kellene másképpen csinálnod a győzelemért. Az ellenfelek kreatívan vannak megcsinálva, viszont vannak olyan ellenfelek akik csak a karaktereddel győzhetőek le. Sok türelmet igényel. Összességében viszont szórakoztató.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041600295', 'num_games_owned': 4724, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1691985647}
review:
Feels old, because it is. Hasn't aged well. No 4k support, because if you play in 4k the transport squares don't function (can't click them when the map pops up). When you play in borderless windowed mode, clicking off the screen (since the mouse doesn't lock to the screen) minimizes the game and keeps it running, so mobs escape or kill you depending what was happening. 

No mazing/pathing in a TD game. Very restrictive on which towers can be built, in which location. You have to unlock each of maybe 16 tower types, then 4 upgrades on each tower with multiple points. 

For instance, you might have a 20 square long path in an area, where you can build 4 towers. One square #3 you can pick from two ground traps. On square #9 you can choose one of three towers. On square #11 you can pick from three different ground traps. And on square #16 you can choose one of four towers. 

The content feels slow as hell, and if you bump it to double speed, you have to constantly be on your toes for other paths to open to sprint over and help there. Currency (gold, skill points, etc) feel slow and drip-fed also. Spend 30 minutes on a map? Here's 2 skill points and 3 items you going to break down for components. You need 15 components to craft and item and they randomize, so you're going to make each one several times to try to get something usable. And you need (I'm estimating) 200+ skill points to fill out the tower tree.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036581382', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 1195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1195, 'last_played': 1687692562}
review:
Yeah a negative is probably too harsh given you can get this real cheap in either a bundle or on a sale these days but can't say it amazed me, certainly not long term.
It's a strange but interesting mesh of a tower defense and a diablo-like with also alike aesthetics. It's certainly unique but can't say I found its design ideas as positives.
We can set traps only in very specific places and only specific types those spots dictate limiting our options. Outside of the missions we also can put in upgrade points into specific traps narrowing what is worth using even further. Thus the bulk of the killing we will do on our own in an ARPG fashion where we do have abilities, items to equip, stuff to craft but then given we're clearing mindless hordes just charging onward it more feels like sweeping. Perhaps it would feel much better if the progression wasn't so dearly slow. While the max level of a character is 100 getting there will require beating every mission at least 4 times...and this is what the game wants us to do. The campaign wasn't very thrilling and asks for redoing it multiple times over so you can hit some kind of character build at last. Given the grim setting it's shocking there is almost no story in here, our character might say something there and there but it just feels like doing same few levels for arcade vibe with only implied stakes making everything feel shallow and fails to captivate. By the time I dropped this game 3 years ago in 2nd campaign run I was thoroughly bored with the loop and little options as was my level was just 30 and didn't look back until now. Trying to come back to old save is a massive wall of systems that serve little practical purpose in the experience and sense of pointlessness as there was no plot to rekindle either.

Perhaps if the game had some plot to not waste the potential of the setting and level design, allowed more freedom with traps and rebalanced skill/upgrade systems so it takes less points to max something out or simply allow faster levelling then it could become something more engaging and memorable. As it is it's a good impression quickly turning into a meaningless slog.
Maybe it's more fun in coop but game seems rather unpopular. It's also severely completion-unfriendly with online achievements, forever taking milestones and even containing broken ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107612555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2772, 'last_played': 1691477940}
review:
동일 게임회사의 The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing 게임 내에 있는 타워디펜스를 확장한 디펜스 & RPG게임
딱히 재미는 없음

이 게임사의 문제점은 도전과제에 항상 멀티플레이 도전과제가 있다는 것

멀티플레이 하는 사람이 있어야 도전과제를 깰 수 있는데
당연히 멀티플레이를 하는 사람은 없으므로 도전과제는 깰 수 없음

운이 좋아 친구와 멀티플 도전과제를 깼다고 해도

버그로인해 클리어가 불가능한 도전과제도 있음

만약 버그가 없다고 해도
도전과제를 올클하려면 노가다 오브 노가다가 필요한 더러운게임

티어당 약 15개 가량의 맵
티어 1~4
케릭터 3종류

케릭별로 티어4 맵을 클리어하는 도전과제를 깨려면
최소 15 x 3(1~3티어 클리어) x 3(케릭터 3개) = 135개의 맵을 클리어해야함

맵 하나 클리어가 쉽고 빠르냐?
그것도 아님

매 맵마다 타워를 깔고, 맵마다 3~6웨이브 클리어가 있음

시간이 아까운게임

author: {'steamid': '76561198020313592', 'num_games_owned': 986, 'num_reviews': 576, 'playtime_forever': 5243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5243, 'last_played': 1682151977}
review:
[h1]Sum-Up[/h1]
[h3]In-depth analysis further down.[/h3]

[table]
[tr]
[th]🟩 [b]Pros[/b][/th]
[th]🟥 [b]Cons[/b][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]
- Good variety of possible builds to experiment with, and find your favorite playstyle among the three available classes.

- Engaging gameplay that equally mixes ARPG with tower defense, and introduces new content / features regularly to keep interest high.

- Despite the servers shutting down, co-op multiplayer still works via the Steam friend system. There’s no matchmaking with randoms though, so bring a friend - or three.

- Varied and solid challenges in most levels, especially later on, that can be overcome if you find the right strategy, and it’s fun to do so.

- Decent variety of game modes other than the regular campaign, such as custom difficulty Scenarios and the classic Endless (perfect for grinding gear).
[/td]
[td]
- A few specific levels are an unbalanced mess that will force you to either heavy, boring grind or the weirdest cheeses, if you don’t have a 4 player full team.

- PVP modes are completely unavailable due to the official servers being shut down. Some achievements are related to them; achievement hunters will convulse in pain.

- Several traps and skills are gimmicky or useless throughout the whole game: they are just crap, you won’t use them, and have no point in existing.

- In general, solo players and smaller teams will be penalized by a map design that, especially in late-game and higher difficulties, requires multiple combatants fighting in multiple “lanes” to keep the horde at bay.
[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[table]
[tr]
[th]🟨 [b]Bugs & Issues[/b][/th]

[td][b]Content & Replay Value:[/b][/td]
[td]It took me, alongside another player, around 40 hours to complete Deathtrap and gain a Perfect 3-star rating in each level, only possible on Hard difficulty.  After that, for those wanting more, Endless and Scenario modes are available. Even with the presence of multiple classes, most content stays the same, so I don’t see a reason to replay once finished.[/td]

[td][b]Is it worth buying?[/b][/td]
[td]The standard price of 20€ is fair for this amount of content, but i’d suggest getting it only if you have at least one friend to play co-op with, solo isn’t as much fun.[/td]

[td][h3]Verdict: Good[/h3]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2548409603]Rating Chart Here[/url][/td]
[td]An enjoyable mix of tower defense and ARPG, however dragged back by significant design flaws and less-than-stellar balance. It’s still fun… most of the time.[/td]

[quote]Follow our Curator page, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41449676/]Summit Reviews[/url], to see more high-quality reviews regularly.[/quote]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2965485336

[h1]In-Depth[/h1]
[h3]Setting & Writing[/h3]
From the get-go you’ll realize story and lore are Deathtrap’s least concern: playing as an anonymous guardian without any backstory, you’ll be thrown into the Ink (an alternate dimension) to man a series of ancient fortifications and repel the hordes of monsters that threaten to break into the realm of humans. Apart from some basic info to give each level some context, there won’t be any lore-related material or other info to know more about the world - and that’s fine for this genre.

The environments have a dark fantasy style, with the general tone being dark and moody, from the UI to the locales, creatures and pieces of equipment. The gothic influence is evident and suitable for this setting, while the music and color palettes complement it well. Even if its visuals aged with the passing of time, Deathtrap still looks pretty good.

[h3]Exploration & Building[/h3]
The world is divided into 13 main levels, plus six Scenario-only stages. Each of them is entered from a hub-like main map, and of course the previous ones must be completed to unlock the next - this on each of the four tiers (each housing more advanced versions of the same maps). The layout of each level is already revealed and stays the same no matter the tier, however trap placement spots and monster spawns change radically, forcing you to change the strategy each time a new tier is unlocked.

The maps aren’t very large, and have no secrets or other hidden elements to discover. Some of them have neutral foes that you can kill during a wave for an extra reward when the level is beaten - but that means temporarily abandoning your defenses to do so. Speaking of defenses, you’ll have a limited Essence amount at the start of each stage, to build and upgrade your traps as you see fit. More essence is gained as waves are defeated and enemies are killed, so that you can expand the defensive grid more and more. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2965485379

[h3]Combat System & Bosses[/h3]
Your target will be to defend the exit portal(s) in each level, and prevent monsters from going in. To do so you’ll employ a wide range of traps with different elements, strengths against specific enemy types, and unique passive properties you may unlock and upgrade as the level goes on. You’ll know in advance how the next enemy wave is composed, and also their fixed paths on the field: planning ahead the right tower types, and managing your resources wisely, while supporting your towers with your class’ numerous active and passive skills, will be the keys to success.

In general this is a TD where you’ll have to actively support your defenses by fighting alongside them, but beware; your death will detract one life point from the portal and take away the “Perfect” rating, which is the only way to obtain the maximum amount of skill and tower upgrade points at the end of a level. The ARPG-style combat features a unique type of “mana” for each class and a unique way to gain it, alongside many offensive and utility skills, specialization in different trap categories and unique traits that suit specific roles in the field (tank, dps, etc.). 

Bosses are especially strong and lethal enemies that sport multiple unique traits, usually have an entourage of support minions, and may have map-wide cancerous skills; for instance, making all traps stuck for several seconds, or spawning additional enemy portals while the wave is already ongoing. Later on, maps may have several of them at the same time, alongside Champions, mini-bosses that are more common but of course less powerful than their bigger cousins.

[h3]Character Progression & Crafting[/h3]
At the end of each level, depending on your performance and selected difficulty, you’ll get one or more chests containing random items and gold, to equip your character with, divided in rarity levels (Uncommon, Epic, etc. up to Godlike). Performing additional tasks like killing neutral mobs or clearing the optional Challenge of the level will award not only more goodies, but also extra upgrade points that will be vital to make your characters and traps stronger.

Between each mission you’ll be able to browse the trader, often refreshed with weapons, armor and runes (trinkets) to equip your hero with. Sell and buy, or if you prefer craft your own gear using the blueprints found as loot, alongside the materials obtained from chests and dismantling unwanted equipment. You may re-spec your characters to try out new builds, but the cost is very high until at least mid-game, so think wisely before spending points recklessly, or you may get stuck with a botched build.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2965485398

author: {'steamid': '76561198032589399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 269, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1561813054}
review:
"Deathtrap" - це гра в жанрі Action-RPG з елементами Tower Defense, розроблена компанією NeocoreGames і випущена у 2015 році. У грі ви граєте за ловця монстрів, який знаходиться в особливому світі, де має боротися з ворожими силами, що застосовують різні стратегії та тактики.

Одним з найбільш цікавих аспектів гри є комбінування бойової системи Action-RPG з елементами Tower Defense, де ви можете ставити в різних точках різні бар'єри, щоб зупинити наступ ворогів. Гра також має досить великий вибір зброї та навичок, які ви можете вдосконалювати, щоб бути більш ефективним в бою.

Гра має також гарну графіку та звуковий дизайн, що додає до загального настрою гри. Однак, деякі гравці відзначають, що гра може бути досить складною в тих місцях, де потрібно використовувати стратегії, щоб перемогти сильних ворогів.

Загалом, "Deathtrap" - це цікава гра, яка поєднує у собі два жанри та має цікаву геймплейну механіку, що робить її цікавою для гравців, які люблять Action-RPG та Tower Defense ігри.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006784111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1582937856}
review:
As a role-playing hero, flattening hordes of monsters and letting the rest run into our masterfully constructed tower defense - Deathtrap takes the entertaining defensive interludes from The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing and knits an entire game out of them.
You don't have to have played Van Helsing to have fun with Deathtrap, though. It takes place in the same scenario, but there are no story references. Especially because Deathtrap does without any plot after the short intro anyway. Monsters want to push out of a parallel world into reality, we have to keep them away from a portal, and that's it.
It's actually a pity, the charming main characters were one of Van Helsing's strengths - in Deathtrap, on the other hand, we control uninspired standard grimaces. But in terms of gameplay, the mixture of trap building and "hack & slay" fights has lost none of its appeal: As a warrior, marksman or sorceress, we lard our labyrinth with death traps and jump into the breach ourselves when the enemy threatens to break through to the portal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201246082', 'num_games_owned': 3232, 'num_reviews': 1499, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1666993938}
review:
"Deathtrap", Neocore Games tarafından geliştirilen bir kule savunma oyunudur. Oyuncular, farklı düşman türlerine karşı savunma kuleleri inşa ederek ve farklı tuzaklar kurarak kalelerini savunurlar.

Oyun, üçüncü şahıs görünümüne sahip bir karakterle oynanır. Oyuncular, farklı görevlerde ve hikaye modunda oynayabilirler. Oyuncuların görevi, düşmanları durdurmak ve kalelerini savunmak için tuzaklar ve savunma kuleleri kullanmaktır.

Oyuncular, farklı savunma kuleleri ve tuzaklar arasından seçim yapabilirler. Savunma kuleleri, ok atıcılar, topçular, buz taretleri ve lazer taretleri gibi çeşitli tiplerde gelir. Tuzaklar ise, patlayıcı tuzaklar, buz tuzakları ve zehir tuzakları gibi çeşitli tiplerde olabilir. Oyuncular, kuleleri ve tuzakları yerleştirmek ve yükseltmek için kaynaklar kazanırlar.

Oyuncuların, birçok farklı düşman türüne karşı mücadele etmeleri gerekir. Düşmanlar, canavarlar, askerler, büyücüler ve devler gibi çeşitli tiplerde gelir. Bazı düşmanlar, sadece güçlü saldırılarla yenilebilirken, diğerleri sadece belirli tuzaklarla durdurulabilir.

Oyun ayrıca çok oyunculu modlar sunar. Oyuncular, diğer oyuncularla işbirliği yaparak veya karşı karşıya gelerek oynayabilirler.

Grafikleri ve tasarımı, fantastik bir dünyada geçen oyuna uygun olarak oldukça iyi yapılmıştır. Oyunun müzikleri de atmosferi güçlendirir.

Genel olarak, "Deathtrap", kule savunma oyunlarını seven oyuncular için oldukça ilgi çekici bir seçenek olabilir. Çeşitli savunma kuleleri ve tuzaklar, farklı düşman tipleri ve çoklu oyuncu modları oyunu tekrar oynanabilir hale getirir. Ancak, oyunun hikaye modu ve görevlerde tekrarlama hissi oluşabilir ve bazı oyuncular, oynanışın yavaş tempolu olduğunu düşünebilir.

review: Рекомендую, но с натяжкой. Последний этап игры, начиная с миссии где доступны только большие пушки, и до финальной миссии, полный отстой. Видимо разрабы думали что люди будут фармить неделю что бы пройти этот этап игры, но, видимо, забыли что игра не настолько интересная. Да и баланс хромает на обе ноги, половина способностей и ловушек совершенно бесполезны. Играть лучше с друзьями, одному будет скучновато.

author: {'steamid': '76561198335146272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1673197485}
review:
别看是15年的老游戏，好玩的捏，塔防+角色扮演，英雄可以升级，学技能，配装备，地图也有探索和收集要素，比普通的塔防游戏自由度大很多，音乐和画面都不错。
这个游戏可能默认使用集成显卡，进去发现画面卡顿的朋友可以调整下NVIDIA设置，将游戏添加入高性能显卡支持就好了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198215884115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 3777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1758, 'last_played': 1707078709}
review:
Well ye. Im done with this very nice piece of steampunk. U feel the climate of the Van Helsing series game but in fact Im done on the Tier 3 list on 4th map I can't imagine myself trying to fcking earn that 3 stars. Apart from that I have earned 3 stars on every map so far. The tiers have the diffrent way of planning those traps. The traps are amazing but u need to clearly damage the whole mobs by yourself. It's not the game I want to call set the traps and wait till the end doing a few hits on your own. No it's like hns and a tower defense in one game it's nice it really feels like the original Van Helsing tower defence etaps but it's really harder to be honest. I gave this game a try I don't regret it but the requirements of being a sweat and don't let anyone get in the gate makes this game sooo fcking hard right now with those fcking gargoyles. So Im done. I was lvl 38 Sorcesser I do like it-her :) Her attacks very nice the upgrade's are sooo awesome like in VH series and ye. 

  All I can say just give it a try U'll love it after a 4th map cuz u realize your character will be stronger more powerfull so the game will be harder and it's a very great balanced game I do really recommend this one.
Fcking love it ! <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198022485158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 6940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6652, 'last_played': 1674420934}
review: Горен соглашается на участие в некоем эксперименте и вскоре приходит в себя в почти пустой комнате уровня 48, где имеются большие прямоугольные отверстия в полу и потолке. На каждом уровне находятся два человека, а сколько всего уровней — неизвестно. Этажи связывает общий колодец, по которому раз в день опускается платформа с едой, и чем ниже находятся люди, тем меньше у них шансов поесть. Каждый месяц происходит рокировка, и обитатели верхних уровней могут оказаться в самом низу, и наоборот. Поскольку разрешалось взять с собой один предмет, Горен выбрал томик «Дон Кихота», а его сосед прихватил большой самозатачивающийся нож.

review: Man, I really WANT to love this game. It does everything right in terms of tower defense but when the wave ends and a screen pops up telling me I accrued 450 essence then the screen drops but I REALLY only have 178? How is a glitch this game breaking allowed to remain in the game? Its almost embarrassing. Thumbs down for laziness and incompetence.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065545417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 7674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7654, 'last_played': 1667938533}
review: **** (of 5) This is not a pure tower defense game since you cannot win the szenarios by just relying on your traps. You also need to level up your character and decide for his/her skills. Maximum experience points and Trap enhancement points make you decide on what to focus. You cannot have everything which is an interesting challenge of decision. Nevertheless the game is wrung out, once you have managed all the levels - at least I wasn't tempted to do it again with another character (played with sorceress). That would be too much grindig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091933104', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1670050295}
review:
這款遊戲作為偶而開起來殺殺殺放鬆還是不錯的，深入了解卻存在一些問題，不然你看很多給好評的評論是不是遊戲時數普遍都不高?

角色平衡有問題，弓箭手非常的弱勢，需要停止攻擊2秒進入隱身狀態才能補充魔力，而普功輸出也很癢。
遊戲優化有問題，GPU使用率60%~70%，FPS卻經常不穩定。

大概是這兩個問題讓我決定以負評作為評價，我還是很喜歡范海星的。

author: {'steamid': '76561199171695222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2415, 'last_played': 1666949688}
review:
Based on The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing Franchise of games, those having played these can look forward to an expanded version of the Tower Defence Mini Game. If you into Action RPG Character Progression (which fundamentally effects games play), as well as comprehensive Tower Defence (including upgrade/buff progression), then this is a must play. The game also has a sizeable map pool - I am 40.3 hours in and no map has yet become boring. The music is good, especially the Battle Symphony, though it would be nice to have included a few more tracks.

The game is not without its flaws - Some redundant/broken menu options (I use Controller), but none of these are game breaking in anyway. More a case of quality of life effecting, but simple work arounds exist. I did have 2 game ending crashes (screen freezes, while game runs in the background - PC restart was required), but 2 crashes in 40+ hours of game play is really not a big deal in my books.

Note to the Developers: A similar game with next gen graphics and refined games systems (including more Hero Based content), set in the Warhammer 40K Universe would do well I am sure ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027491283', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 5879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3962, 'last_played': 1672666394}
review:
[h1] NOT BAD, NOT AWESOME EITHER [/h1]

[b]Disclaimer:[/b] This is my first proper tower defense game I played, so can't compare to other titles. But I had fun with it. 

Neocore had a really good idea of mixing ARPG with Tower Defense. I guess mostly because they already had assets ready. Sadly, they did not go through with it all the way.

You have 3 classes of heroes to choose from (melee fighter, ranged marksman or sorceress), about 20 towers/traps and 13 levels, each with 4 difficulties while each adds a little twist to the same old map, to keep it fresh. I tried mercenary first but found one level impossible to beat. So I picked up sorceress with global damage spell and game was ez pez from there.

You level up your traps and characters ARPG style which is very nice, and if you need some extra levels, you have scenario or endless modes for that. You can increase different difficulty stats for better EXP gain, more gold or better item drops which is fantastic.

Where the game falls short is the stuff that devs clearly ran out of time or money for. Shop in this game is absolutely useless and never sells anything useful. Item drops are poor and so random it is hard to find good gear piece. You also have crafting here, but it is very basic, also heavily RNG oriented and worst part is that you can drop schematics for crafting that you already have - or which are for different class!

Enemy variety is kinda small, but at least you can quickly pick up what unit it is and what kind of trap will counter it.

Overall I sank 66 hours into it so it clearly did a lot of things right. If you ever see it on sale and like tower defense games, I would recommend grabbing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198446994166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3506, 'last_played': 1653163586}
review:
I guess this is one of the best tower defence games I have played. It has certain charm to it. Nice graphics and FXs. (minding it's from 2015)
-Tech tree is big, BUT it feels like eveything is narrowing to certain types of towers to eficiently solve the level. Experimenting with other types will probably feel like playing on a harder difficulty.  
-Heroes feels unballenced. Though I have max lvled everyone of them, Sorceress is easier by a mile. But still I enjoyed everyone of them. 
-Level difficulty is scaling well. If you can't solve the level, consider to look for a hero build as it may drastically help.
Overall, a great game. Too bad it got ditched by devs. New levels or heroes would have been nice.
My personal grade is 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198126564849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 618, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1657688106}
review:
Видеообзор https://youtu.be/oK_ehav5uNE
Графика, спецэффекты, и оптимизация нормальная Эта игра вида защита башни с элементами РПГ, да мы строим башни ловушки, правда не там где хотим а там где только задумано игрой, да на карте есть уже башни и ловушки атаковать они не могут пока мы их не улучшим, также у нас есть персонаж которым мы можем свободно перемешаться по карте и атаковать мобов, пр том персонажу можно прокачивать скилы и экипировать, да это помесь обычной РПГ с защитой башни, вполне интересно и неплохо сделана сейчас некоторые игры вида защиты башни пробовали сделать нечто подобное но ни чего у них правда не вышло

author: {'steamid': '76561198094821039', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1655791406}
review:
This one just didn't do it for me, for some reason.Maybe the multiplayer experience is better, I only ran single player for about 7 and a half hours and it just did not captivate me for some reason. It looked like it would be a fairly fun TD experience, with a unique spin of RPG elements, but I just found myself getting bored quickly and falling asleep at the keyboard. Not my cup of tea. There are many positive reviews from others, but I wasn't super impressed with the overall quality or experience of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085891656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 459, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1651754990}
review:
[h1] А сейчас я расскажу вам сказку... [/h1]

Deathtrap - диаблоподобная башенная защита во вселенной Van Helsing.

На сюжете останавливаться не будем, так как он скучный, поговорим о геймплее.

Самое интересное, что может предложить игра - это РПГ-составляющая. Мы выбираем себе персонажа, прокачиваем его, одеваем, крафтим шмот и оружие и убиваем монстров. На выбор есть волшебница, оперирующая магией, но дохлая в плане здоровья и защиты, наёмник, являющийся, по сути, жирным танком, и стрелок с арбалетом.

Всего у нас тринадцать карт, и для каждой предусмотрены четыре уровня сложности. Строим ловушки, обороняем портал от гадких тварей. На одни только ловушки рассчитывать не стоит, поэтому нашему герою придётся принимать в боях самое активное участие.

Мне сразу же пришло в голову сравнение с Orcs Must Die, но Deathtrap подаётся на серьёзных щах, тогда как уничтожение орков проходит весело и непринуждённо. А теперь давайте поговорим о том, что, на мой взгляд, не даёт обозреваемой игре стать прям вот идеальной башенной защитой, способной затянуть на многие десятки часов.

Во-первых, скука. Тринадцать карт - это не так много, на самом деле, но каждую придётся проходить по четыре раза, если хочется получить идеальную игру. А разница - только в "толщине" монстров. Прут одни и те же твари, надоевшие до зубовного скрежета, но убить их сложнее в силу большего количества здоровья.

Во-вторых, ловушки. Их можно ставить только в тех местах, которые отвели для этого разработчики, и мне неоднократно приходилось жалеть, что нельзя поставить пушечку "вот прям здесь", чтобы перекрыть большую площадь. В какой-то момент ловушки, хоть их и можно прокачивать, просто перестают справляться со своими задачами: уровень мобов растёт быстрее, чем наши защитные сооружения. Внимание, вопрос: а не проще ли  было просто отрядить героя мочить тварей? Да и сущности, валюты, за которую строятся и улучшаются ловушки, всегда не хватает.

В-третьих, давайте посмотрим на достижения. "Убейте xуиллиард монстров", "Прокачайте своего героя до уровня 100", "Заработайте xyиллион монет", "Получите три звезды на каждой карте на четвёртом уровне сложности" и так далее. Раз за разом перепроходить одни и те же карты, чтобы наконец-то получить ачивку? Не, извините, я найду, куда потратить сотню часов жизни. Нас пытаются искусственно удерживать у монитора, причём не за счёт чего-то офигительно интересного, а просто ради "поповысиживательных" достижений.

В-четвёртых, сервера умерли. Давно и окончательно. Так что единственный выход - кооператив. В нём интересно. Наверное.

Картинка такая мрачненькая, музыка и звуки нормальные.

[b] Подведём небольшой итог.

Deathtrap - неплохая 3D башенная защита с РПГ-составляющей, тремя разными героями, прокачкой, крафтом, однообразными монстрами и картами и кучей ачивок, для получения которых придётся до-о-лго сидеть за монитором. Orcs Must Die, на мой взгляд, куда как круче.

Тем не менее фанатам жанра игру порекомендую.

Спасибо за внимание. [/b] 

[b] Ещё больше обзоров [/b] >>[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42209702/][b] здеся [/b][/url]<<

review:
For what it is and what it's trying to do, this is a pretty good game, not easy, not hard.  I'd say it's average with decent graphix for it's time.

For those who are upset about the mechanix or item drops, item quality, etc.  You can use notepad to edit the files that control the rng.  Including the ranges and chances.  Just don't go way OP or the game dies.  The fact that you can basically mod this game yourself by editing the files makes this worth full price.  If you aren't comfortable looking for the files to edit, or aren't sure which ones... easy answer, try open with notepad.. you get nongibberish, it's editable, gibberish.. nope.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052348106', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1658005505}
review:
Some backstory.

The ARPG known as "The incredible adventures of Van Helsing" that the devs made prior to this had some segments that combined elements of a horde mode and a tower defence game. It was easily the best part of said game and definitely deserved a spinoff based around it. And as you might imagine, Deathtrap is that spinoff. 

The game itself is set in the same universe as the other game though exactly how they are connected is unclear. And If anything it fells like said decision was made as an excuse to reuse art assets from said game (don't think there is a single original element to this in fact). But in the end it doesn't really matter as there isn't much story in it anyway. You're simple one of the three selectable character classes that's stuck in the "ink". A sort of buffer zone between the underworld and the real world that was once the center of a series of battles between demons and the forces of good. And guess who picked this exact time go for round two? Yep its you verses the entire army of hell!  

You do have some help though in the form of a series of defence networks left behind from the last war. And that's where the game itself starts as like the segments from TIAOVH, it exists on two fronts. A horde based ARPG where you face the enemies directly and a tower defence game that supports the former utilising the after mentioned defence networks. When you pick a level you get presented with an arena and the path enemies will take through it, and its up to you to decide how you will plan your defence utilising fixed trap positions. Each one costing "essence" to activate which you get more of from slaying enemies. Once the wave (each level consists of between 3 and 6 and you get to reset your traps between each) starts monsters will come from the directions indicated on the map and will either get killed by the traps you set or by you attacking them directly with your character and his skills. 

Once the level is finished you will get ranked based on your performance and get an appropriate reward chest with loot and XP that you can use to upgrade your  character with, sell or break down to crafting materials. Standard ARPG stuff. What isn't standard though is that instead of just getting upgrade points for your character you will also get upgrade points for your traps. Allowing you to customise their effects in exchange for a higher essence cost for deployment.  You can also unlock new traps all together by completing objectives. 

Graphics are as mentioned the same as TIAOVH with an art style that can only be described as "Transylvanian". Utilising a blend of Slavic, Hungarian, Romanian and German aesthetics which does give it a very unique flair. Sound on the other hand is nothing to write home about with music that while appropriately "epic", will get tiring after a while due to lack of variety. Same with the voice acting as your character only has a handfull of lines that s/he keeps repeating during combat.

In terms of criticism that i could lob at the game; i have to admit that it could have explained its own mechanics better. Enemies for example come in three types (Armored, Horde and Giant) and traps are only really effective against certain types. But exactly how effective can only be determined trough trial and error and expect a lot of retries as its impossible to tell what you need before each wave. Traps also feel unbalanced with some being straight up worthless (looking at you, lightning tower) while others such as the Archers summon are OP as hell. Meaning that if you decided to sink upgrade points into one of the former its some you will never get back. The game can also get very samey after a while so i definitely recommend that you play it as co-op with a friend or two as that's when it really shines. Really missing a couch co-op mode though as its online or nothing.

Would i recommend Deathtrap in the end though? Yea i think so. There is definitely some good time wasting to be done here especially together with some friends. Just don't expect a deep story or anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046044714', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 3091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1773, 'last_played': 1652911437}
review:
This game is from an alternative universe where Diablo 3 is a tower defense / arpg hybrid with grim dark graphics.

There are 13 campaign maps which can be played in 4 tiers (similiar to difficulties in diablo). But on each tier each map gets a new twist, which makes this basically 52 different maps. After 22 hours I'm in the middle of tier 2 maps and started realizing how massive the content is. 

Each map can also be played in scenario mode, and there are ~5 scenario-only maps. In that mode you can crank up 9 different difficulty modifiers from level 0 to 3, for increased risks and rewards. A map editor and Steam Workshop support is also included.

There are 3 different characters to choose from (Warrior, Rogue and Wizard). You can level up skills and passives on your character as well as your traps. None of the systems is super deep, but you will have to make choices as you level up, if you don't want to get stuck on the easiest difficulty level. Respec is always possible but costs a significant gold fee per point.

At the end of maps you get some chests which drop gold and loot. The loot is typical arpg stuff with rarities and the usual modifiers (hp, armor, resistances, lifesteal, physical damage, elemental damage, damage on enemies with certain status effects, crit chance, crit damage, magic find, gold find, etc.)

I beat the first tier of maps some years ago in around 7 hours playtime and thought I was done, but I'm glad I picked this up again to realize this was only the tutorial

9/10 game, -1 for lack of more classes and a bigger skilltree, but it is seriously underrated

author: {'steamid': '76561197993183561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1660411243}
review:
리뷰쓰다가 삭제되어서 귀찮아서 간단요약 함

단점
- 도전과제를 마무리할 수 없음 (도전과제 절반정도가 멀티플레이어: 멀티하는 사람이 없음)
- 단순한 맵디자인 (12개? 13개였던가? 의 맵이 끝)
- 지루한 아이템 파밍 (아이템 빌드 같은게 크게 존재하지 않는다.)
- 지루한 반복적인 퀘스트 (12개 정도의 맵을 5~6번 정도 반복해야 한다. 그렇다고 크게 성취감이 있진 않다.)

장점
- 세일할때 사면 싸다.
- 트레이너 써서 깨면 하루정도 심심풀이 게임 가능하다.


결론
- 시간낭비 일듯
- 정말 할게임 없고, 스팀에서 90% 세일하면 사서 하루정도 시간때우기용...
- 요즘은 게임이 쏟아지기 때문에 굳이 이 게임 할 필요는 없을듯..

아래는 이전에 썼던 리뷰..

-----------------------

디아블로 형태의 게임성에 디팬스 요소가 추가되었다고 보면 됨

반복적인 맵을 클리어하고 레벨을 올리고 아이템을 파밍하고
스킬트리 올리고...

하다보니 살짝 지루한 감이 있어서
트레이너로 앤딩볼까 생각이 살짝듭니다.

아주 재미있지는 않은데 킬링타임용은 괜찮은 정도..

review:
NO
Do not.
Look Neocore games should legally not be allowed to make games
I thought 40k Martyr was just a fluke. ARPGs are generially shit... maybe..... since it was old.. this would be good
Something about surviving a puzzle

Its tower defense...
And i thought "Oh wow tower defense.. Can't go wrong"
HOW THE FUCK DO YOU GO WRONG IN MAKING A TOWER DEFENSE

I don't know how to explain it since none agrees EVER
but

Basically. Animations.

It doesn't feel like you are fighting it feels like a really really bad animation asset. One you sell to bad mobile devs with shit mobile targets. Who can't handle 2 fps.

Slow.. 
pointless.

the sound bugs out when fighting.. and i tried all the classes.

If this wasn't tower defense. i would still be wondering "What's the point" and "nono it will get better later"
FUCK NO.

It lacks the very soul of a game.
Pushing the button isn't fun. nor do they tell you when is it actually fun.

And its in all their games.
Their animation disgusts me. Like seeing a particularly bad turd in the gutter and imagining touching it.
It feels like small disgusting insects are crawling all over me

author: {'steamid': '76561198137810777', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1648382087}
review:
I have a mixed feeling about this game, probably because I already played the better game (X-Morph: Defense, for anyone curious). But if I have to choose between yes and no, I choose no.

My main complaint is that you can only put it in a fixed place. This makes the game feels like more a puzzle than expressing yourself. And I personally do not like puzzle-like games where you only have fixed choices.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979985577', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 5837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2598, 'last_played': 1703493787}
review:
Deathtrap

Van Helsing movie mixed in a Orcs Must Die Tower defense game



Pros -

#1.3 characters to pick from

The all are very different so try them all 

#2.Many traps 

#3.Multiple difficulty levels

#4.Cooperative


Cons -

#1.It is very GRINDY

You have to replay levels you already beat to get the money and experience 

#2.You need a computer and monitor that is newer than 2015 and the higher end the better

I had to get a new monitor and update my graph card or drivers to get it to run properly and before I did that it would crash.

#3.Some levels are designed for cooperative and will not be that fun solo unless you character is so OP or the difficulty is set low enough

#4.There is no barricade type trap to force them to change paths/direction so that is unique for a TD game

#5.There is limits on what type of traps and where you can use them 



The Bottom Line -


Deathtrap is an ok TD game.I would give it a 6.5 or 7 out of 10.I would say it is worth about $5.


If you like Deathtrap I recommend


https://store.steampowered.com/app/201790/Orcs_Must_Die_2/

author: {'steamid': '76561198056627958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1001, 'last_played': 1673504840}
review:
Another case of Steam needing a "maybe" thumb.

The game is a tower defense game that employ's an interesting mesh of TD and top down dungeon crawling play style. The towers/traps themselves are fun in concept and in most executions, The levels are simple in design and graphics. The gameplay is interesting and fun on the easy and normal difficulty's, and the UI is simple enough to get the basics down though mastery will take awhile. 

I found the campaign to be entertaining and the character combat to be fun...ish, The "Traps" are kinda simplistic and get a little repetitive after a while. I was not expecting much having gotten it for 90% off and I was suprised at the amount of idea's and content here, even if it is a little bare bones and unpolished.



Now the bad:
The difficulty spike in going from normal to hard on the campaign isn't bad but the spikes going from campaign to any of the other play modes is absolutely insane. Part of this is due to an actual difficulty increase and another part is due to the utter LACK of resources needed to build and build up your traps, and if your traps aren't good enough, AND plentiful enough you will lose because your character is absolutely a wet paper bag in a hurricane. ALSO the rewards given for completeling levels/campaign etc are EXTREMELY low, you will find yourself choosing between EITHER leveling all traps sorta equally OR maxing a FEW towers.

The above being said the play-modes OTHER then campaign levels are NOT intended for anything less then a MAXED character and trap set, not sure how you get there without playing those levels but yeah. The "Character creation" is you selecting wizard, knight, or archer... but that's it, you cant change anything about your character not even the color.

This last point is more a pet peeve of mine then a real negative. The control style annoys the ever living hell out of me! even changing the key binds for movement my mouse will still move the Character unless I hold shift and that's just really annoying. I'm trying to kill something and suddenly my character is running into a group of enemies and dying. I HATE clicked based moving in anything other then a Myst style game. ALSO the freaking cursor is the size of a ant...seriously I've lost COUNTLESS lightening strikes due to this damn thing and the movement style. If you're going to make a TINY golden arrow that looks steampunkish then it should go with out saying that half the textures used in half the levels SHOULD NOT be the same color/texture, especially when you've no auto-lock, or aim assistance at ALL and it is critical to aim your shots! losing a perfect round at the last second because I lost the cursor against the same colored level texture really SHOULDN'T have been a thing...that's what beta testing is for.

In conclusion, this game is fun but it needs to be re-balanced and optimized, there's no reason for graphics this basic my 2070 super should be maxing out at a resolution of 2160 x  1440. Also you may want to increase the rewards for the levels as you can't even fill a map with basic towers on what you make from the waves, meaning there is no way to diversify game play because there is only ONE strategy that works.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108897024', 'num_games_owned': 777, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 2064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1970, 'last_played': 1641209453}
review:
Kule savunma oyunu ancak biraz farklı, kontrol ettiğiniz karakterinizle de saldırabiliyorsunuz gelen düşmanlara (Orcs must die gibi). Önceden belirlenmiş yerlere tuzaklarınızı kuruyorsunuz seviye sırasında kazandığınız mavi puanla. 

 Tuzaklar da iki çeşit bi yere koyduklarınız var bi de kule olarak. Bunlar da fiziksel ve büyüsel olarak ayrılıyor. Bir de summoning yapan yer tuzakları var. Her seviye sonu tuzaklar için ayrı sizin için ayrı skill puanı kazanıyorsunuz. Kendi skill puanınızla pasif hasar, direnç, gold vb. Şeyler ya da aktif yetenekler açabiliyorsunuz. Tuzakları da geliştiriyorsunuz ya da level sırasında satın alabileceğiniz güçlendirmeleri açıyorsunuz. Toplam 25 tuzak var bu arada.

 Her level sonu başarınıza göre gold ve item düşüyor. Kask, kemer, silah, yüzük vb. Hepsinin nadirlik seviyesine göre 1 veya 1den fazla özelliği var. Levelinize göre de değişiyor tabi düşen itemler. Marketten altınla da alabiliyorsunuz eşya. Market mantığı da şöyle: saat başı değişen random eşyaları olan bir dükkan. Ya da craftingden craftlayabilirsiniz istediğiniz şeyin şemasını bulduysanız. Oyun sonu düşebiliyor ya da dükkanda satılabiliyor.

 Karakterde de 3 class var: Savaşçı, okçu, büyücü. Her birinin kendine özgü skill ağacı var. İtemleri farklı, oynanışları da bayağı farklı.

 Düşman tipleri de bayağı var. Tipden ziyade türlerine göre strateji yapıyorsunuz. Örneğin az sayıda ama zırhlı yavaş yaratık gelebilir. Ya da zırhsız yavaş ama hayvan gibi canı olan yaratık. Ya da çok sayıda hızlı az canlı yaratık. Ayriyetten hasar türleri de farklı: fiziksel, zehir, ateş vs. Eşyalarınızın her bir hasar türüne karşı sağladığı hasar direnci de var. Her tuzağın üstünde de yazdığı üzere bazı türlere avantajı bazılarına dezavantajı var. Menüde ansiklopedi tarzında bir şeyi var orada karşılaştığınız yaratıkları inceleyebiliyorsunuz hoş olmuş.

 Seviye mantığı da şöyle ki pek fazla level yok yani 10 15 tane falan ama her seviyenin 4 aşaması var. İlk aşamaları bitirince sıra sıra 2. aşamaları bitiriyorsunuz. Güzel yanı aşamalar arasında level dizaynı, değişken bonus objektifi ve yaratık türleri farkı var yani aynı levelin daha zor hali değil.

 Endgame içeriğine ulaşmak istiyorsanız aşamaları bitirmeniz lazım. Ben daha 3. aşamadayım ama hala ulaşamadım son seviye setlere.

 Yani kısacası kule savunma+rpg olup da rpg kısmı başarılı bir şekilde yedirilmiş nadir oyunlardan. Eski ama kendine has bir grafik tarzı ve ufak bir evreni olan unutulmuş bir gem.Gem diyorum e çünkü 31tl fiyat çekmiş yapımcı. İndirimde şu an 3 lira 10 kuruş. Hani şah eser olmasa da bu tarz seven insanların 10-40 saatini harcayacağı bir oyun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054915862', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 1266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1640655710}
review:
If you liked the TD minigame in the Van Helsing games get this. It's more of the same and upgraded.

Very nice TD game, gets ARPG elements, your hero does matter, you can kite enemies, lure them intro other traps, tank them, etc. You upgrade your character, gear, get different abilities, etc. 
It's a little slow to start, but once you get more traps and more gear it gets better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178644945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2465, 'last_played': 1638206566}
review: If Grim Dawn and Kingdom Rush had a child, that would be it. A solid 20-40 hours of fun. Basically this is a tower defense game in which you also get to aid the towers success with your main character who can be one of three classes - ranger/warrior/mage. There are a lot of towers to unlock and upgrade and each character class comes with a lot of unique skills as well. That being said, if you are looking for a game with a great plot behind it, that's not it. This game is 0.5% story and 99.5% action and that's how it was intended in my opinion. All in all I had a lot of fun with this game and I would heartily recommend it to anybody who is looking for a fun tower defense game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085917627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1261, 'last_played': 1635980303}
review:
Well, I wouldn't say it's an action RPG (if we count using a character as an RPG, then ok, let it be) but so far - this is my favourite tower defense. Way more entertaining than Orcs Must Die II, if I'm honest. It has high replayability, makes you work to unlock more traps, and is set in Van Helsing's world; what's not to love. 

Oh, and it still looks good in 2021. It aged very well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111335346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4105, 'last_played': 1632844605}
review:
I really enjoy this game!

At the beginning I was disappointed, because its not like Orcs Must Die (1-3) which are my favourite tower defense games. But just because the gameplay is different, doesn't mean that the game is bad or no fun.

After a short period of getting used to the fact, that traps can only be placed on specific locations and that they have to be upgraded, first with XP and then during or in between the waves, I was hooked.

I really like the gameplay and the mechanics. There are not that many different levels (13, I think), but since there are several difficulties per level and in each the spawn locations for traps and the type of traps available are different, there is lots of fun to be had.

The character also earns XP and gets quite powerful in mid and end game, but the traps still are important, especially if there are different routes and exit points for the spawns.

If you like tower defense / action rpg games, give this one a try. And keep an open mind and don't be annoyed if it feels very diffent than Orcs Must Die, like I was in the beginning. But I am really glad that I gave it another try and I had over 60 hours of fun so far and just have finished all the levels on hardest difficulty with full rating. At least with the melee char, two others to go..! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198029904609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1625260698}
review:
This is really more of a thumbs-medium.

Deathtrap is a feature-length adaptation of the tower defense minigame from Van Helsing. Van Helsing is quite good, and very worth checking out if you like casual arpgs, but it's not built to play a tower defense in, and right from the start you can feel the limitations of the engine in Deathtrap.

Controls are a bit cumbersome. Items spawn on the map. Side objectives are limited by what is already possible in Van Helsing.

None of these things make the game objectively bad, but they wouldn't be there if Deathtrap had been built ground up as a tower defense.

On the plus side, saving a bunch of time and effort by recycling the engine should mean Deathtrap is crammed with content, but unfortunately it's not.

Design-wise, there are three classes with complex skill sets that feel good to play. Enemies are recycled from Van Helsing, and have mostly the same qualities, but there's an okay variety of them. There's no "puzzle" enemies in the campaign that need to be solved with a particular damage type, but different enemy categories have different vulnerabilities and each mission has multiple levels of difficulty that it can be replayed at once you clear the campaign.

However, the campaign is only thirteen missions. It fits on a single small map. My playtime is reflective of leaving the program running, not a standard playthrough of the game. The game itself is shorter.

If this isn't a barrier for you, if you just want a timekill that scales up in difficulty, Deathtrap is probably going to be a fine game. It's decently fun, the little bit of writing that there is is solid, and I didn't run into any game-breaking bugs or massive UI frustrations.

However, if you want a TD with some meat on its campaign, this isn't that. Defender's Quest or Gemcraft might be your bag instead.

review:
The game itself worth the play, perfect combination of tower defense and RPG elements, well-designed!
However, there are a few game issues exist, for example, game crash on start-up,  crash in some specific action in-game, achievements bug, system error... all can be solved if you know how to google.
Overall, recommended!

這款遊戲值得購買遊玩，遊戲完美結合塔防以及類暗黑的RPG要素，值得花費時間體驗。
但，遊戲本身存在一些問題，例如：啟動遊戲就閃退、遊戲中做到特定動作閃退、成就卡住無法解鎖...等等的，但只要你會估狗，就我目前觀察到的問題都有辦法完美解決，難度不大。
總體來說，我推薦大家購買！
