author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 3489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3453, 'last_played': 1608862646}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Topview Tower defense game.


[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

[b]Video Settings information.[/b]

[list]
    [*]There are many resolution sizes available.
    [*]You can play fullscreen, windowed mode or borderless windowed.
    [*]There is a Brightness slidebar available. 0-100
    [*]There is a Contrast  slidebar available. 0-100
    [*]There is a Gamma slidebar available. 0-100
    [*]There is a Saturation slidebar available. 0-100
    [*]There is advanced settings, Which includes graphical detail, V-sync, Shadows and many more.
[/list]

[b]Volume Settings Information.[/b]

[list]
    [*]There is a Master volume slidebar available. 0-100
    [*]There is a Music volume slidebar available. 0-100
    [*]There is a Sound Effect volume slidebar available. 0-100
    [*]There is a Battle sounds and a terrain sounds volume slidebar available. 0-100
    [*]There is a Speech volume slidebar available. 0-100
[/list]

[b]Miscellaneous Information.[/b]


[list]
    [*]You can play this game with a controller.
    [*]The game has many different languages available.
    [*]You are able to change and customize the key buttons on your keyboard.
    [*]You are able to make a pick a character. There is a Mage, Archer and melee fighter available.
    [*]You can play the game single player, Co-op and Versus mode. Only Online available.
[/list]

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

This is a very interesting tower-Defense game. Not only you can place traps but you are able to play with your character too. It's not like "ORC MUST DIE" That you have complete control over traps and place them anywhere you wishes. You only have certain locations where you could build Traps or Towers. Enemies will drop Essences upon death which will be required for upgrading or placing new Towers/Traps. You are able to build in "Build phase" and Combat Phase however you can only hurt enemies in "Combat phase" This also includes for neutral enemies which may drop items upon their death. IF you have died or an enemy has reached the "Core", You will lose a life. You will be game over and forced to restart the game as all lives has been vanished.

Abilities and Potions have cooldown, The damage and cooldown could change by items or by upgrading the Character Perks. Towers/traps are also able to get upgrades and make them stronger or faster. Some abilities could apply a Tower buff or could do insanely amount of damage. Towers/Traps has elemental effect, like Poison, Ice, Fire and so go on. They also have Piercing, Splash, concentrated and other effects. Elemental and Damage type attacks will have an impact on some enemies as all enemies are strong or weak against certain attacks.

[b]Ingame Information.[/b]


[list]
    [*]Voiced over subtitles.
    [*]You can skip cutscenes.
    [*]There is options available ingame.
    [*]Level selection looks really amazing.
    [*]The game is pretty "Deep" Build and it's addictive!
    [*]There is a difficulty level available and Hard could provide you with 3 stars. (Monsters get stronger)

    [*]A well explained tutorial (You can toggle this off).
    [*]Graphics looks amazing.
    [*](Combat) Soundtrack is pretty nice.
    [*]There is no Camera rotation.
    [*]You can upgrade your character with gear and there is an ingame shop where you can buy or sell new items.

    [*]There is a character level system and a Trap level system.
    [*]Gore is on by default but you are able to turn this off.
    [*]Defensive units + Enemies are good/bad against certain effects or damage types.
    [*]There are bosses and mini bosses.
[/list]


[b]Miscellaneous Information.[/b]


[list]
    [*]There is a leaderboards available and it isn't hacked for once!
    [*]You can play with the mouse or use the keyboard. The character will respond to keyboard buttons and clicks.
    [*]It doesn't say or show how many kills each Defensive unit got. Which could be useful! (Like Dungeon Defender).
    [*]You will unlock new traps even if you restart a level or surrender. As Some is based on kills.
[/list]

[h1]Other things.[/h1]

This game is certainly worth the full Price in my opinion. The graphics, The gameplay, The soundtrack, Level system, Gear,  Level selection graphical layout. Everything is very well done and i have certainly enjoyed playing this game. If you are into Tower defense Games. You should buy this game, No matter if the game is full price or discounted. This is a must buy if you are into Tower Defense.

-------------------


[quote] Reviews are always uploaded if i have at least played for 2 hours or more. Unless the game is really garbage and doesn't deserve the 2H limit.[/quote]

I Give this game a 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198309364301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1697415512}
review:
10/10

Aqui você é colocado como um guerreiro que tem que defender diversos portais onde há ataques constantes de criaturas, mas para isso precisa preparar armadilhas para que te ajudem. O clima dos lugares é bastante sombrio e meio devastado, lembrando um tipo de era de trevas e um reino de fantasia medieval do mal, não é toda aquela coisa bela e cheia de brilho que alguns desse universos costumam apresentar.

Não há apenas uma área por onde os inimigos atacam, há múltiplas, e assim você precisa usar armadilhas para te auxiliarem enquanto você tenta deter as criaturas de outra área, ou coloca o mesmo nível de defesa em todas as partes apenas para darem uma filtrada na quantidade de inimigos e assim você apenas finalizar com o que sobrar deles. Essas armadilhas são colocadas em lugares já pré determinados, então o que você faz é escolher uma das áreas e encaixar o tipo de armadilha que achar mais adequado ali.

O seu personagem também tem as habilidades especiais próprias e nesse quesito o jogo apresenta o sistema de um action rpg mesmo, portanto você vai melhorando o seu personagem, coletando itens que caem dos monstros ou mesmo em baús próximos, melhorando as habilidades com os pontos que ganha ao passar de nível, entre outras coisas. Ao final de cada partida, você pode ir a loja e vender equipamentos que conseguiu para ter um pouco mais de ouro e assim comprar coisas novas coisas.

Os gráficos do jogo tem aquele toque de ambiente macabro, tudo muito escuro e sinistro, é algo que gostei bastante e que ao mesmo tempo ajuda muito a manter o clima de RPG mesmo, tirando um bocado a sensação de meramente ser um tower defense, os ambientes tem caminhos pelos cenários que na maioria dos jogos seria fechado, por exemplo, se tiverem dois caminhos separados por uma floresta, você não precisa ir até o lugar onde eles se unem para poder ter acesso a outra estrada, basta atravessar a floresta, que as vezes pode ter um baú do tesouro esperando.

Enfim, Deathtrap é um ótimo jogo para se passar o tempo e com o sistema de pontuação de cada fase, acaba podendo se tornar um vício enorme, então recomendo muito, acho que é um híbrido de muito bom gosto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247158532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1035, 'last_played': 1527374447}
review:
En primer lugar nunca me funcionó el sonido y si bien me atrapó como para terminarlo así; No lo recomiendo.
La poca variedad de enemigos, los escenarios muy similares, los niveles de dificultad pensados más para party (de los cuales no podés armar porque no hay nadie), el inventario/habilidades muy básicas y el peor problema.... Las recompensas, solo las dan al final del nivel y si llegas a perder no obtenes nada, lo cual frustra ya que a más dificultad más tiempo lleva y si perdés es todo para nada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068431321', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1528418907}
review: So I've played a lot of tower defense games and some of the ones on mobile devices start off really fun and then start trying to steal your money with stupid microtransactions.  This game is basically one of those games, without the microtransactions.  It isn't mind blowing, but it is a really solid TD game with a diablo style progression.  I think that Orcs Must Die 2 is the best action TD game in the genre, but there is still plenty of room for more good games like Deathtrap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018106289', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1492348234}
review:
TDとハクスラを合わせて3で割った感じのゲーム。

TDとして見ると、罠の設置地点と種類が決まっているのでシナジーが無い。
罠だけで封鎖することは難しく、キツいWaveは自身の手で対処しないと突破されてしまうので、結局はマップ全体を走り回ることになる。

ハクスラとして見ると、脆い敵は罠で死んでいくので、残った硬い敵を時間掛けてチマチマ削っていくだけ。
作業感が半端なく、遊んでいる途中に寝てしまったゲームは久々だった。

TDはTD、ハクスラはハクスラとして遊んだ方が面白いです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198053656072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2940, 'last_played': 1524508795}
review:
It's fun until you've completed the first run of the maps. The decision made by the designer to stop you being able to replay old maps and still farm XP is a bad one in my opinion, it forces the player to continue to play on the next tier, rather than to go back and enjoy it at their own pace. Although I've played for 50+ hours, I end up hitting this wall where my time spent playing is no longer rewarded with the ability to level up. 

I've played this 1,2 and 3 player, it's absolutely more fun with others- the design of the levels is such that it encourages it. This is fine, but the game is less enjoyable on your own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029219721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1522365674}
review:
I wish I could recommend this. I really wish I could. But as it stands, eh.

So, Deathtrap is an Isometric ARPG Tower Defense hybrid where you get to play a hero and also build towers and traps to stop monsters from entering your base. This reminds me a lot of Warcraft 3 custom maps which I adored and thus I had to give this a try.

And it's really fun! Lots of traps and towers to choose from, a good bit of customization for your 3 classes through skills n gear, and solid core gameplay. It also looks and sounds alright, so that's cool.

Sadly, this is where the whole thing takes a turn for the worse. The game has bugs. A lot of them. Enemies get stuck in walls, the game crashes for a set of specific graphics cards on a few select maps unless you start RIGHT AWAY with no build time, and there's a good bunch more I won't bother to list here.

And the worst part, the game has been abandoned by the developers who jumped ship to the next game. I suppose Deathtrap wasn't profitable but from what I can gather they used to listen to all the comments they got, fixed stuff etc. and one day later stopped completly and just made more games.

I dislike supporting devs that don't deliver a finished and polished product but I can suck that up if the devs promise to fix that issue. Sadly, this probably won't happen and as such I can not recommend Deathtrap.

If the game does work for you, cool. It's really fun and I wish the devs would care more about it. But with it not working for a buddy and additional glitches popping up here and there it's hard to recommend this in fear that it'll just not work for you, either.

review: По нормальному сделана прокачка,в отличие от хельсинга.Немного кривое управление из-за невозможности крутить камерой.Удобний кооп и возможность кастомизации карт.Полное отсуствие онлайна в дуэлях и в поиске группы(зачем их вообще добавили).Дешёвый крафт чарованных шмоток(хорошо помагает в начале).Играть можно,как TD с элементами RPG даже очень хорошо заходит.Оценка 4/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268858768', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 5153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1002, 'last_played': 1547678207}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962657563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1520198793}
review:
Lots of potential but two main flaws ruined it for me.

1. Poor controls.  Click to move games should always run towards the mouse  cursor when you hold down the mouse button, not try to path to the location the mouse cursor is over.  For example if you're holding down mouse1 to run upward and your mouse cursor passes over a wall or chasm,  you suddenly change direction and start trying to find a path to the location on the other side of that wall.  In a level with lots of obstacles this is infuriating.  And it is impossible to run and shoot at the same time.

2. You can only place towers in a few predetermined locations.  There are maybe 3 or 4 places on each map where you can place each type of tower.  And towers that have synergy such as towers that weaken against physical damage almost never come right before towers that do physical damage so the synergy can never be realized.  Severely limiting tower locations in a tower defense game is such a bizarre design choice.  It removes all the creativity and fun from the TD genere for no apparent reason.

One of the nice bugs: I just did a endless mode on the crystal vaults map and got up to wave 42. I received like 2 billion exp and directly got boosted from level 65 to 100 (the max in the game) xD The game crashed directly, however. Still I am level 100 now xP

author: {'steamid': '76561198080049401', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1518572665}
review:
So this game has been sitting in my library for a while now, just an extra part of a purchase on Humble Bundle.  I'll be honest, I didn't expect anything from it.  Tower defence games have never seemed particularly interesting to me.  But recently I've been going through my unplayed games, and I was pleasantly surprised by Deathtrap.  

I still don't much like tower defence, Deathtrap didn't change my world, but there's no denying the amount of effort that went into the development of this game.  The graphical quality is fairly good, and the voice acting is of a high quality.  I haven't played much, so I can't say how the story develops, but the introduction, while nothing especially unique, does add a pleasant element to the game.

It's a little difficult to comment on the gameplay without having much experience of other games, but the RPG elements add a degree of difference from other tower defence titles, rather than exclusively dealing with in-level tower upgrades.

Overall, while I wouldn't spend much time on this game myself, that is purely because of genre preferences, and for anyone who enjoys tower defence games I would certainly recommend trying Deathtrap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198801680581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1516238749}
review:
Доброго времени суток. 

Не так много игр в стиле tower defense можно пройти с удовольствием. Deathtrap всё же оставляет после себя какое-то приятное чувство. Хоть и не сразу… При запуске игры не отпускает ощущение, что режим, взятый из серии The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing, перекочевал в отдельную игру не совсем понятно зачем, но получилось не плохо. Есть три героя: наёмник (ближний бой), охотник (дальний бой) и волшебница (тут всё ясно). У каждого есть экипировка, навыки, пассивные улучшения и у всех свои. Башни же для всех наших героев одни и те же, но их тоже можно улучшать, а потом применять эти улучшения на самой карте. 

Различные режимы игры могли бы не дать заскучать, поскольку тут есть и кооператив, и соперничество, и редактор карт (очень простенький, совсем не такого ждёшь при таком словосочетании) но… онлайн пуст, так что, если у Вас нет друзей, которым нравится такой жанр игр придётся играть одному. Насколько Вас увлечёт эта игра – сказать трудно.  Да, можно подгадывать комбинацию защит на разные волны, что бы пройти все карты на самом сложном уровне, получить за это кучу звёздочек и чувство собственного удовлетворения, но…

Если же опустить подробности и посмотреть на игру в целом – то скоротать несколько вечеров вполне можно, а с друзьями – явно больше. Просить многого от маленькой игры, которую делала маленькая студия нет смысла. 

Рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020939185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 11942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11527, 'last_played': 1548045654}
review:
This game is a fun little tower defense game.  This game is easiest 2p.  The maps change when there are 3+ players in-game, making 3p the most challenging, and 4p rather easy.  

The randomly-generated loot is ridiculously frustrating, because so much of what drops is complete trash, and the odds of getting a rune that fits your build are incredibly slim.  

The game moves at a glacial pace, and some enemies even force the game to slow down!  

Many of the Steam Achievements are broken in this game, which can be frustrating.  Reaching out to the developers got a "We're working on it!" response, but it has been over three months since then.  

If the Steam Achievements were fixed, and the in-game store were tweaked a bit such that it could be refreshed/re-rolled, I would recommend this game.  As it is, I can't recommend it strongly.  If you're into Tower Defense, this can be a nice co-op experience, but definitely pick it up on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056903681', 'num_games_owned': 974, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1558883733}
review:
Astucieux mélange de Hack N Slash et Tower Defense ! 
On peut avoir une première impression de diablo like : design des monstres et du personnage, sans oublier l'inventaire. 
Toutefois, on est bien dans un tower defense avec pas mal d'armes et défenses a disposition. Elles ont chacune leur arbre de compétences pour les faire évoluer : si on veut se spé en dommage AOE ou en fixe. C'est au choix ! 
On apprécie la coop de 1 à 4 joueurs.
Musique épique qui donne l'envie de jouer. 

Le grand regret, c'est le manque de map ! Seulement treize ! Certes on peut dès le niveau 20 (sur 100) choisir d'autres niveaux de difficulté ou prendre des cartes dans le workshop ( indispensable pour ne pas tourner en rond ! )  C'est le grand défaut de ce jeu. 

Je le recommande, niveau qualité / prix y a rien à redire. ( Personnellement j'ai attendu les soldes steam pour l'avoir à 5 € mais même full prize à 20 € c'est tout à faire correct ! )

author: {'steamid': '76561198010200356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1514218039}
review: Van Helsing con le trappole. Un bel tower defense d'azione perché si deve anche combattere col proprio personaggio, con tante torri, o meglio trappole, tanti mostri, tre personaggi. A tratti ricorda Orcs must die, sia per la presenza del personaggio che  per il tipo di trappole, ma la visuale è dall'alto. Il principale difetto è lo stesso di Van Helsing: troppe scelte. Tra trappole, migliorie delle trappole, abilità del personaggio attive e passive, armi, vestiti, possibilità di costruirsi gli oggetti, alla fine si passa più tempo a scegliere tra la marea di opzioni che a giocare negli scenari. Chi ama il genere comunque non resterà deluso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044556468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1615639126}

author: {'steamid': '76561198265341942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 5304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5236, 'last_played': 1522037246}
review:
I spent like 200+ hrs on the GOG version and now about 50 hrs on the Steam version. This is one of my personal favourites along with Borderlands and Doom series. If you enjoy Diablo style games and Tower Defense games this is a must have. It has a mixture of gothic/cyberpunk atmosphere which is awesome. People complain about Deathtrap being grindy. Yes it can be but it doesn't have to if you follow my advice: 

- To level up your character very fast play the first map (Darkmoor) in endless mode (you will earn an abundance of skill points by doing so). But you should do this after you are like halfway through Tier 1, Tier 2, etc. after you upgraded your traps and character to a respectable level or when you are stuck with one particular map.

- Don't try to level up all traps in your inventory equally but stick to only a few traps (one fully leveled up trap per enemy type e.g. Frost Pillar for Giant monsters should suffice).

- If one trap doesn't prove effective against monsters, don't hesitate to reset and redristribute  your research points. Same applies for your characters skill points. It's a nice touch that the game allows you to do this. It is strongly advised that you readapt your character and traps in order to succeed in a particular map with flying colours. 

- In order to earn max number of research points for your traps you have to finish the map/mission flawlessly that means without dying and a without a single gate breach. You can earn extra research points if you also finish the side quest before the last attack wave ends. 

- Study monster types thoroughly on the mini map before each attack wave and setup your traps accordingly.

- Inbetween attack waves you should first upgrade the traps which are farthermost. You will not be able to upgrade them during attack waves since you will be near your gate defending it fiercely 90% of your time.

- The more essence you have the more traps you can built and upgrade during or inbetween waves. There are various methods to gather an abundance of essence e.g. essence traps. Make use of them !

- Salvage items you don't need from the beginning DON'T SELL THEM. You will get valuable gems in return. Those you will need later on in Tier 4 when you start receiving Godlike items. You can upgrade those Godlike items up to 10 times with those gems.

- Sure everbody has his/her own personal favourites but for me following combination of traps proved most effective: Frost Pillar, Icicle Field, Essence Trap, Voltaron Coil, Razor Launcher, Monster Cage & Winter Queen Sigil.

- I have not tried but I DON'T recommend playing this game with a controller, you should definitely use a mouse + keyboard combination.

- Last but not least. Always keep an eye on the Minimap during gameplay !

Hope it helps !

P.S.: If anyone wants to play online Coop he/she can add me as a friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051509641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2311, 'last_played': 1492030555}
review: Fun and addictive Tower defense game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965964690', 'num_games_owned': 1011, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 1953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1953, 'last_played': 1498010998}
review:
Do you like Diablo?  Do you like tower defense games?  Do you see where these questions are going?  Deathtrap is an isometric tower defense where you can fight using a hero character, and which has RPG elements.  Monsters follow set paths, and you must set up towers and floor traps, as well as use your hero's innate abilities to take them out.  as you play, you get experience, and you can level your defenses as well as your abilities.

What is the result is a well thought out hybrid, comparable to games like Orcs Must Die and Dungeon Defender.  Unlike those games however, Deathtrap chooses a serious, somewhat modern dark ambiance.  Also like those games, you can bring friends to play with you as well.  This allows you to coordinate on how to best spend resources, and use your unique abilities to give yourself the advantage of versatility.

Deathtrap is a great game, but at $20 that might be a steep cost if you are purchasing it for friends as well, so it may be worth waiting for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005664777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1561839811}
review:
Deathtrap is an amazing genre mix. I like to play tower defence games occasionally and I really enjoy RPG games. This game combines both.
The game itself is simple: Defend your portals by killing all enemies moving along predifined lines. You can only win if you combine the attack skills of your character with towers you place along those lines. 

Be aware that this game is probabily created on a tight budget. So don't expect super awesome graphics, a scripted and well narrated story, a huge variety in maps, cinematic sound and a multitude of characters and towers.
I enjoyed the game for arround 20 hours, leveling different characters with a friend in network coop. I like the character classes and the variety in skills. Sadly, after you played all levels, there is not much content for further playing. The difficutly becomes harder, but the maps and towers stay the same. I relly hope for a successor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969577791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1513162488}

Mix of tower defence and RPG, access to towers is acquired through gathering winning points. Some maps have added objectives. Three classes to choose from. Progression may be somewhat grindy, but levels feel well balanced.
Three classes of enemies, each one needing a type of trap to be controlled, plus flying enemies immune to ground traps.
Very nice game.

review: Ein Spiel dass immer wieder Spass macht, weil es immer wieder neue taktische Möglichkeiten bietet. Es wird immer mal hektisch und man weiß teilweise nicht wo man zuerst hin soll. Genau das sorgt dafür dass man immer aufmerksam sein muss und erhöht die Spannung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072981277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1751, 'last_played': 1650917411}
review:
Vorweg... Tolles Spiel! (Wobei ich nur den KOOP Modus bewerten möchte)

Ich war anfangs etwas skeptisch, dass man die Türme nicht Frei bauen darf wie man möchte aber ich muss sagen es ergibt sich damit eine unerwartete taktische Tiefe. Auf welche Türme spezialisiere ich mich /mein Partner sich. Wer nimmt welchen Bauplatz um eine max. Ausbeute zu erreichen, wer Skillt welche Boni etc.

Optisch von der Aufmachung und den Effekten finde ich es auch gut.

Das einzige Manko was uns bisher aufgefallen ist, es friert regelmäßig beim KOOP spielen für den beigetretenen ein, sodass wir das Spiel neu starten müssen. Kommt leider mehrmals am Abend vor egal wer hostet. :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198263427469', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1508618161}
review:
When papa Diablo meets mama TD...

I was confused when I started the first map. Everything was unclear. Mechanic of building/upgrading tower was strange. My first 20 minutes of game time was negative. But I continued playing. And.. I liked it.. 

It reminds Dungeon Defenders with only difference that you control hero not by arrows, but by cursor. You have 3 hero for choosing: Archer, Warrior and Mage. Classic. I picked Sorcerer.

Your hero has HP and Mana, money for traps(towers) and some abilities. You start with autoattack (ice bolt), active skill (Lightning), kinda of ultimate with a long cooldown (attack all unit on the map) and 1 skill which buffs trap.
So, you place some traps, wave starts, enemies come, you are walking around and casting spell trying to not die. Pretty funny, actually.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1176152079

When a level finishes you get some items for the hero and appear in the "city". There are some menus: 
1) Skills. You get SP with each level where you can spend them. You can improve all skills. Some skills has 3 avaialble upgrades and some only 1. Each per can be learnt several times. So, customization is huge.
2) Traps. There are 15 traps at total. Each has 5 perks. First 3 unlock upgrade in the game. It means, if you learn upgrade in the city it gives nothing to the tower until you spend some gold to upgrade it in the battle.  Each such upgrade has 3 levels. So, 9 upgrades for a tower at total. There are also 2 upgrade which increases characterstic for traps. They can be researched serveral times
3) Store and Inventory. Your hero has Weapon, Necklace, Ring, Belt, Armor and 3 rune slots. You can find items in the battle, craft them or buy in the store. There is a random generating item system like in the Diablo.

There are about 15 levels. Each has 4 stages. To start the next stage you need to pass all levels at the 1 stage. I spent 3-4 hours for passing 6 stages, so i suppose there is a lot of game time.

There are different types of monsters: usual, fast, flying, strong and slow, archers. There are also improved version of monsters with abilities (like in the diablo) and there is a boss in the end of each level.
Design of levels is  different. So it's cool

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1176653193

I really liked the game even after 5h of playing. But there is a huge flaw. The game crashes constanly and developers are not willing to do anything about it. I played 6th stage 5 attempts and it crashed 5 times. The last one was on the fight with the boss at the last level. I was tired of trying and deleted the game. I read reviews, there is A LOT of threads in the forum and reviews which told about it. And.... no replies from developers. The game is abandoned. I also read, achievements are not working and the game crashes on level 9 for AMD videocard holders. So, be aware. save your money

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1176653298

[h1]Resume[/h1]
I would give this game a positive rating because it's fun game, but I can't because the technical part of this game is terrible. I couldn't pass 6th mission, because it crashed 5 times in 5 attempts. So... I can't recommend it. Stay away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140822604', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 8463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2825, 'last_played': 1575315328}
review: Présenté comme un spin-off de la série des Van Helsing (que vous connaissez peut-être dans la catégorie des hack 'n' slash),  Deathtrap est un hybride mi-tower defense, mi-action RPG, qui comporte assez d'éléments RPG pour que vous soyez presque familiarisé avec le style de jeu . Si vous avez aimé les phases de Tower Defense dans les Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing vous aimerez forcément Deathtrap. Le jeu en reprend totalement le concept et les caractéristiques pour nous offrir une expérience encore plus aboutie. Les sessions de jeu en solo, en coop et même en versus sont très plaisantes... Have fun ! XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198010048647', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1507934249}
review: I am soooo sad I can't continue playing. Hitting the 9th map (it was a total blast up until that point) is just a hard stop. I feel bad about being punished for having an AMD card when I was enjoying the game SO much even with the buggy little freezes (kinda gave it character in a weird way). Allow me to continue past the 9th map and I'll happily change this to a thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014089582', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1507925076}
review:
tl;dr Tower Defense meets Diablo 3 meets 'meh'.

Deathtrap is not a horrible game. It isn't a particularly good one either. 

+ challenging, but not unfair
+ skill has a real impact
+ huge variety in terms of character and trap development
- huuuuuuuge variety in terms of character and trap development. There are so many friggin traps and skills around, it is absolutely overwhelming. As is almost always the case in situations like this, it leads to...
- balance issues. Some combos and traps seem borderline gamebreaking, like the essence trap which lets you build and upgrade so many 'towers' it becomes boring
- very grindy. Items drop randomly and can have a huge impact.
- absolutely zero comma zero zero story

Considering the price tag of 20 Euros and the store full of amazing games, I cannot recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054382565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 6074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4435, 'last_played': 1651378959}
review:
I loved playing this game. 
To be honest it is by far my favorite TD game. 
The levels felt unique, fun, they had their own unique challenges. 
You had to work around each character & almost specialist each skill tree the same way. 
The game offers a large variety, sometimes you'll find yourself replaying a level because you sliped up one time, but thats the great part about this game. 
Every level almost has a learning curve, every level can be played by one of the characters in a unique way. 
Why do I only have 74.6 hours in this game at the moment.... BECAUSE all of a sudden the game would just crash. 
I would have never stopped playing this game if it wasn't for it. and for almost a year every few weeks I want to play this game but I can't. The game has some kind of comparability issue with 
I stopped playing in Oct 2016... and I miss the game. 
Below is a thread I posted related to the issue I was having sadly. I think the Dev's gave up on the game but maybe I'm mistaken.


http://steamcommunity.com/app/310510/discussions/0/305509857563705960/?tscn=1478037600

author: {'steamid': '76561198006525099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1505782213}
review:
Jeżeli grałeś/aś w "The Incredible Adventures of VanHelsing II" i tęsknisz za zawartą tam mini-grą typu tower-defence, to właśnie ją znalazłeś! "Deathtrap" to właśnie ta mini-gra (z tego samego studia) przeniesiona do osobnego produktu. Ponownie dostajemy ciekawy typ rozgrywki znany również z serii "Sanctum" - budujemy pułapki i jednocześnie bawimy się w pełni sterowalną i rozwijalną postacią, której klasę (najemnika, strzelca lub czarodziejkę) mamy do wyboru na początku gry. Każda misja posiada stopień trudności do wyboru, a po jej zakończeniu otrzymujemy porcję złota na zakupy w goblinowym sklepie, doświadczenie i możliwość rozwoju postaci oraz pułapek. Ciekawa opcja to możliwość tworzenia własnych przedmiotów - od broni zaczynając, przez elementy pancerza po błyskotki. Wszystko to okraszone zostało bardzo przyjemną dla oka grafiką, sporym poziomem trudności (przy wyborze najwyższego poziomu trudności), dobrą muzyką również znaną z w/w prekursora, świetnym klimatem i naprawdę dużą grywalnością.
Zdecydowanie polecam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198353896449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 6083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5802, 'last_played': 1505490292}
review:
ハクスラとタワーディフェンスをあわせたゲームです。
トラップとプレイヤーの直接攻撃で敵の侵攻を防ぐのが楽しいです。

 長所
・トラップとプレイヤーの強さとのバランスがいい
・ボタン1つでゲームスピードを上げ下げできるのが便利
短所
・取得不可の実績がある(バグ？)
・最上級レアのGodlike装備が普通に店売りしているので
かんたんに装備が整えられてうれしい反面、ハクスラの醍醐味である
強敵を倒してレア装備をゲットする楽しみがない

今作は同社のVan Helsingシリーズのミニゲームをゲーム化したものなので
これが気に入ったらVan Helsingもおすすめです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198009596311', 'num_games_owned': 5864, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 2055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1917, 'last_played': 1613969738}
review:
This isn't a terrible game, just an unfinished one. Take the tower defence levels from Van Helsing 2+3 and remove any significant customization until level 50. I ain't kidding. All the good gear you would want to use is like 20 hours worth of grinding. Don't forget, it's only 13 levels for the official campaign with 4 difficulty tiers and none of them explain any important stats like the level of the monsters/equipment you can earn. It's very unpolished and is painfully apparent in the hero balance.

Fighter for some reason gets a lot of bonuses for being around Summon Stones (building slot to have summoned units guard area), yet the majority of the maps don't have them near the area you need to protect, making him mostly useless for a single player character. Meanwhile the Sorceress is too good at single target DPS and made every level a breeze, no matter the content. The Hunter is interesting with having to wait 'in the shadows' and regain his energy while moving super fast to lane, but isn't given a lot of potent skill to do useful damage with the low amount of energy he can use.

Overall Score: 5/10 There is a game here, but demands too much investment for such a small degree of satisfaction. Pretty much only fans of the Van Helsing tower defense might like it and even then, you may not like how simplified it became.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995749953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1503757113}
review: Ack.  I don't remember how much I paid but $1 would be too much.  If you are interested in this because its a "tower" defense game - it's not.  You can only place specific traps in specific limited locations (So your only decision is when to place a trap - not where or what type).    Much of the "challenge" (if you call it that) is as a run-n-gun type game.  And that run-n-gun has a wierd mechanic where you have "essence" that fuels your shots.  When you run out you have to run and hide to allow it to regenerate.  So you are never really in a fight very long.  And your "towers" are all pretty much decided for you.  There is a skill tree - but honestly didn't see it add anything to the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051501559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3312, 'last_played': 1583657494}
review:
Overall enjoyable game with some interesting mechanics. Tower Defense mixed with an RPG/Dungeon Crawler.

Pros: 
For the price the game has plenty of content.
Multiple different strategies and heroes to choose from.
Multiplayer adds a new dimension to the game.

Cons:
Multiplayer bug, the host can pause the game and let all the other players connected kill everything while the game and mobs are paused. I've used this to help get through tough levels, but omg how did this bug get past testing?
The mage is the best hero by a mile, a rebalancing patch would have been reasonable when this game was new.
There are a couple levels that are flat out overtuned, this is where the pause glitch came in handy after multiple failed attemps.

review:

Besonders viel Spaß macht es im Coop. Ich habe es zusammen mit einem Freund komplett durchgespielt und es wurde nie langweilig. Einziges Manko ist, dass die Spielzeit von 9 Stunden, die wir benötigt haben, um es durchzuspielen, doch etwas gering ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041108461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 5976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4873, 'last_played': 1628904197}
review:
Would give this a positive review, except for the "Bottomless Pit" map Tier 3 ruins it.

You have to grind and outlevel your toon to beat it... which makes the following maps not fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048219518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1501276543}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013994481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 1547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1386, 'last_played': 1647661090}
review:
I cannot understand all the hate this game gets.
Premise is pretty simple; tower defense meets Diablo. There are only 3 classes, the classic fighter/mage/thief archetypes, but there are plenty of ways to customize each one. Upgrading both your character and traps is straightforward enough but diverse, delivered at a reasonable pace. I mention this in contrast to games such as Path of Exile, where you stare at an overwhelming skill tree, hesitant to pick a skill to upgrade as to not waste your points. Same thing with item drops; you only get equipment for your class, and not too many, so you don't have to waste time managing your inventory.
Love the theme, too. It has a dark gothic flavor mixed with steampunk, and landing hits that make monsters explode is pretty satisfying. 
The difficulty is spot-on, too. Sometimes I have to restart levels and replan my strategies, but not too often as to cause frustration.
A lot of people complain that you can only set up traps in designated areas, and that you can't wall-in enemies into specific paths. There are plenty of tower defense games that do or don't. It's intended, not a design flaw.
I have not had the chance to play multiplayer yet. Too few people playing at the moment, unfortunately. I'm quite content with the single player for now, though.
It's hard to hold something against this game. After all, its game mechanics seem to be implemented exactly as intended. Perhaps some NPCs and story elements would add more soul to the game. Perhaps another layer of gameplay elements could be interesting. Either way, it's a very good game overall and I recommend it in its current state.

review:
それなりに楽しいし悪いゲームではないんだけどミニゲームとしてならセール時におすすめ
有志日本語化あり

ハクスラ要素のあるTDではなく、TD要素のあるハクスラだと思った方がいい
罠の置ける場所と種類がマップごとに決まっていて、プレイヤーキャラクターの基礎攻撃とスキルで敵を殲滅していくゲーム

上にある動画みたときはとても面白そうに思えたけど、実際やってみると「この罠とこの罠をコンボで使いたい」ということが出来ずもやもやするマップが多い

coopや対戦が必須な実績があるのも個人的にはマイナス点

author: {'steamid': '76561198060922164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3124, 'last_played': 1672607119}
review:
Ohhh yes.

So glad this made it to a stand alone game. When I first played van Helsing I enjoyed the mini tower defense game within the game.

I have not played as much as I wanted too, but thus far I would recommend it to any one who loves tower defense games.

Thumbs up from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960885260', 'num_games_owned': 663, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1696213121}
review:
I got this with 3 other friends in order to enjoy some tower defense meets diablo gameplay which sounded awesome. The game is pretty fun in co-op mode as well as dorking around in single player. 

Unfortunately only 2 of us could actually play the game. Nvidia cards seem to not have the same issues but if you have an AMD card in your system I don't recommend buying this game. I've spent countless hours and multiple system configurations trying to tweak and solve whatever the issue is. 

From everything I can test it seems to be with how the game interacts with the video card drivers. Its like they wrote a proprietary interface that works correctly with nvidia drivers only. It is really unfortunate but I've found no settings that make the game playable past around level 14. And the game play is rather crappy up until them most of the time.

** NOTE: if you have an AMD video card do NOT buy this game! **

I want to recommend this game, and if they ever fix it and I notice maybe I would, but for now it has left me with unpleasant feelings and so I would warn people away from it so as to save them the pain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027973295', 'num_games_owned': 1826, 'num_reviews': 1850, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1654889950}
review:
Приобрел данную игру в составе The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing Anthology. Так и не понял, какое к нему отношение имеет Deathtrap... но это не тот вопрос, который следует поднять. Deathtrap - это самая скучная игра, которую я запускал на своей системе за последние два года. За проведенное в ней время я не нашел ни единого повода задержаться. 

На запуске Deathtrap автоматом подцепляет геймпад и не дает производить навигацию по меню с помощью клавиатуры, за счет чего интерфейс ощущается очень куцым. Далее тебя встречают серая гамма очередного фэнтези. В первые несколько мгновений кампании не происходит ровным счетом ничего интересного. После чего следует осознание, что это еще и MOBA! Не выдержав всего этого, я закрыл игру и поклялся больше никогда к ней не возвращаться.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981624277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 1407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1407, 'last_played': 1499714898}
review:
It was fun and aesthetically pleasing. Then the mods decided custom maps should not reward loot or experience and players were faced with an extreme grind-fest of a game.


Stay away you will have to play 60+ boring hours to reach end-game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085820470', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1499714553}
review:
评分：7/10

挺不错的一款塔防游戏，加上了范海辛的背景
比较有特色的就是英雄的技能和装备系统，类似于范海辛本作（暗黑）的形势，有创意工坊和地图编辑器，有合作模式可以和朋友开黑
适合于喜欢TD的玩家

确定就是内容较少，创意工坊内的地图也不多

review:

Perfect game if your looking for RPG style gameplay, but want to play casually in stead of grinding dungeons for ever.

I would recommend the game at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011331020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1452743224}
review: Actually one of the best tower defense games I have ever played. Yes, you might have to grind to make it with perfect ratings on harder difficulties, but the fun ramps up when you have more unlocked options. Not much character development or plot, but that is not important in this game. Just have fun with it as a tower defense game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014007641', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2932, 'last_played': 1561632730}
review: Absolut geiles Tower Defense Spiel. Umso geiler, wenn man mit einem Freund zockt. Man kommt schnell rein und wird schnell süchtig. Die Kritik, dass man nur auf vorgefertigten Plätzen Türme setzen kann, ist für dieses Spiel nicht so tragisch. Man will sich immer weiter verbessern, schließlich will man die Maps auch Perfekt auf Hardcore schaffen und Türme unterschiedlich upgraden. Charakter leveln und Items finden im Action-RPG-Stil verfeinern noch das ganze. Einziger Makel: es gibt nur drei Charakterklassen zur Auswahl, das wäre sicherlich mal verbesserungswürdig mit einem Addon. Im Angebot zuschlagen - Vollpreis wäre ein bisschen zu happig hierfür.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032705509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1505165896}
review:
I like how balanced this game is. It scales perfectly when playing alone or with 2, 3 or 4 players (can be chatic though). The hard mode is difficult but challenging nonetheless. A perfect blend of Tower Defense game and RPG elements. The core of the game is extremely satisfying. The tutorial messages are handy and not invasive. A lot of diversity in this games from scaling but also from combining towers and upgrades for those towers, and levelling up your skills.

Ofcourse no game is perfect but mentioning flaws would be nitpicking rather than listing serious flaws.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044557375', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1467555381}
review: An interesting tower defense I got from Humble. I'm a huge fan of the unique theming and gameplay. Good for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022164138', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3461, 'last_played': 1504914328}
review:
Saw the premise and since I love hybrid-esque (fan of spellforce, with all its flaws) games thought I'd give it a whirl.
Imagine my surprise whilst playing i suddenly get a borgovian hat..Hmm borgovian I say, that reminds me of the van helsing games..Let me check.and tadaa, it is from the same devs.Great already since I love that series (depite some of the gnarly bugs). 

I have yet to encounter any bugs in this one, aside from a may or not be design desicion that doesn't grant you chest if you didn't pick it up before end last wave.

So the game, some feel it is restrictive because of the level cap on some to be researched items, but tbh I don't mind.It's not as if you get that many points that it limits your choice that much before a certain level.
Same with the skills for your adventurer/defender/.. smth 
A lot of good passive skills, something I can enjoy, don't want to be micromanaging the traps or the toon, it's exactly the good balance that makes this mix work.Otherwise it'd be a td with action elements or an action game with td elements. It's not, it's a true hybrid.Fun to play in co-op or SP, can't comment on online multiplayer since i play with a friend.

EDIT:
Playing a bit more: HM with random people is crazy and fun :) and sometimes even with just two we really get our ass handed to us and have to try different strategies.Maps change depending on what tier and how many players, not just more hp and more enemies, maps and possible traps change.Atm at 56hr and nowhere near done :D

For this price, just get it already

author: {'steamid': '76561198007554934', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 740, 'last_played': 1594508947}
review: Neocore's Van Helsing games had a tower defense mini game. People enjoyed it enough for it to warrant its own spin off game. And it is a good game. It is a situation of taking a good thing, a thing that works, and making it a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060948868', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1498980244}
review: Très peu de liberté dans la stratégie en terme de tower défence

author: {'steamid': '76561198007032272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1498858029}
review:
Buyers be aware that you CANNOT play this game without a controller. I bought this game during the summer sale and it was included in a package deal because it would be cheaper to do it this way then to buy the games seperately. Anyway, even if I didn't buy the package for THIS game, a tower defense game is always interesting.

However, the controls are confusing, I struggled to figure out the controls and I still haven't figured out how I can actually progress to the next level after defeating the first.

While I had a little fun, playing the first level, I can't say much about the rest since I can't actually ACCESS THE DAMN THING.

How hard can it be to patch in decent keyboard and mouse support? Even if the game was primarily designed for controller, if you port it to the computer, you have to include support for FUCKING MOUSE AND KEYBOARD!

My conclusion? No. Skip this game, because I am certain there are better alternatives. F You developers for forgetting such a basic thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108519137', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 899, 'last_played': 1511604142}
review:
From the guys that brought you Van Helsing series, and will bring us Inquisitor Martyr, comes : DEATHTRAP !
I had 4 bucks on my steam wallet and decided to buy this, because of its looks, feel and genre.

Reviews are Positive (775) Negative (156).
Deathtrap is a Tower Defense game with strong action-RPG elements, a game of vicious tricks, killing machines, rotating blades and splattering blood.
+ Co-Op for 3-4 players. (i was in a group of 3 )
I did not get to play it much due to Foxhole, but I enjoyed it.
A short description can be Diablo meets tower defense. 3 classes: melee, mage and ranged, with inventory, potions, skills + you get to build towers to help you defend your "gateway" (that is your castle/base) from waves of mobs.

80% discount was a dealbreaker.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016472422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1498402215}
review: Вместо вдумчивого размещения башен и наблюдения за последующей мясорубкой - истеричные метания из однго конца карты в конец. Как TD игра - полное разочарование.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140727299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 6208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1590158515}
review:
Awesome tower defense game, where you jump into the action and help defend in a 3D environment, setting traps and shooting foes. 
You get to play 3 different classes, level up, find gear and earn gold. 
It definitely has a Van Helsing vibe to it and keeps you interested and playing! 
If you love TD games with a mix of 3rd person RPG, then you should check out this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005673250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1655052771}
review:
Incredibly restrictive hero defense game.

They give you a ton of points to distribute...but cap what you can buy by character level.

They give you a ton of tower types to place...but only a few spots to place them, and they pick what types you can place beforehand.

They give you the ability to equip your character...but enemies don't drop loot and you only get a few pieces given to you per level.

Way too many limitations to be fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994817007', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1178, 'last_played': 1624000940}

review:
Diablo meets tower defense. 
If you are new to tower defense or prefer a less hands on, more automated type of game then I don't recommend this.
The game seems dead from a support perspective but I haven't had issues running it.
Not as good as Orcs Must Die but I thought this had it's own flavor and brought enough to warrant a thumbs up despite it's shortcomings.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973124770', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1462592860}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049922178', 'num_games_owned': 5433, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1494412086}
review:
[h1]+ GOOD +[/h1]

+ 유저 한글패치가 있다. +
완벽한 한글패치는 아니지만 스킬, 메뉴, 미션 필수내용 등등 스토리를 제외한 게임 진행에 필수적인 것들의 대부분은 한글화가 되어 있습니다.
http://minipol.tistory.com/entry/Deathtrap-%ED%95%9C%EA%B8%80%ED%8C%A8%EC%B9%98

+ 보기에 나쁘지 않은 깔끔한 그래픽 +

+ 패드 최적화가 잘되어 있다 +
진동이 상당히 강하게 잘오고 버튼 배치도 나름 잘되어 있습니다.

+ 캐릭터, 장비, 스킬, 트랩 등등 레벨업하며 육성하는 재미가 있다. +

+ 유즈맵을 지원한다 +
맵을 유저가 스스로 직접 만들어 즐기거나, 스팀 창작마당에서 다른 유저들의 수많은 유즈맵을 구독후 즐길수 있습니다.

[h1]- BAD -[/h1]

- 짧으면서 재미없는 시나리오 -
이야기 전달 방식이 거의 텍스트로만 되어 있습니다. 영웅 캐릭터는 3명이지만 똑같은 메인 시나리오 맵을 재활용하기 때문에 쉽게 지루해지고 별다른 재미를 느끼기 힘듭니다.

- 그다지 좋지못한 타격감, 효과음, 배경음 -

- 높은 난이도에 갈수록 트랩들의 활용도가 떨어진다 -
난이도를 상승시키면 몬스터들의 능력치는 엄청나게 높아지는데 반해서...사용가능한 갯수, 고정된 위치, 육성의 한계치가 정해져 있는 트랩은 점점 활용도가 떨어집니다. 그래서 영웅 캐릭터의 레벨빨, 스킬빨, 장비빨, 컨트롤빨로 승부를 하게되는데...일반적인 타워 디펜스를 생각하고 플레이하게된 유저들이라면 이리저리 영웅을 컨트롤 해야되는 귀찮은 상황을 싫어 할수도 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966882693', 'num_games_owned': 3109, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1494313869}
review: A great mix of Tower Defense and Diablo. Tons of customization through skill trees, upgradeable traps and towers, equipment for your character complete with a crafting system. There's lots of content here and it's a fun game for anyone who's a fan of tower defense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276990568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1494449264}
review: I purchased Deathtrap last year.  At the time, I had a 15 inch 2011 Macbook Pro.  It seemed to run fine.  I had a little bit of a difficult time trying to figure out how to play it, so I ended up not playing for a while.  I recently upgraded my computer to a 2016 15 inch Macbook Pro w/ Radeon 455 graphics card.  Unfortunately, the game is unplayable due to the fact that the cursor is out-of-sync with what is on the screen.  Specifically, I have to point the cursor about an inch up and an inch to the right of anything that I wish to click on.  I have tried adjusting the resolution, window mode, etc.,  without help.  I have searched the forums for a solution without luck.  I have emailed Neocore (the game's manufacturer) without any response.  Therefore, I cannot recommend this game (at least to anyone who wishes to play on a newish Mac)

Some issues with the UI, and getting resolution adjusted and text size adjusted so text can actually be read. Also is VERY system resource intensive. author: {'steamid': '76561198032137848', 'num_games_owned': 1957, 'num_reviews': 775, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1506633359}
review:
An insane amount of character and trap customization. Char customization comes from exp levels and loot whereas trap customization comes from gaining trap points from completing new stages, completing quests, passives from character skill points, and char gear. Deathtrap is a tower defence game where you also control your hero Diablo-style, except there are tons of deadly traps you’ll use also use. 

Once you choose your hero you’ll be fighting through the 13 included campaign maps, but because the campaign has so few areas, you’ll start to become accustomed and familiar with them quite quickly. You’ll be replaying them repeatedly for the experience points, loot, and challenge since they can be played on different difficulty levels. Choose from one of three classes; Sorceress, Mercenary, or Marksman. Each have their own sets of abilities and their play styles are vastly different, so you can find a class that suits the way you like to play and branch from there with their unique skill trees and abilities complete with a level cap of 100 and more than 50 skills.

Возврат. И студию NeocoreGames в черный список криворукорукожопов.

review:
I loved this game. It's a hybrid of a great looking tower defense and Diablo. 

Towers you upgrade with skill-tree and hero with skills and gear.

As always with gear, the grind comes into play and there are many levels of gear, unique and combos, it gives the game longevity! 
Better gear and you play custom maps with harder difficulty which equals harder mobs and bosses and better loot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977267103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1492306131}
review:
Yet another of over fifty games which tells me left-click is right click and right click is left click; because my mouse is left-handed (reversed mouse buttons), and I am unable to remember every damn game which does not tell me correctly from the ones which do not. 

The terminology (Microsoft put Windows Mouse settings in the last Century) is:-
PRIMARY CLICK
&
SECONDARY CLICK

Thumbs down to every game that mileads we lefty/customers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142860006', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1277, 'last_played': 1588522758}
review:
强力推荐！非常超值的一款塔防游戏。
有点像兽人必须死，但是它的游戏视角比较方便操作 不容易晕。。
游戏一共3个职业其实都差不多，但是法师DPS比较高 我觉得很好上手
推荐升满闪电箭和回蓝 基本就很轻松了
这游戏不管是单机一个人还是和基友联机都很爽内容还算丰富挺耐玩的
最后给新手一点建议 箭塔 冰塔 喷火塔效果比较好可以优先升级

author: {'steamid': '76561198081737316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2932, 'last_played': 1508019339}
review:
If you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients
- To Make the Dough
375 grams (3 cups) plain flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
1/4 cup (50 ml / 3½ tablespoons) olive oil
1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) water
Extra flour for dusting 


- To Make Cheese Filling
15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese
5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan, Romano & Asiago)
Note: grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.
1/2 cup cheddar cheese
2 eggs, lightly beaten
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper


- Extras
Your favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)
Parmesan cheese
Basil
Fried vegetables
Shrimp
Fish slices
Chicken pieces 
Make the Ravioli filling.

- In a small mixing bowl, add the ricotta and mash with a fork.
- Add in the 3-cheese blend, Cheddar cheese, eggs, salt, and pepper.
- Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth, paste-like consistency.
- Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. 

Make the Ravioli dough.

- Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water, oil, and salt. Mix.
- Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs, water, oil, and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed.
- Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough.
- Take the dough out of the mixing bowl, shape it into a ball, and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic.
- Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick, or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters.
- With a cookie cutter or upside-down water glass, cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15-20 dough circles).
- Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis, or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn’t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. 

Fill the Ravioli shells.

- Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough.
- Fill a small bowl with water, dip your fingers in, and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle.
- Fold the dough in half over the filling, making a half-moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a “homemade” touch as well.
- Repeat this process for all your dough circles.
- Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. 

Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker.

- Roll the dough into two sheets
- Place one sheet on the ravioli maker, and form the filling cups.
- Fill with the ravioli mixture.
- Lay the second sheet of dough on top, and roll it out. This will seal in the filling.
- Remove and separate the finished raviolis.

Cook the Ravioli.

- Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil.
- Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5-6 minutes, or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test.
- If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time, you can freeze the rest 
- Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed plates

Serve it up.
Top with your favorite sauce, grate some fresh cheese over it, and enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049356842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1679591824}
review:
Positives: Fun to play, well balanced (if a bit grindy), graphics are ok, loads fast
Negatives: The game freezes on the 9th map, halting the single player progress. On all the maps I was able to play, the game pauses on a black screen for 2-3 seconds - this occurs every 3 or 4 minutes. As I gathered from the forum, both these issues are AMD specific (I have up-to-date drivers, i7-6700K, Fury X, 16 GB RAM).

TLDR: I cannot recommend this game, as these issues were reported more than 7 months ago and the devs are probably busy patting themselves on the back for the positive reviews they got so far...

review:
Nagyon élvezetes ! Különben is imádom és rajongója vagyok a tower defense játékoknak és végre találtam egy kedvencet. Mellesleg ez egy magyar fejlesztésü játék aminek örülök, hogy végre ilyeneket is látni. 
-MIndenkinek azt ajánlom, hogy NEHÉZ-HARD fokozaton játszon ! Mert az alap ! A könnyű és közepes módban az ellenfelek kevesebb életerővel indulnak, ami szerintem nem kihívás !
 
Remélem lesz Deathtrap 2 is !

Viszont ! Szerintem jobb lenne ha a következő részben a csapdákat a játékos saját maga helyezhetné el a pálya akármelyik részére így a játék sokkal szabadabb lehetne ! 

Ennek ellenére 10/9. Igazi Diablo 3 hentelés érzés a játék :) Tengernyi ellenfél !

author: {'steamid': '76561198298876519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1489087867}
review:
A good-looking but otherwise sub-par Tower Defense game

Those that played the Van Helsing series already know what this game's about: the minigame where your normal action hero keeps building traps and towers on predetermined assault lanes. So then one has to mention it's closest in aesthetics to Van Helsing III, the blandest and most fluff-generic of the trilogy. The setting is the Ink or the astral plane of the world.

The game has many options like the main game, with level progressions apparently going to at least 100 (I completed the campaign with my character at level 20, in 9 hours).

The game is occasionally visually impressive but rather badly organized and unintuitive. An example: there are three map systems that all work subtly differently (minimap, full map and teleporting map).

Rarely do I regret spending money (EUR 5 or so) on a cheap, discounted game. I do regret buying this one, but oh well. If this had been EUR 1-2, it would be priced fairly. Indeed, several superior Tower Defense games are: you can get the Kingdom Rush series discounted occasionally, for example. Other options I like are Last Hope and Prime Defenders.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073322414', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4493, 'last_played': 1708416111}
review: This game is very entertaining for those who are fans of Diablo-style games and/or tower defense games. HOWEVER, there is a glaring hole is the game's design. That hole is the unimaginative time-extender of grinding. If you are not a high enough level, do not have the gold required to switch your tower buffs before starting or lucky enough to get the runic tower buffs you need to beat a level, then you will have to grind a lower level, even if you have beat it on maximum difficulty, just to have an opportunity to beat the next level. I played this game to the penultimate level of campaign on tier 4 before running into this wall yet again and being unwilling to grind anymore. If it weren't for the grinding, I would give this game a 7.5/10, but with the in-built grinding, I give this game a 4/10. Do not waste your time. If you haven't played Sanctum 2, I would recommend that instead.

review: The blend of ARPG and turret defense works well for a while, giving you something to do besides watching your towers kill things, but at "Tier 3" (the 3rd time around the game) there are quite a few maps where turrets are almost useless (or you don't have money to buy them) and you must complete them solely with your character skills. author: {'steamid': '76561198055417402', 'num_games_owned': 1408, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1485803063}
review:
Not bad, a fun tower defence games that I had not heard of before. Reccomend this if youre really into the tower defence genre, however I would say to pick it up at 50%+ off.

Pros:
- Intresting and unique that it is a tower defence game with arpg elements in it, such as upgrading your abilities, traps and spending gold on better loot, also has "jungle" monsters that you can kill if you choose to earn more loot, which seems to be inspired from MOBA games, I thought this was a nice feat.
-Overall fun gameplay, you usually have a choice of 3-4 towers and the fact you can choose your abilities and what to spec into it allowed some diverse gameplay

Cons:
-Didn't personally like the voice lines or voice acting
-Bad Optimisation
-Lack of story (small complaint)
-Short
-Not worth full price, buy it on a sale

author: {'steamid': '76561197974976217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 7664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7206, 'last_played': 1485588038}
review:
Le jeu est vraiment un mixte entre un tower defense et diablo, c'est la meilleure description possible. À un certain moment, il devient par contre frustrant car trop difficile. Tu dois revoir tout ton système de trappe et ça à CHAQUE niveau car ce qui fonctionnais très bien pour 1 niveau, ne fonctionne plus du tout pour l'autre alors tu dois tout changer tes améliorations à CHAQUE niveau et ça j'avoue que ça deviens vite "gossant". Ça reste toujours un bon tower défense mais il aurait intérêt à diminuer un peu la difficulté ce qui enlèverais beaucoup de frustration.

   Malgré tout, je le recommande quand il tombe en spéciale à moins de $10, ça devient alors une aubaine.

J'ai rechanger mon évaluation maintenant que je sais qu'il y a 100 niveau. Je vous conseille de progresser en niveau en jouant les cartes et en demandant seulement du XP lorsque vous êtes bloqués. Quelques niveaux de plus feront toutes la différence. Aussi, ne vous gênez pas pour prendre 4 différentes abilités. Vous avez les boutons 1 à 4 utilisez les les 4 avant de progressez dans toutes autres choses. Même si vous utilisez 1 seul point dans ces abilités, ça fera toute la différence car les abilités utilisables avec raccourci sont toutes très puissantes même au niveau 1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121718704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1483680575}
review:
When a game has a very positive reaction by the numerous people playing it, you get excited to have it in your games library. When i got this, it was part of a bundle and i looked at the genre of Tower Defence and was uncertain; but boy was i wrong.

This is tower defence done right, and in a way that is fair to be sold on steam. For those who haven't played this particular game but other tower defence games; it is similar to Sanctum - just way more in depth in regards to your character development.

The skills/passives you can upgrade to get develop into many different variations of play and there are even three different classes.

The maps are well thought out, and even has a jungle (similar to a MOBA style) that once cleared stays dead and gives you more loot at the end although this is entirely optional.

The traps themselves differentiate themselves enough for them all to seem useful - except the spring trap.

This was a very pleasent surprise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011728053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 3772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1069, 'last_played': 1656645018}
review:
I very much enjoy this game!  Its a fun take on tower defense, with heros!  Usually I don't care for the 'micromanagement' of towers and units or a unit, especially when it requires direct control for attacking and using skills.  Having said this, Deathtrap manages to keep a good pace and the towers/traps don't have micro themselves, overall I find it to be a pretty well balanced game; sometimes you hit a point in the campaign and think 'how the &*@% am i supposed to do this differetly/better', especially trying to three star some maps, but challenge is part of the fun!  And I haven't hit an 'impossible' level........yet :P

I cannot speak to multiplayer or PvP as I have not played either, but as a single player game I do thoroughly enjoy it.  At the point of writing this, I have about 9 hours logged in the game.  If the hours logged end up showing 100+, which would be typical for me for a good TD (as long as there is enough content/replayability) I would definitely consider this a 'favorite TD' of mine.

TL; DR - its like a 2 dimensional version of 'Orcs Must Die!', but with a lot less freedom on where you can set traps and towers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073462948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1517963381}
review:
Лучшая Tower Defence игра в стиле тёмного фентези (и единственная) на данный момент. Обычно подобные игры являются инди проектами с рисованой графикой, а то и вовсе в стиле 8 битных игр, либо обладают несерьёзным сюжетом, а противники обычно нарисованы абы как, для галочки. Здесь же всё наоборот: перед нами серьёзная игра с тёмным, пугающим миром, детально прорисованными противниками в стиле Диабло 2 и Deathbreed (для тех, кто видел), атмосферной музыкой и великолепной системой "прокачки", которая не уступает полноценным РПГ играм. Да и чего ожидать от полноценного проекта, а не привычног онам инди? 
За прохождение миссий (карт), мы получаем золото, экипировку и ресурсы, необходимые для крафта и заточки вещей, а так же очки улучшений, коими мы и будем улучшать свой арсенал имеющихся ловушек (коих около 40, а улучшения разделены на 5 категорий для КАЖДОЙ ловушки), среди которых будут и башни, и ямы, и точки спавна существ. Некоторые карты обладают нестральными "лагерями" существ, уничтожение которых приносит дополнительную награду, словно в настоящей РПГ. Всего мы имеет 3 персонажа с абсолютно разным стилем игры и дополнительными бонусами для определённой группы ловушек. Имеется встроенный редактор, кооператив и даже ПвП режим (коий лично мне не нужен). Поразительная реиграбельность карт, имеющих несколько уровней сложности и дополнительные "тиры" внутри каждого, влияющие на качество и количество противников.
Вобщем, игра идеальна для любителей мрачного фентези, стимпанка, tower defenc'а, и всего связанного с этим. После просмотра вступительного ролика, прослушки музыки на подготовительном экране и старта карты аж мурашки по коже бегут (разумеется, если полностью погружаться в сюжет).Я редко даю оценку 10 из 10, но за неимением конкурентов в данной стилистике даю эти самые 10 из 10.

Ich bin zwar nur mit einem Cha Level 100 aber zu zweit mit einer Zauberin (Ich Tank), rasieren wir durch alle Level und haben eine Menge Spass. Man kann ein bisschen craften und im End-Game muss man ordentlich grinden um die god-like items auf zu rüsten, die selten droppen und hauptsächlich aus dem Shop gekauft werden, der sich alle 15min oder so aktualisiert. author: {'steamid': '76561197999564180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 10726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6686, 'last_played': 1484553479}
review:
Simple but a great Tower Defense, ARPG game. Only three classes, but they all are very different from each other. Pre-designated trap areas takes some of the variety and puzzle work out of some of the story missions, but it works for this game. Game can be slightly inconsistent with its difficulty level (story missions again); vast majority are easy but then you will have ones that will be insanely difficult out of no where. Traps are satisfyingly effective in their monster slaying and offer good variety for multiple builds. "Pro" tip: learn to love Essence Traps. 

Lots and lots of replay value with leveling (max level is 100), three classes, three types of gameplay (story, custom scenario, or endless) and RNG gear drops. Equally fun playing Co-Op and Single Player. Engine is the same one used with Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing, I have had zero crashes and zero bugs, fantastically developed. Bottom line, if you enjoy Tower Defense with ARPG mixed in, you will like this game.
