author: {'steamid': '76561198043886129', 'num_games_owned': 1781, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1545178170}
review:
Deathtrap is a surprisingly robust TD game with a deep progression system for both your character and towers. The gameplay is straightforward and easy to get the hang of but gets really challenging quickly and requires alertness and strategy to stay one step ahead. The built in tutorial gets you familiarized with the mechanics without any confusion and by the second or third level it's second nature. 

The ability to specialize both your character and the types of towers you use gives the game a feeling of personalization that is lacking in many 'trial and error' style TD games that, for me, get tiresome quickly. Deathtrap instead allows the player to utilize their own favorite abilities and towers that they've taken the time to develop in order to overcome the enemies. It feels much less 'puzzle' oriented than many TD games for this reason, because there is a lot of flexibility in how to win rather than figuring out what the developers wanted you to build and in which spot. This gives the game a lot of depth and even replayability because there are so many ways to build your arsenal of offense, not to mention three distinct character classes to use. 

There's also a loot system where you outfit your character with armor, weapons, and trinkets to further specialize your build. The armor upgrades are reflected cosmetically and it feels rewarding to observe your ascent up the ranks by looking more and more radical. There is a strong 'one more level' urge that pulls you forward because you're continually leveling up your character, towers, getting and crafting new armor and weapons and further personalizing your development as a 'guardian' as you play. You're always excited to see your new spell or tower upgrade in action and it drives you forward in a very well-paced and enjoyable gameplay loop. 

All in all, it's tough not to recommend Deathtrap, especially when it's so commonly on sale. Even at it's full price, the content is there to provide enough fun to justify spending the cash. If the idea of playing a tower defense game combined with an action RPG that has rewarding depth and character progression appeals to you, it's highly unlikely you'll regret picking this up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079136057', 'num_games_owned': 486, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1477697857}
review:
Довольно любопытный гибрид tower defence и action-rpg/Diablo-like hack-n-slash в сеттинге вселенной Ван Хельсинга. Прохождение миссий с отстройкой башенок, защитой базы от волн монстров. При этом игрок контролирует героя и может помогать своим башенкам различными скиллами/заклинаниями/набаффами. Присутствует шмот, прокачка, крафт, анлоки скиллов, вот это всё.
Сингл коротенький и уныловатый. В коопе, наверное, может заиграть новыми красками (жаль, никто из друзей в Deathtrap не играет - попробовать не довелось). Самая мякотка игры - в челленджах и закрытии всех карт на максимальной сложности, что реально сделать только в коопе, идеально продумав тактику прохождения миссии и обзаведясь топовым обвесом (для чего нужно изрядно погриндить).
Игра не супер-топ, но на пару-тройку вечеров занять может, особенно, если у вас есть друзья, с которыми можно потрайхардить челленджи в коопе.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970481922', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1516134144}
review:
One of the better Tower Defense games in my book. Co-op is fun and intense.
The element of progression for your skill and trap tree is easy to manage and customize and you instantly feel your "powers" rise if you do it right.
Also the RPG style inventory and crafting works ok, but you can't share items with others.
Did not expect anything from this game, but was positively surprised.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039016788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1480760466}
review: At about level 20 (2 or 3 hours in) you beat the game. Then it's basically just replaying the game at 'higher difficulties', aka boosting enemy health and handicapping where you can place towers. Oh, you used to place a tower at the corner? Well, that was too beneficial, now on higher difficulty you must place it 3 squares away and hope to hit jack squat. Worth $1.99 at most. I tried playing all 'three' classes to see if maybe was more fun but after beating the game 3 times and having to make coffee just to stay awake, it is all just trash. Just go play Sanctum instead. This game has 4 different types of towers, and only allows specific towers to be placed in very very very specific spots. Sanctum lets you place anywhere you want. This is the most linear tower defense designd.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007513026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1024, 'last_played': 1480465681}
review:
I'm a TD fan but I hadn't heard of this game until recently. I generally don't like the action style TD games as much, for some reason Orcs Must Die didn't appeal to me. But Deathtrap is great - excellent graphics, interesting a varied opponents, lots of things to upgrade.

So far the game balance has been good. Fortunately there are three difficulty levels, sometimes I get stuck on games that only have a single difficulty level. I'm playing at normal difficulty but often go back to previous levels to try and complete them on hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987324453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1535936085}
review: This game is one of the most enjoyable games I ve found! The tower defense element along with shooter and spells make it alot of fun to play. The look of the game is truely unique with almost a steam punk look in menus and alittle warhammer as well a rpg fantasy all rolled into one. Graphics and sound are great. the discussion forums are full of technical issues, but hopefully neocore will address them as they are able. I have had no problem with windows 10 running it, and only a problem exciting game on windows 7. On sale definetly worth trying!

review:
I grew up on the likes of Diablo and Titan Quest, while my time these days only allows for a quick paced round of Tower Defense. This game hits that sweet spot right in the middle. My wife, of which has a hard time picking up a lot of games, also enjoys this immensely, joining me in epic waves of monster killing fun.

The only downside I've found, which falls solely on my taste,  is that you are unable to place towers at will, instead you must put them in pre-designed locations along the path.

review:
Amazing, highly detailed tower defense. Three character classes, level up to 100, unlock new traps and upgrade them. Magic items can be found, bought or crafted. Great crafting system and character build with skill tree. 

This game looks a lot like Path of Exile. 

Update: after playing this game many times and for many hours, now it does not work on the same PC I have played it on several times. I have no idea why but I finally just uninstalled it and gave up on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005741042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1424425934}
review:
Pour les RPG-istes que nous sommes, s'il y avait un Tower Defense que je conseillerais avant tout, ce serait forcément Deathtrap, pour deux raisons : la première c'est que c'est un hybride qui comporte assez d'éléments RPG pour que vous soyez presque familiarisé avec le style de jeu, et la seconde c'est qu'il se présente comme un spin-off de la série des Van Helsing, que vous connaissez peut-être dans la catégorie des hack 'n' slash débordants d'énergie. Il est d'ailleurs présenté comme un hybride mi-tower defense, mi-action RPG, avec son héros qui joue un rôle dans l'univers.  Plus personnalisable que Defender Quest qui axait son potentiel sur le scénario, à vous de voir si le genre peut vous plaire, parce que le travail réalisé par Neocore est propre et mérite que l'on s'y attarde.  
Du coup, les RPG-istes que nous sommes trouverons forcément à redire sur cette idée que Deathtrap est un action-RPG.  On est très loin d'un Les Royaumes d'Amalur : Reckoning, alors dites-vous bien que c'est un Tower Defense avant tout. 

[url=http://www.rpgjeuxvideo.com/death-trap-a127285506] Le test complet [/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198006408236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1492367083}
review: The quickest description of this is Diablo Tower Defence. If that sounds interesting then you'll like this game. I haven't tried multiplayer on it yet, but I'm enjoying it greatly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017232245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3141, 'last_played': 1478972616}
review: I do recommend this game.  I'm about 55% of the way through and have enjoyed it.  But, then I hit Tier 3 level 4 and the game difficulty blew up.  I've gone through 29 maps on Hard with a little trouble hear and there, but with refined strategies that got me through.  Now this level - no chance.  I'm not even remotely close, despite 5 attempts with vastly different strategies.  I even went through some side quests to gain 10 levels, craft a bunch of more powerful gear and try again.  That got me about 2% closer.  On the discussion boards, I'm definitely not the first to have this problem.  The developers seem pretty smug and unhelpful, and don't seem to be considering nerfing this level a bit.  So, I'm done.  And that's fine - it was worth the $10 or so I paid for it.  But I thought a review might get the developers to consider a fix.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995993959', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1476349414}
review: Итересный тоауер дифенс, ставиш ловушки прокачиваешь их все как вобчном жанре таких игр. Но есть момент, еще есть персонаж которым Вы рубите всех нападающих. Важным моментом для меня было то что есть поддержка джойстика, падаю на диван и спокойно играю.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993567513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1468549028}
review:
Hero-based Tower defense that has RPG elements mixed in. Something like a third-person POV Orcs Must Die (hero-based TD) mixed with Diablo/Path of Exile (RPG elements like loot, spells, crafting, skill point upgrades, etc.). There are three archetypes of a hero that you can play: Sorceress (spellcaster), Mercenary (melee) and Marksman (ranged). I mainly played as the sorceress.

13 (+6 bonus levels) levels that you complete then repeat in 4 tiers of difficulty (harder versions of the same levels, sometimes with conditions/level-unique towers/optional objectives). You can earn up to 3 stars per level if you complete them on the hardest difficulty without dying/letting enemies through.

There seems to be no real story besides the opening and ending parts; each stage just has flavor text of descriptions of the area. In the sorceress' path, you're a defender to stop creatures that spawn from portals from reaching a gate that leads to your world. You keep moving towards the Inkheart for some unclear reason. There's a connection to the Van Helsing series but I haven't played those games so that's as far as my world knowledge took me.

Perspective can be a little annoying. Because it's an overhead camera and there are 
sometimes I clicked at an enemy with a ranged skill and it missed. Usually happened on inclines (like stairs). Best option was to click directly on the creature.
It was annoying to miss a lightning bolt and be forced to wait another cooldown cycle.

The first two tiers of difficulty allow you to experiment and find a playstyle you enjoy. I played a utility/cc style and was happy with that. But that gets thrown away in Tier 3, which is when the difficulty randomly skyrockets at the 4th level and you're forced to minmax and find specific builds that work for the level. It becomes quite a different experience; instead of an easygoing game, it becomes a hardcore minmax fail-unless-you-optimize game. I guess the developers figured that if you played the same levels 3 times already that you are looking for that hardcore experience with that steep difficulty curve.

I beat it by minmaxing certain skills, maximizing essence gain, and playing at 1/2 speed most of the time. Instead of essence multipliers being a bonus, it became pretty mandatory. Since every life mattered, I had to stare at the enemy bar to see when a new wave came (normal waves come silently) because they like to try and sneak in fliers while you slowly kill the tanky walkers. I ended up beating the stage with over half life left (missed some fliers because I stopped looking at the minimap/monsters-currently-on-map section while kiting) while my old build couldn't get past the first wave.

I think most people who like the idea of a Diablo-TD game can enjoy the first two difficulty tiers in this game. Then there's a sudden brick wall and hardcore gamers who like to optimize and figure out strategies will enjoy the challenge of the higher difficulty tiers.

What I'd like to see changed:
[list]
[*] A good map is very useful in TD games but this map falls short in some areas. It would be nice to be able to move (pan) the map/minimap around because the full map sometimes doesn't show the full area. The teleporter map shows more than the standard map. It also can be hard to see when enemies spawn in because the minimap can get cut off and the enemy icons are hidden by the portal icon.
[*] It would be nice if you could unlock the actual in-game camera and rotate/pan/zoom out. While some things turn transparent, on one level I found an angel statue with spread out wings that blocked the view of a significant portion of the screen. You can see health bars through the wings once the enemies are damaged but it's still a little annoying. A less optimal solution would be to make them transparent when enemies are nearby. Also, there are some maps where enemies can attack you from off screen because it's zoomed in a bit too much. You can see a lot more in a map when looking towards the top-right corner than the bottom-left corner of the screen.
[*] To be warned upon entering tier 3 that you need to minmax so that you're in the right frame of mind when playing the levels. The sudden change felt out of place. The first few levels weren't so hard compared to the previous tier but the 4th one was hard enough that I couldn't beat the first wave without an optimal setup.
[*] It's nice that the enemy spawn points are X'd out when there are no more enemies that are coming during that wave but it'd be nice if the red line showing enemy path also disappeared with it.
[*] To see the path that individual unit is taking by selecting an enemy unit. Only really matters if the wave splits up and has multiple paths.
[*] To have a keybind to cycle game speeds instead of just increase/decrease.
[*] To have a bigger radius for the auto-loot button so that you don't need to walk around and press the button multiple times for the same chest.
[/list]

Other random thoughts:
[list]
[*] On some levels there are creatures that you can kill for extra loot but you usually need to go away from the action to find them. You can start the wave next to them and then run back afterwards.
[*] For the sorceress, I found that one point in Teleport (a spell you can unlock later on) was so useful to cross gaps and get to urgent places to either spend essence on traps during waves or just to attack things yourself.
[*] Shift-attacking to hold ground is really useful to stop yourself from walking into the wave. Strafing in between attacks is necessary to avoid projectiles some enemies shoot.
[*] I ended up switching to WASD movement controls so my left hand could supplement mouse movement while my mouse hand did the rest.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198074691353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 952, 'last_played': 1469699732}
review:
Zaskakująco udane połączenie RPGa z Tower Defence. I to jeszcze okraszone dość dobrze możliwośćią grania w trybie kooperacji.
Połączenie wyszło na dobre. Gra się przyjemnie. Gra jako taka zrobiona dobrze.

Dla wybrednych - gdzieniegdzie występują bugi graficzne, czasem coś prześwituje, ale nie psuje to przyjemności z grania.
Polecam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003893784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1773, 'last_played': 1480028897}
review:
Played both solo and coop, it's an interresting small spin on Tower defenses. You can tank enemies or stun them with your character, or focus on specific tower builds.

There are 13 main missions and even though it might feel not enough, once you go into higher difficulties they provide different styles and twists to each level so it still feels fresh.

I wholeheartedly recommend this TD game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137798765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3057, 'last_played': 1482321352}
review:
제목은 데스트랩이지만 트랩은 그냥 덤이고 영웅이 메인인 영웅 디펜스다. 워크래프트 유즈맵에서 쉽게 볼 수 있는 영웅을 컨트롤하는 타워디펜스를 생각하면 된다.

3명의 캐릭터와 25개의 타워, 레벨이 100까지 있고 가장 높은 등급의 아이템은 10강을 해서 총 14개의 옵션을 붙일 수 있다. 또 무한모드와 각종 패널티를 이용한 세세한 난이도 조절 등등 파고들만한 요소를 매우 많이 만들어두었다.

문제는 게임이 만들다 말았다는 것. 스테이지는 13개 뿐이며 나중에 패치된 보너스 스테이지도 7개뿐이다. 레벨은 더럽게 안오르는데 저 스테이지들을 돌고 돌고 또돌고 하다보면 진절머리가 난다. 치트를 권장한다.

DLC 메뉴가 있는것을 보면 DLC가 예정되어 있었던 듯 싶지만 반응이 안좋았는지 DLC따위 없다. 유저가 적으니 코옵은 친구와 하는 게 아니라면 있으나 마나고 유저가 직접 만든 맵을 플레이 가능하지만 역시 유저가 없으니 맵도 적다. 그리고 보상을 받으려면 결국 공식맵으로 플레이해야 한다. 

타워 시스템에도 심각한 문제가 있다. 일단 타워나 트랩을 정해진 자리에만 설치 가능하다. 문제는  트랩의 종류마저도 제약이 있다는 것이다. 트랩은 총 15종, 타워는 10종인데 소환계, 마법계, 물리계 등등 5가지 특성에 따라서 분류된다. 특정 위치에는 정해진 특성의 타워만 설치 가능하다. 때문에 얼음 타워와 트랩으로 도배하고 얼음계열 데미지 강화 스킬을 쓴다던가 하는 식의 전략은 사용이 어렵다. 영웅의 스킬중에 특정 계열의 타워나 특정 속성의 데미지 등등을 강화하는 스킬이 많은데 그래놓고 왜 이런 식으로 제약을 둔건지 모르겠다.

타워의 강화 역시 문제다. 만렙 기준으로 타워 레벨은 9단계, 타워 패시브는 21레벨까지 투자가 가능하다. 포인트가 어마어마하게 들지만 효율 역시 어마어마하게 차이난다. 근데 타워 포인트는 첫 스테이지 클리어와 퀘스트 수행으로만 준다. 13개의 스테이지를 4티어까지 다 깨고 서브퀘스트도 다 깨면 더 안준다. 때문에 한 영웅이 7~8개의 타워만 운영해야 한다. 때문에 전략 역시 확 줄어든다. 타워마다 기능이 다른데 결국 범용성이 높은 타워에 몰빵해야 하기 때문이다.

여기서 끝이 아니다. 갈수록 적들의 피통은 어마어마해지고 소환 타워의 몹들은 순삭당하기 일쑤다. 근데 영웅은 풀셋 기준 옵션만 70개를 둘둘 두르고 있다. 마법사마저 피통이 어마어마한데 저항력이 높아서 안죽는다. 평타 데미지는 수천이고 스킬은 수만의 데미지를 입힌다. 타워는 높아야 천단위 데미지다. 높은 난이도로 갈수록 지을 수 있는 타워의 수도 적다. 결국 영웅만 개고생이다. 타워든 트랩이든 그냥 잡몹에게 슬로우나 걸어주는 셔틀일 뿐이다.

사실 데스트랩은 그냥저냥 할 만한 수준이다. 그런데 가격이 더럽게 비싸다. 타워 디펜스에는 명작이 많다. 킹덤 러쉬도 있고 디펜스 그리드도 있고 풍선타워 디펜스도 있고 플랜트 앤 좀비도 있다. 모두 스팀에서 구매 가능하다. 그러니 이건 거르자.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993213833', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1106, 'last_played': 1638568927}
review: Not really sure when or how I ended up purchasing this game, but I didn't even install and give it a try until recently, and I'm blown away by the hidden gem I had been sitting on for a long time.  Big fan of the ARPG genre with games like Diablo, Titan Quest, Van Helsing (same developer as Deathtrap) and many others, and a big fan of the Tower Defense genre, with my most of my time in the Dungeon Defender series, I was extremely happy to see a really nice combination of the two.  I would highly recommend this if you're remotely interested in both the ARGP and TD genres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018476373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 1693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1693, 'last_played': 1477396536}
review: I was initially drawn to Deathtrap for its fantasy theme. I am playing as a Sorceress, so I don't know what the other two classes are like to play but the combat and tower interation leaves no dull moments during the waves of enemies.  The loot and levelling up system is rewarding enough and having played through the solo campaign once I am pleasantly surprised to find  myself wanting to keep playing the new challenges, so this replay value is something not all tower defense games have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004711546', 'num_games_owned': 706, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 1616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 940, 'last_played': 1478137711}
review:
This game is pretty good. It's a mix of tower defense and RPG. Though it has the good parts of both worlds it also has the worst.

Pros:
3 classes with 3 slightly different mechanics.
About 30 towers.
RPG like combat.
Ability to download player made maps.

Cons:
Marksmans mechanics requires you not be in combat to recharge the focus you need to use skills. This makes playing him much less enjoyable as you constantly have to run away from combat if you need to use skills.
Crafting is worthless, it's completely random and 95% of the time you'll make something worse that you already have or what drops.
Some towers are much better than the rest making. Making the rest largely useless. The ranger tower is an example. It's a summon tower with huge range, good damage, and an upgrade to have the archers dodge 45% of attacks giving it good survival. The other summon towers don't even come close in my opinion.
Not many default maps.
Not many skills, most upgrades are just buffs to the other skills or passives.

ANNOYANCES:
You can't adjust the camera angle, making some areas really annoying to fight in since you can't see that well.
CLICK TO MOVE! Damn this. You can move with the wasd as well but click to move can NOT be turned off. And you need to click on people to attack. So a great deal of time when you try to attack you end up moving on the map. These actions share a button map too so it's not like you can slot them to different buttons. Really frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961267416', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1467088869}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052386399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 5500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3634, 'last_played': 1477018390}
review:
Deathtrap is a tower defense ARPG based on the tower defense part of the Van Helsing series.  If you liked that part of Van Helsing, you'll probably like this.  The difference is that there is no open world here; the game is played in progressive stages where you get a set amount of essence (the main resource) at the beginning of each to build and upgrade towers, and you get more within each stage from killing enemies.  Also like Van Helsing, you still play a character of one of three classes, get gold, loot, experience at the end of each stage, and upgrade points for completing each stage depending on the difficulty and how well you did, as well as for completing quests within each stage.  The character development is fairly similar to Van Helsing; you get three skill points per level to spend on class skills.  The upgrade points are separate and upgrade your traps individually.  Both can be respecced for gold, and there is also a store in between levels.


Pros:  

+There is a lot of content (13 stages x 4 tiers, the same map on a different tier isn't just higher level versions of the same stuff, but a completely different layout of traps, enemies, and quest objectives.)  There are also optional scenario-only maps and player-made maps.  Scenarios are stages where you are able to set certain difficulty modifiers in exchange for increased gold, exp, and loot.

+Decently interesting skill synergy between the character skill upgrade and trap upgrade points system.

+Relatively unique game; there aren't many tower defense games that have as much focus on character growth.  Dungeon defenders is the only similar game I can think of.

Cons:  

-The experience system.  Any map more than a level or two below your current level gives no experience at all.  This is particularly annoying given that players will probably be going back to several stages because they were unable to complete it on hard, complete a quest, or otherwise get all the upgrade points initially.  Scenario mode gives almost no experience, even with the +90% exp difficulty modifiers on, regardless of which map you use.  Endless mode gives fair experience for the first few waves, but then exponentially too much experience after that.  Playing to wave 8 gave me about 60k xp.  To wave 25, gave me 700k exp (leveled from 81 to 90).  To wave 36, 1.8 million exp (leveled from 50 to 80).  The maximum level is 100.

-Some stages are just too long.  Earlier stages only take a few minutes, some later ones take 25-40+.  Endless mode should have an option to start at any wave you've reached before, as it takes several hours (even at x2 speed) of just waiting to reach the higher waves otherwise, or alternatively have a much higher speedup function.  A high level character can get all the essence they need to fully build out a map in one or two waves, and then do nothing for 20-30+ waves until the enemies get strong enough that they need to play.

TL;DR overall, I would rate 8/10.  Tweak the exp system so that lower level maps have maybe a penalty but not a strict 0% cutoff, make endless mode exp linear and not exponential, and make scenarios give a lot more exp (in line with doing a current level map + modifier), and it would be better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000623055', 'num_games_owned': 1316, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1471783068}
review:
The game is advertised to work on OSX, yet I never was able to finish a single map, the game keeps crashing.

I asked for help on the steam forums AND the neocore forums with crash logs, behavior and attempted fixes a month ago and never got an answer.

I spent so much time trying to get this fixed that I am now over 2h of gameplay and therefore can not ask for a refund.

If you are on OSX, DO NOT buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165561778', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 4593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4593, 'last_played': 1473662451}
review:
If you expect a challenge from the games you play then this is a game for you - it's hard, but more of a challenge than being near impossible to play. I'd guess that a lot of people might submit to rage quits and hatred towards some aspects as the missions progress, but that's what's great about this game - you build your hero and invest in the traps you want to upgrade, and you should choose the right ones for specific situations. There's different ways to achieve victory, so it's also based on reflex and skill.

To those getting stuck, here's a few tips that are pretty much essential:

- the ice trap, although not very helpful damage-wise, is one of the most useful ground traps when upgraded (and you don't need to invest in nothing more than the slowing upgrade) - slowing your enemies down gives you a huge advantage in pretty much any situation.

- learn how to generate essense effectively (upgrade the essense floor trap and use it early to collect essense for later waves, invest in the skill that gives you more starting essense).

- the gun tower is OP, so keep it your main tower weapon until you get the Olympus Tower.

- you can respec your traps, and should do it when you run out of points for upgrade; some traps become obsolete and there's no point in keeping them upgraded. The purpose of the gold you collect in the game is pretty much mainly to allow you paying for respecing your skills and traps.

- improve skills wisely. Focus on lowering enemy defense to certain kinds of attacks (especially the main ones) so that big creatures lose their defense against getting hit. Make your main attacks more powerful and be sure to have mana regen set in a way that lets you use power skills without much delay.

- at some points you might find it that it's almost impossible to fight off waves of creatures or that they are too powerful for you to take them on. That's because your level is too low. You need to level up, which is fairly simple and becomes available once you get the "endless" option for completing levels. The more waves you take on in the levels that reward you with XP, the more XP you get. This way, you can get ridiculous amounts of XP - it can be a small amount for a few levels and over 100 000 for reaching wave 12 or so, but over a 1 000 000 XP (yes, MILLION) if you complete over 30 waves.

- The Olympus Tower is probably the most powerful direct damage trap in the game when you lower its cooldown. You can do it both directly in the trap upgrade page and also as an in-match upgrade. Combined with the +90% damage upgrade it's devastating at the highest upgrade level for damage and speed.

Deathtrap gives you an amazing experience of a very dynamic mix between tower defence and a hack and slash game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965972936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1472187138}
review:
Um Tower defence interessante com elementos de RPG e um Design meio gótico.
Pros:
-Gráficos agradaveis
-Jogabilidade interessante
-Traps com um bom design
-Niveis variados de desafio
-Maneiras diferentes de jogabilidade

Contra:
-História praticamente inexistente
-Não pode colocar as Traps onde você deseja, somente em locais pré determinados.
-Inimigos parecem todos os mesmos, mas não são

Dou um 8/10, falta pouco para ser um dos melhores TDs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033717350', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1718, 'last_played': 1599141397}
review:
Very nice game for people who love looting and leveling like Diablo and killing monsters with towers and traps like Orcs must die.

Pros:
+ 3 Characters with skill-tree (rpg elements)
+ Many different traps, which can be boosted in several ways
+ High replayability of levels due to the option to make it more difficult for more xp or loot
+ Playable with Controller (but inventory control is horrible)
+ Coop play is possible
+ Satisfyingly popping Monsters

Cons:
- Classes are a bit unbalanced, in my opinion the Marksman is way better than the other classes
- You can place traps only on certain spots, which makes the game quite scripted
- You have way too much gold in the game which cant be spend on important things, because the equipment you can buy in the shop is mostly crap and there is no other use for money. (Except resetting your skilltree which is ridiculously cheap)

All things considered is the game a rather good tower defense game with many rpg elements.
Due to the good replayability the game will entertain you for a good while, when you like to loot&level!

review:
RPG + tower defense + leveling up your character + epic loot + gearing your character + strategy + skill trees + side quests + great graphics + smooth and epic game play = shut up and take my money!!!

All jokes aside this game is really great. It's different. A good different. Tired of the same ol games that do nothing but remind me of other games Iv play yet not adding anything new to catch my attention and keep me playing. When I play this game I think, man I haven't ever played anything like this before. Iv been looking for something like this and I'm glad I bought it. Definitely one of my favorites. It's unique. Totally worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146811540', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1494426399}
review:
Да,кто-то сейчас скажет,якобы какого хрена ты так мало наиграл,ещё и обзор пишешь.Но всё таки,даже этого времени мне хватило.
Эта игра это что-то новое для меня в жанре TD,т.е Tower Defens,тем более в ней присутствует жанр РПГ и графика глаз не режет.
Однако,управление немного корявое,так и не разобрался как перейти с управления мыши на клавиатуру,так как управлять персонажем очень трудно используя мышь,и очень долго ищет CO-OP
Однако,игра мне понравилась,если бы мне сказали оченить её по 10 бальной шкале,я бы поставил 8:)
Советую всем поиграть,деньги потратил не зря:)

author: {'steamid': '76561198044709703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 2278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2278, 'last_played': 1467561530}
review:
Picked this up during a sale because it looked interesting. As a mixure of tower defense and ARPG it seemed to strike a decent balance between the two. Its a fun co-op game, with three classes to choose from. Though those classes are pretty generic (melee, ranged, and magic). The skill variety wasn't anything to get excited about but it provided enough to make a unique character if you wanted to. 

There are however numerous bugs in the game, some of them game breaking. And the balancing of your character compared to the monsters is grossly out of whack (characters are far too strong). It definetly feels like the game could have used much more polish. 

Overall though its a fun game to play through with some friends, it doesn't have much replayability so I'd recommend picking it up on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033865282', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 3382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3015, 'last_played': 1471599355}
review:
Deathtrap самая лучшая из мною виденных Tower Defense игр на данный момент. Ни много, ни мало. Если вам надоели все эти мультяшные ТДшки, то эта игра для вас - ошметки, кровища и крики просто повсюду :) Ну что-то я слишком кровожадно описал, все не так страшно на самом деле. Помимо ТД составляющей, здесь есть и не хилая РПГ часть геймплея. У вас есть герой, которому с повышением уровня прокачиваются навыки, падают\покупаются\крафтятся шмотки. Можно найти (шмотки падают после завершения уровней) уникальные вещи, которые потом можно улучшить. Много-много всего интересного в этой игре. Отличная реиграбельность, например, я проходил игру год назад, сейчас поставил, чтобы записать получасовой ролик с геймплеем на youtube, а в итоге залип на целый день)) Очень советую, мой итог 9 из 10, один балл снял за то, что разработчики забросили игру, и она уже очень давно не обновлялась, и вряд ли будет) Но может быть увидим следующую часть!?

https://youtu.be/Bc9ninOa0Xk

author: {'steamid': '76561198007665656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 7836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6360, 'last_played': 1472670432}
review:
Imagine a world that feels like Diablo in terms of look, loot, and character progression, but it's entirely a tower defense game. That's pretty much Deathtrap. This is kind of a lenghty and boring write up that goes into detail with my opinions on stuff; bottom line, it's a cool TD / ARPG game.


It's a 'pre-placed' tower build location type of TD game with predetermined paths. You can play single player, coop, or pvp, [though I had trouble connecting to a friend for coop, not sure if that was our setups or an issue with the game]. Aside from each TD level, there is no world to walk around in or towns to visit, just a menu map and tabs for crafting, the store, skills, bestiary and what not. Not much story except a few cutscenes but I skip em anyway. 

There are 3 classes, and skill trees for player skills, traps, and world effects which are all fairly extensive. It has 25 different traps, split into 5 classes, and the build markers will be class specific so you can only choose from one of those 5 types of traps for that marker. This is pretty limiting and a bit of a buzz-kill but it's honestly balanced well. You'll be doing most of the killing with your skills, not your traps most of the time, but it's a pleasingly good balance.
There are something like 15 maps with 4 tiers of difficulty, and then scenarios with different difficulties and enemies mixed in for each map. Also this game has a level editor and is on the Workshop so you can find more player-friendly maps there where you can just stack up tons of traps and watch the chaos go down. 

Item grinding is important, like any good diablo-esque game, and once you get the Godlike items it's quite fun adding a LOT of upgrade stats to them one at a time. Also, each trap has 2 slots (usually dmg & cooldown) which can be upgraded with tokens which drop along with other loot and are a major part of the customization. For better or worse most of time the best stuff you will buy instead of waiting for a good drop. There is magicfind and goldfind on items but it's kind of meh in my experience. 

I've found the Sorc to be easy mode, the Merc to be pretty good, and the Marksman to be gimped. The marksman may be better for coop as he has some good traps buffing. I love trap-heavy builds, but unfortunately the marksman just can't succeed this way on his own, at least up to mid game where I got. in fact the only build I could find success with him is with his blue death beam thing, which is an awkward looking skill for a hunter type character. It shreds, but if you dont max out that one skill, he kind of sucks for solo play. 


The graphics are great, once I got my 970 and turned everything to max, it looked even better, and the game runs well- alt tabbing and stuff is no problem. There is one crashing glitch where the game ctd if you try to craft something you dont have the blueprints for, something like that; it's been forever since that happened, it may have been patched anyway. Other than that, the game is entirely bug-free for me.


There are a couple of strong [b]negatives[/b] which hurt the game. The game has a few points where difficulty spikes MASSIVELY. There arent a lot but when you get there, it could make you want to quit the game. The level designers seem to do what many (bad) tower defense level designers do - which is get bored, and force you to change your style & build entirely, in order to progress. And I hate that. There were a couple of points in the game that took a massive retooling, and were still SO hard,(that stupid one with the flyers, you know what I'm talking about devs) and what's more, there are very few places to increase your experience & trap levels along the way - you can grind gold & items but NOT experience & trap points, so you have to do the alternate Scenarios & Endless levels which are very few in number in some early - midgame spots. Also as mentioned before, it's a shame that the tower placements are pre-determined and pretty restricted in terms of what you can do, rarely can you concentrate them into a killing zone for instance. You can, but you have to do it -just so-. 


If you can get past these few roadblocks, you should find a fun ARPG style grindfest to grind through at your leisure. Worth 50% off price, and would be worth full price if not for the couple of negatives.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 690, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1471401455}
review:
This is pretty much just copy pasted TD minigame from the Van helsing games. It has same graphics, looks, and many of same traps. The upgrade system is pretty boring, just increasing damage and small little incremental chances of effects or stat boosts. Your character learns a few abilities, but mostly you just hold down left mouse to attack. The items you get only drop at end and are very boring and generic. The game isn't very long, with 13 levels. You can't path or maze, or even choose whre to set towers. There are predetermined spots you can place from a preselected type of tower. You can upgrade those towers. There's really no story. There is co-op and vs, but nobody plays. There are a decent number of towers, but they unlock very slowly. The game is techically sound, and has good combat feedback and enemy death animation. Its an ok game, but nothing too special, due to lack of openess and ability to be a true "TD" game like in WC3. 

6.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010267364', 'num_games_owned': 1213, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1481771276}
review:
Here's a game by Neocore, the creators of the Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing series. If you haven't played those, they're pretty decent hack and slash games in the vein of Diablo - and also the reason why Deathtrap exists. In the first game of the trilogy there were a few sidequests based around a tower defense minigame, where you used Van Helsing, his ghost companion Lady Katarina, and an outpost's arsenal of traps to defend your lair. They were a neat diversion, and proved popular enough to get expanded on in the sequels, and get its own spinoff title.

Deathtrap takes place in the same universe as Van Helsing, across a series of fortresses found in the Ink, a general otherwordly dimension you often visit for one reason or another. They were built to defend the human realm from the monsters found within, and you play as an adventurer who for whatever has decided to take up that task now. These are one of three classes: the close-quarters, tanky Mercenary, the fragile, spell-hurling Sorceress, or the ranged, hit-and-runner Marksman. All have their own skill trees, some of which are your standard ARPG stuff of passive bonuses and attacks, while others boost your traps. They also have their own dedicated upgrades, which are either unlockable boosts for them in the levels or passive stuff which is less potent but always active.

The levels play out largely the same as they do in Van Helsing, save for your character probably not having the array of skills he can. You're still able to contribute, but the towers will be the brunt of your offense. Most of them are lifted from their parent game, and include guns, spikes, burning floor tiles and even pits of monsters who fight for you. A lot of them enemies are also most of what you fight in Van Helsing, and have the same qualities such as resistances, auras that buff other enemies, and going berserk at low health.

This all makes sense given that you're in the same universe as the games that came before, but it still makes Deathtrap come across as a bit of a hand-me-down title. An expensive one, too, as it retails for twenty dollars when not discounted, five more than the Van Helsing games. Not that those games are bad or that this one is; I had fun playing them and so far Deathtrap is some decent fun. But it doesn't exactly stand on its own, and so far I haven't done much I didn't do in Final Cut. If there was anything you didn't like about the combat in that, such as the combat lacking a bit of punch, that would still apply here I think. Progression also seems to be about the same as in its big brother, which seems like a bit of a problem since you're only given new equipment, gold to buy it, or materials to craft things at the end of every level. You can get extra chests in some levels by killing optional enemies during waves, but it's not a huge boost.

Deathtrap also seems like it's a bit of a short game, with only thirteen levels, four of which I've finished in about two hours. There are higher difficulties for them the game encourages you to build your character up for, but it's overall not a grand adventure like Van Helsing was. It's probably a bit unfortunate they linked the two games together in so many ways, because this isn't a bad title at all, if you wanted more in that vein but wanted to take a break from Final Cut or whichever game you were on it'd be fine for that. But if you didn't like them, or don't much care for hack and slashes in general, this might not be the one to change your mind. Either way, I'd get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184395153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1471147269}
review:
1週目終了。
タワーディフェンスとしての面白さは及第点？

良い所
　罠を設置してモンスターが死ぬのを眺めてニヤリできる。

悪い所
　罠でモンスターを倒すためにはプレイヤーはモンスターの視界の外に居る必要がある？
　　それってモンスターが罠で死んでいくことを見れないんですけど、、、
　　モンスターが罠で死んでいくところをニヤニヤ見るのがこの手のゲームの楽しみ方じゃないの？
　ピタゴラススチッチ的な罠が仕掛けられない？
　　テレポートで同じ罠を何回もループさせるとか、トランポリン的な罠で溶岩に叩き落とすとかしたいのにできない。
　後半描画処理が間に合わなくなると盛大にコマ落ちする。
　　この手のゲームならコマ落ちじゃなくてすべてのコマを表示してスロー再生のようになったほうが良いように思う。
　　モンスターがいきなり数メートルも移動するとプレイヤーキャラクターによる攻撃ができない。
　英語が苦手なのでよくわからないがモンスターに火、氷、毒、物理などの耐性の有無などがもっとわかりやすくなっているとよい。



GTX 1070 
Intel i5-4690 3.50GHz

author: {'steamid': '76561198284987275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1469487057}
review:
I usually like playing tower defense games, but the added 3D, 3rd person roaming part of the game takes away from the experience. The visuals are great, but the gameplay is lacking due to the reason above. It is often difficult to move around the map with a mouse/keyboard which means you can't get to the towers you want to upgrade easily. It requires you to click and hold to move your character, who doesn't move very quickly. Using a controller helps, but also limits the number of actions you can do.

It didn't turn out to be the game I expected. I wouldn't personally recommend this game to my friends, so I don't feel comforable recommending it to all of you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064734868', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1469649383}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031180632', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 3136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2874, 'last_played': 1561916590}
review:
Deathtrap gehört zu den Tower Defense Spielen wo man einen steuerbaren Helden besitzt. Im Gegensatz zu den meisten anderen TD-Spielen mit Helden wie Kingdom Rush, muß man hier seinen Helden nicht nur bewegen, sondern auch die Attacken ausführen. 
Es ist fast schon ein Hybrid aus Tower Defense mit Diablo oder Torchlight.
Das Spiel hatte ich schon länger auf der Wunschliste und es war schon öfters im Angebot, trotzdem habe ich es erst jetzt gekauft, da ich von der Turmkomponente nicht viel erwartete. Es ist wesentlich besser als ich erwartet hatte.
Für den Helden stehen 3 Klassen zur Auswahl: Söldner, Zauberin und Scharfschütze. Der Held levelt und besitzt eine Ausrüstung, bessere Ausrüstung erhält man durch Missionen oder Craften.
Bei der Verteilung der Skillpunkte ist man frei, ob man sie für den Helden oder die Fallen einsetzen will.
Der Weg der Gegner kann nicht beeinflusst werden und es können nur bestimmte Bauplätze genutzt werden. Es gibt sehr viele schöne und unterschiedliche Türme und Fallen.
Eine gute Strategie muss die Kombinationseffekte berücksichtigen, z.B. reduziert eine Giftfalle auch die physikalische Wiederstandskraft, dies erleichtert es Türmen mit physikalischem Schaden und dem Söldner.

[u]Kleine Macken[/u]
Ein paar Achivements funtkionieren nicht mehr und ich hatte manchmal einen Absturz, wenn ich das Spiel im Hauptmenü ordentlich verlassen wollte, aber ansonsten ist das Spiel stabil. Die Entwickler scheinen das Spiel nicht mehr weiter zu pflegen.

[u]Fazit[/u]
Sehr guter Mix aus Tower Defense mit Action-RPG, der mir viel Spass machte.
Die bezahlten 5€ waren ein guter Preis.

Mehr Empfehlungen (Schwerpunkt Tower Defense Spiele):
http://store.steampowered.com/curator/8896126-Gametests-and-Videos

author: {'steamid': '76561198045639343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1468096118}
review:
I don't know what's up people's behinds about this game. I always avoid playing anything that looks like an RTS, and only kind-of like Tower Defense games, BUT: this game is STILL awesome to me. I got this on sale, yeah, but I just played it for 5 hours before I had to force myself to quit and go outside. It would take less than 2 hours to earn that at work, so even if I paid full price it's well worth it.

I literally only opened this just to see what to categorize it as in my library and ended up playing for 5 hours straight... that should tell you how encapsulating this game is! Great combination of "MOBA" feel with "Tower Defense", with upgrades that feel good, no hand-holding (play on hard mode, it's not that hard and it's more challenging and fun!)

I am mad that I have to put this down for a while. Can't wait to come back and play some more. I played the sorceress class and it's great fun due to the spell casting and all that.

I don't know, yeah, try to get it on sale, but don't let the red "Mixed" fool you, because I'm a picky gamer, I hate almost everything, and I had a blast. Maybe the game got lucky with me and it will suck for you, but idk, I had a great time and it will take another 35 hours at least before I can even feel like I'm partially "spent" on the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096542490', 'num_games_owned': 2340, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1468086055}
review:
准备的来说，这是我的第一篇测评。为什么选择这么个冷门的游戏呢？是因为我个人最喜欢的游戏类型是ARPG类和塔防类。碰巧这次夏促探索到了这款游戏，便抱着试试看的心态买了下来。

先总结一下这个游戏吧

+塔防类游戏中优质的画面&容量大小- -
+支持多人合作以及对抗
+众多的RPG要素及道具收集

-没有官方中文（连补丁也很难找到最新的，steamcn上需要500积分才能下）
-游戏帧数不够稳定
-打久了感觉有些重复，千篇一律


其实没有汉化问题也不是很大，玩过暗黑类和塔防类游戏的话稍微适应一会就行了，无非就是类似WAR3的TD类RPG地图。

防御塔一共分为五个系，地面塔，陷阱塔，魔法塔，物理塔，佣兵塔。而每个塔又分为2个被动升级项和3个主动升级项。个人比较推荐地面系的火焰塔，魔法系中的凤凰炮塔，物理系的枪塔，佣兵系的弓箭塔等等。

英雄的话个人比较推荐近身的战士，因为一来可以堵住路给炮塔提供输出环境，二来普攻和闪现比较好用=。=技能的话推荐加普攻和陷阱增强，闪现一级即可，被动点满溅射和杀敌加经验的，后期技能还没解锁，暂时不是很清楚。。。

个人打分7分，属于小品游戏里面比较有意思的，推荐各位试试

author: {'steamid': '76561197971291045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1469812072}
review:
An excellent tower defense game with a Diablo/Gauntlet-esque hero. Very tempo-based with satisfyingly frantic moments moments and lulls right when you need them.  

It reminds me in a very good way of a Kingdom Rush (gameplay-wise--storywise, it's in that shadowy, richly allusive vein of, well, the first Diablo), only in 3d. The hero mechanic implemented exactly how you'd want it to be. 

Levels are well-designed to be tough, but a fair tough. Lots of brass rings for you to try to grab--optional environmental enemies, for example--but it's all very understated. There aren't so many as to detract from the main game, just to provide a momentary jaunt and make you feel like a badass. 

Lots of good progression--you can upgrade your towers and your skils, and of course there's equipment. There's a lot of depth without feeling overwhelming. (Well, it's a whole lot for the first map or two, but you can quickly see how the pieces come together.) 

I haven't tried co-op but I'm haranguing my friends to get on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998118312', 'num_games_owned': 2100, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 2637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2525, 'last_played': 1467463125}
review:
Rating 7.5/10
Overview: Isometric/ Action RPG/ Tower Defence

The Good:

+ One of the better looking tower defense games on Steam

+ 3 character classes; Sorcerer(Magic), Mercenary(Melee), Marksman (Range). Each one has their own skill trees. Some skills focus on making your character or traps stronger. 

+ Scenario mode allows you to customize the difficulty by selecting from 9 different categories i.e. more monster health, faster monsters, less damage etc. 

+ Endless mode

+ Each level has 4 different tiers. Each tier changes the tower placement or conditions of the map providing good incentive for replaying levels. 

+ Completing levels, rewards you with experience and loot allowing you to upgrade your character and traps.

+ 25 different towers/ground traps between 5 different categories  


The Average:

The game features controller support however for a much better and easier experience it is strongly recommended to play with a mouse. Certain functions can only be done with mouse. 

The game does a poor job explain how certain things work in the game. I had to go online many times to check for answers that should have been explained in game. 

In each level you can only place certain types of towers in predefined places. Unlike other tower defense games, this removes a lot of strategy associated with tower placement. This game is more about which skills and traps you invest experience points into rather than where to place towers which in my opinion takes a lot of the fun out of the game.  



The Bad:

- Multiplayer is dead which is sad because some of the multiplayer modes seem really fun 

- The game only has 13 campaign levels and 1 or 2 bonus levels. There just isn’t a whole lot of content here. 

- glitchy achievements, some achievements will not unlock and the ones that do, require some grinding. 

Conclusion:

A game that does a really decent job of combining action rpg elements with tower defense. The problem however is that the game is lacking content compared to other games in the genre. If you like tower defense games, I would recommend this game at a discount. I would love to see the ideas expanded upon in a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073706313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1501954185}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970676127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1638833783}
review:
So I don't usually like writing reviews, but I was sort of blown away by this game.  First of all, the reason I bought it is because it's a tower defense game. I love tower defense, and the genre is getting pretty thin. Defense Grid, Kingdom Crashers, it just seems like nothing fresh has really happened td games in a while. So when I first played Deathtrap, I was very surprised. 

First of all it looks great, the graphics are very nice. It has a very Gothic feel. There are some graphical glitches in the game, specifically when you kill some of the larger enemies, there is some screen tearing. I have yet to investigate how to fix that issue, but small issues are okay with me as long as they don't completely interrupt gameplay. 

Speaking of gameplay, that's the strength of this game. It's sort of a mashup between Diablo and just about any other tower defense game. You have your character, you can choose from three, who can run around the battlefield and attack enemies, give power ups to towers, and they can also fight ghosts that appear on the battlefield to help you unlock better gear. Speaking of which, another cool part of the game is the leveling up of towers, and the equipment aspect. When you're in between levles, you can improve your equipment through crafting, finding equipment after fights, and purchasing items in the shop. 

Perhaps one of the best things about the game is the towers themselves. It's very satisfying to watch these towers cut down a group of enemies as they walk along the predetermined path. I won't go into all the different trap types, suffice it to say, there are many, and they are all enjoyable to play.

The long and the short here is that these two elements brought together work beautifullly, seemlessly. It's like they were meant for each other and someone finally pulled it off well. If you like td games, you need to try this one. Worth every penny!

author: {'steamid': '76561197976417227', 'num_games_owned': 796, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1611529771}
review:
I encountered several problems using the game in 4K (Ver. 1.0.6). Teleporters not working properly, monsters disappear from the screen and other small problems. I opened a ticket for one of these issue on the bug tracker Mantis (Ticket ID 0001265) and after several weeks without any feedback from developers, to my surprise, I find myself with the ticket canceled by this official explanation: "4k resolution is not supported, so there could be some side effects when set manually."

Unfortunately, 4K resolution is NOT CONFIGURED BY HAND but at the first start after the installation has been set AUTOMATICALLY from the game itself. The 2160p resolution (as several other higher to 1080p) is also available in the dropdown menu of settings. No hack or tweak was made to set the resolution.

A response of this kind is not acceptable.

Obviously the engine used on the game natively supports this resolution but the developer has not bothered to check what happened in the case was set to a resolution of this type by the user, or at least could have LOCK incorrect / unwanted settings.

It seems that the developer has decided not to further support this game and this is his right. But in my opinion does not make us look good in comparison to the thousands of INDIE games developers always available to deal with their users in order to refine and improve their products.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048002635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1467090148}
review:
[b]A unique take on tower defense[/b]

[b]5/10[/b]

[b]Worth the price?:[/b] Buy on sale 

[b]PROS:[/b]
-Visually pleasing on maximum settings
-Lots of variation of towers and traps
-Lots of items for your character
-Unique enemy designs

[b]CONS:[/b]
-Messy UI 
-Sorta cringey voice acting (sorceress, haven't tried any others) 
-Recommend playing solo, playing multiplayer is so easy its boring
-Dangerously close to being just another generic TD game 

Not the best tower defense game out there, but its one that plays well. The RPG spin in this game is a nice addition to tower defense, leveling up your character and traps is rewarding, but the game can get easy fast because of this, you don't seem to ever be low on gold, meaning you can easily buy all the top gear for your level, making levels a breeze. Its a good time waster, play 1 or 2 levels and revisit it later, not a game to get hugely invested in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018893258', 'num_games_owned': 3719, 'num_reviews': 744, 'playtime_forever': 5607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5607, 'last_played': 1467302425}
review:
ハクスラ+TDゲーム。
"The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing"のTDミッションを抜き出して1本のゲームにしたスピンオフであり、世界観も共通となっている。インク世界から現実世界へ侵入しようとするモンスターを撃退するのが目的だ。
ハクスラのようにキャラ育成、ビルド構築して、大量のモンスターからポータルをタワーや罠、操作キャラの攻撃で防衛していく。マップをクリアすると宝箱が出現してアイテムや金が手に入り、それでさらにキャラを強化して次のマップを攻略していくのが主な流れとなっている。

[ゲーム性]
ハクスラTDというゲームであるが、ゲーム性はややハクスラよりになっている。
理由としては敵のルートと建設位置が固定であるためにTD的なストラテジー性が薄いからだ。エンドゲームに近づくほど最適なビルド構築は当たり前であとは操作キャラ自体の火力勝負に近い。このため、ハクスラが好きな人で防衛ゲームみたいなものをやってみたいという人に向いていると思う。

[装備アイテム]
装備アイテムのレアレティと付加されるアイテム特性の数は以下の通り。
Normal(0) < Magic(1) < Rare(2～3) < Epic (3～4) < Godlike (4+10), 番外:クラフト品(2～5)
クラフト品はアンロックした設計図によって最大でアイテム特性5つのアイテムをクラフトできる。Epicまでのアイテムとクラフト品のバランスは良いと思う。問題はGodlikeアイテムだ。なんとGodlikeアイテムは最大10回強化することができ、1回強化するごとにアイテム特性が1つ増える。はっきり言ってバランスブレイカーだ。しかし、高難易度ではGodlike装備前提のバランスとなっている。

[難易度バランス]
難易度バランスははっきり言って悪い。
キャンペーンモードについて言えば、ゲーム中盤が難しいというバランスになっている。中盤で行き詰ったら、エンドレスモードを繰り返してさっさとレベリングしてしまうのもアリだと思う。
難易度上昇は右肩上がりが理想だが、このゲームでは同じ周回での難易度が心電図のように極端だ。普通の難易度のマップが続くかと思えば、いきなり難しかったり簡単だったりするマップがあるからだ。タワー重視のマップや罠重視のマップなどビルドに左右されるのはまだいいが、”Tier3 Bottomless Pit”のように最悪なバランスのマップがある。ビルドがどうとか関係はなく単純にきつい。逆にGodlikeアイテムを強化すると全体的に難易度は低下する。

[エディタ]
自分でマップを作成してワークショップで公開することができる。
あくまで簡易なエディタであり、マップに最初から配置されているような特殊なタワーを配置することはできない。ただ、モンスターのアビリティを編集して他のモンスターの様々なアビリティを持たせることは可能だ。

ゲームシステム自体は良いがゲームバランスが悪い。ゲーム中盤さえ乗り切ってしまえば育成したキャラの強さの実感のようなカタルシスを感じることができるが、そこまで到達するのが大変だ。
間違いなくゲーム序盤でプレイをやめてしまう人と最後までプレイする人に分かれるゲームだと思う。スピンオフなゲームでゲームのつくりがやや雑であるに関わらずゲームの価格はそこそこするので、このゲームが高いとみるか安いとみるかもプレイヤーによると思う。
個人的に最後までプレイして楽しむことができたが、別のクラスでまた最初からプレイしたいとはあまり思わない。ゲームシステムには魅力を感じるだけに完全に悪いとは言えない惜しいゲームだ。ゲームバランスが悪いことを許容できて、ハクスラとTDが好きなら楽しめると思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561197996656102', 'num_games_owned': 847, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 2563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2415, 'last_played': 1623510134}
review:
Tower defence osadzony w świecie gry Hack and slash "The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing". Mamy więc takie średniowiecze, celtycki steam punk, wynalazki i magia.

Fabularnie jest bieda. Coś tam gadają, ale równie dobrze można to olać. Istotne jest, że mamy 13 poziomów, na każdej jest jakaś brama z której wychodzą demony, a my mamy je pokonać zanim dotrą do punktu którego bronimy.

Robimy to strzelając, rzucając czary i stawiając pułapki. Wieżyczki, pułapki podłogowe i przyzywane istoty walczące po naszej stronie. Możemy je rozwijać na wiele sposobów - wzrost dmg, czas trwania, albo mogą mieć dodatkowe funkcje. Czary mogą przeskakiwać na następne cele itd. Lokacje pod konkretne pułapki są z góry narzucone. Nie można tworzyć własnych ścieżek.

Rozwijamy również własną postać. Są trzy klasy do wyboru - rycerz, czarodziejka i typ z kuszą. Pułapki dla wszystkich są jednak takie same. Różnią się jedynie czarami i atakami.

13 poziomów wydaje się niewiele, ich przejście trwa około 10h. To jednak dopiero wstęp, bo właściwa część gry to New game+ i następne. Mianowicie, przy każdej mapie jest Tier 1, 2, 3 i 4. Przejście gry to zaliczenie zaledwie pierwszego. Taki Trier to nie tylko mocniejsze stwory mające więcej punktów HP ale też inne układy map. Kolejny Tier dostępny jest gdy przejdziemy wszystkie etapy na wcześniejszym. Ogólnie tutaj już zaczyna się wyzwanie. Obecnie robię Trier 2 mapy 12 i póki co uważam, że tego nie da się przejść. Za chuj. (Update: to jest możliwe, tylko twórcy byli trollami)

Jest też warsztat Steam, co-op, tryb pojedynku, tryb nieskończoności oraz scenariusze, w których możesz sobie ustalić np. że potwory mają więcej punktów HP, albo są szybsze, i wtedy dostajesz więcej doświadczenia. Kooperacja sprawdza się dobrze, można grać z obcymi bez problemu, posługując się wyłącznie chatem.

Jedynym minusem jest niewystarczający program nagród. Można się bawić na różne sposoby, ale w pewnym momencie odczuwałem, że w zasadzie stoję w tym samym miejscu co wcześniej. Zdobyłem może jeden punkt na pułapki, wbiłem jeden poziom ale to niewiele zmieniło, mapy odblokowane te same, achivementy te same. A przydałoby się dostać osiągnięcie np. za przejście wszystkiego na Tier 2.

7/10. Kupujcie i grajcie ze mną co-opa, ludzie.:c

author: {'steamid': '76561197964921834', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1466800627}
review:
There currently is a bug where there is no sound effects / music.  The devs apparently know about the issue but there's no timetable for a fix yet, which is unfortunate because this game is quite fun.  It is like a mashup of Dungeon Defender and Diablo with the aesthetics leaning towards the Diablo universe.  I've only played a little bit so far because the lack of sound is a bit distracting, my only concern is that the later levels remain as repetitive as the easier early levels are.  

If there ever is a fix for the sound issue add me and let me know lol I would love to give this game a more in depth chance.

Shame. Because other than that this game is totally worth it and the co op is extremely fun. When it works. It doesn't most of the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975892991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1472487812}
review:
[i]Deathtrap[/i] verbindet auf unterhaltsame Weise Tower-Defense und Action RPG mit der Grimdark-Atmosphäre von Van Helsing und der Souls-Reihe. Wer diese Mischung mag, darf bedenkenlos zugreifen, Skeptikern empfehle ich eine Rabattaktion abzuwarten, denn das Spiel ist recht kurz und bietet ab einem gewissen Punkt nur wohl nur noch im Mehrspielermodus (Coop oder Versus) ausreichen Stoff für Langzeitmotivation.

Der Einstieg ins Spiel ist schnell gefunden und weicht nicht wesentlich von ähnlichen Spielen ab. Monster kommen in Wellen auf festgelegten Wegen und wollen abgehalten werden, ein Portal am Ende zu erreichen. Soweit, so bekannt. Obwohl vom Grundprinzip nicht innovativ, unterscheidet sich [i]Deathtrap[/i] durch seine Charakterentwicklung. Die drei wählbaren Klassen (Mercenary, Marksman, Sorceress) unterscheiden sich mit einem recht umfangreichen Talentbaum, der im Laufe des Spiels ausgebaut und entwickelt werden kann. Passive und aktive Fähigkeiten lassen sich so kombinieren und den Monstern zusätzlich zu den Fallen den Gar aus machen. Der Clou dabei sind die RNG-Items im Stil bekannter Action-RPGs, die von Monstern und Bossen fallen gelassen werden und mit denen sich der Charakter zusätzlich verbessern lässt. Gepaart mit einem einfachen Crafting-System gibt es hier jede Menge Möglichkeiten, den eigenen Charakter über 100 Level individuell auszustatten.

Die Fallen sind vielzählich und lassen sich ebenfalls in mehreren Stufen verbessern. Das bietet ausreichend Raum für Spezialisierung und unterschiedliche Spielstile, wobei die verschiedenen Schadenstypen ausgewogen verteilt werden müssen, um auf alle Gegnertypen und Resistenzen reagieren zu können.

[i]Deathtrap[/i] spielt sich flüssig und eingängig, die Steuerung mit Maus und Tastatur ist präzise und geht gut von der Hand, die Steuerung mit Controller ist möglich. Allerdings wirkt die Ausführung der Fähigkeiten und Kämpfe manchmal trotz ansehnlicher Effekte und guter Soundumsetzung etwas substanzlos. Der Soundtrack hingegen ist stimmungsvoll und atmosphärisch, gehen die Kämpfe los, legt auch der Rhythmus ordentlich zu und untermalt das blutige Gemetzel mit ordentlichem Bass.

Koordiniert im kooperativen Mehrspieler ist sicherlich die größte Langzeitmotivation aus [i]Deathtrap[/i] herauszuholen, im Einzelspieler ist nach 13 sehr stimmungsvoll gestalteten Levels leider Schluss. Dann bleibt nur noch, die gleichen Levels mit höherem, später auch anpassbarem Schwierigkeitsgrad erneut zu spielen und Herausforderungen zu erfüllen. Wem Grind nichts ausmacht, der wird auch daran seine Freude haben, wem das zu eintönig wird, der sollte sich auf den Mehrspielermodus konzentrieren.

Die aktuell verlangten 19,99€ ist das Spiel auf jeden Fall wert, wer nur ein kooperatives Tower-Defense-Spiel ohne Orks und Goblins sucht, sollte gegebenenfalls auf einen Aktionspreis warten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052665540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1492978799}
review:
This game is tons of fun. Super awesome.

The only thing about this game I do not like, is how insanely short it is. I thought that when I was "beating" the game, that I was moving onto the next "world" so to speak. But no, it's just the one area of levels. I was very upset about that...

author: {'steamid': '76561198001779018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1465698421}
review:
Definitely a game to check out if you're an avid tower defense and RPG fan. All of the basic TD tropes are present and accounted for, and there's even a simple crafting system to appease the RPG players.

With that in mind, if you're expecting an awesome TD experience, then you're going to be missing out, namely in the area of massive amounts of enemies and endless supplies of cash that never seem to be enough anyway. The gameplay boils down to a lot of decision making about where you want your traps to be stronger and where you want your avatar to be.

A word for the wise: Save up some essence near the end of the 5th wave so you can bolster the traps around where the boss is going to spawn. You're welcome.

I love tower defense games with tons of enemies and lots of space to put guns and slowing mechanisms. The pre-defined spaces for traps threw me for a bit of a loop, but it all seemed logical enough and didn't give way to frustration too much. I had fun playing this game and would recommend it to most fans of the genre, and even fans of RPGs who don't regularly play TD games.

Check out my full review below:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IveJCyfwFmo

author: {'steamid': '76561198099414892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 13156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1513454988}
review: This game is an excellent take on tower defense. You create a character of one of three classes and then can (try to play) play co-op (online only no local :( ) with up to three others or can do solo in campaign mode. There's not much of a story to the game, but there are brief readings associated with each level that provide some context. Combat consists of activating towers with a substance called essence. You get essence at the start of each level and can acquire more by killing enemies. Towers come in many different varieties and your character can make contributions to the fight based on abilities and default actions. Upgrades, crafting, and a shop feature make this game even better by allowing your character and towers the chance to adapt to new levels and challenges; in this way an RPG element is introduced. I'm not too far in yet and can appreciate the replayability of levels and the challenges offered. Outside of issues with connecting on co-op I can really get behind the other aspects of the game. I got it in a bundle, but would have paid full price based on my experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997838090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1468641179}
review: A fun mix of tower defense and Diablo-esque combat/loot. Three unique character classes to choose from, loot drops at the end of each level, 25 towers/traps, skill tree and progression system for your character and for your towers/traps. Run around each level hacking and blasting enemies while building up your static defenses. All in all, a lot more enjoyable that I was expecting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085269524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1465860635}
review:
I found it on sale and after the good memories of playing something similar on custom maps of warcraft i thought i should try it. 
I expected more. 
I only played it with a controller and i must say it is a challenge. 
I get the feeling playing something like dark souls tower defense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023666926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1772, 'playtime_forever': 1292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1641062479}
review:
I wanted to like this game but I can't. 
The game trying to be combination of tower defense and ARPG and and fail to be good at any of them :/ If you played Van helsing there was parts where you use tower defense mechanic to defend base, it wasn't that great or polished, this is little more complex but still crude and far from prefect, very much like van helsing in many ways, to many. 
Camera is stick to you character, this make it harder to fast look at battlefield and plan you towers placement. You can only place towers in pre defined places and sometimes it is easy to miss some of them, visually game look just ok and everything looks very similar, in small tower defense battlefield you can craft beautiful and unique environment but here is quite basic, not that interesting and it is easy to overlook building places, especially small stone pillars. 
Upgrading towers doesn't change it's appearance or way it works it most often just 5% of this 10% of that and that's it, not particularity interesting to say the least. Character leveling, upgrading and skills unlocking is very similar and character have only couple active abilities, I believe is is 10 of them.
Rpg part is mostly around your gear and preparing best armor or weapon before battle, looks very much like in van helsing. 
There are some side missions but very basics and uninteresting like kill all neutral monsters that are standing in the middle of nothing then you get key and after you successful finish level chests magically appear near you so you can open them and pick up gold and gear diablo/ van helsing style. I don't know why that last part exist really, it would be better just show screen with loot after battle and player can sell or use it, why you have to pick up all that from ground at the end of level and not just get all those items?
And lastly story and characters, also very standard, basic and not very inspired to say the least. It could be ok, I would be ok even without story if gameplay was great bu it isn't, it just works.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995749658', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 1565, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1487248730}

Nein weil....Es gibt einfach spassigere Spiele.....

author: {'steamid': '76561198046345025', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1546889207}
review:
Purchased in a bundle at Humble Bundle, so I did not pay $20 for this.

Fun game, I like the mechanics of it and how it plays. The leveling is cool, as it turns it into a bit of an RPG. Everything is flawless with the exception of three things: some slight graphical issues, where small parts of the screen with flash a blue color for like a milisecond. 2-3 of the levels are way too big for me to really enjoy, but the teleporting helps make it not such a big deal. I can run The Witcher 3 on full settings, and my computer does not get as warm as it does when playing this game on medium detail. 

After beating the initial 13 maps, more modes are unlocked which gives you more stuff to do. Reaching level 20 also gives more things to do
It is a very fun game to kill a couple hours with here and there. Maybe not worth the full 20 bucks, but still good nonetheless. $10-$15 would be a bit better, in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065138999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1465675664}
review:
I've played as Marksman.
I've only played solo.

I really enjoy the genres Tower defence and ARPG and I think idea of mixing those genres together sounds really good. And this game seems really nice on paper. But it's unfortunately just not fun. 

It's not rally a bad game, but there is a lot games I would rather recommend before this.
