author: {'steamid': '76561198048682839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1381, 'last_played': 1579465652}
review:
With less than 24 hours of playtime as of this writing, I am not a master.Consider this a work in progress.
This, in my oppiion is the most enjoyable TD I've ever played, and with anactive team updating ,improving and the promise of DLC, it can only get better.
So far I have experienced no bugs worth mentioning in the single player,the Co-op feels a little rough and I have spent no time on the Versus.
What I like: The Steampunk/Fantasy/Eastern European Mythology elements of the storyline is absolutely unique and engrossing.The tie in to The Incredible Adventures Of Van Helsing was exciting to me as I love TIAVH 1 and 2 and gives me hope that Neocore might continue their expansion of this awesome universe.
The RPG elements are very enjoyable and excellently designed.Every skill and every trap upgraade is vital-there are no throw away traps, upgrades, or skills..
Gameplay mechanics are, in my experience,universally sound-the absence of bugs and glitches is noteworthy.
The map editor is one of the significant unique features, and in my opinion, one of the biggest hooks.It is intuitive and straightforward to use and creating personal maps is really fun.
Overall I absolutely recomend this game-it's worth every cent.
No game is flawless and this has a few,albeit those problems aren't really make or break difficulties.
My biggest complaint is the inability to place traps where I want to.All the traps are laid out as a part of the map build and to me this stifles the challenge somewhat.
Once again,Neocore hits the nail on the head, this game delivers with a skill and originality that is rare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065208602', 'num_games_owned': 810, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2835, 'last_played': 1615127148}
review:
This is a solid tower defence game. Good for playing with friends or solo.
That being said it does have its fair share of bugs and balance issues but don't let that deter you from getting it. Why? because the devs are super active on the forums and they are constantly collecting problems that users find and patching it. So just because you notice something wrong with it now doesn't mean that it will stay wrong, I've only had it for a week and they have fixed tons of minor stuff in that time.
The controls are like ARPGs (Diablo) however if you don't like moving by clicking then all the commands are rebindable so you can walk with wasd.

In total this is a good td and I would reccomend it to anyone who likes tower defence games or anyone who wants something to play with a group of friends as it has 4 player co-op.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007644998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 4566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3354, 'last_played': 1564938603}
review:
[u]Status[/u];

"[b]COMPLETE[/b]"

I have played tower defense games for years and never have I come across a game this polished, diverse, with fantastic graphics, replayability and variation.
There has been no glitches, lag, or any issues of locking or crashing of any kind in over 16 hours of gameplay.

My con is just one, that their marketing department gets off their butt and get this game known. Many play but more could be playing for sure. 

My many pros are as follow;

If you have played Sanctum, Sanctum 2, Tower Wars, Toy Soldiers, Dungeon Masters, Dungeon Masters II, Sol or Defense Grid 1 or 2, and appreciated any part of them... then this game will Top them All and add a variation of each with a fantastic tutorial!

Well polished, runs smooth, and the shop  and crafting to add an additional twist of genious when it was not needed is really terrific too.

This game however has had complaints/reviews from the lazy players, who want to path, and sit back and let the towers do all the work. Those are the same persons who probablly write a bad review because they manipulated x, y, or z and beat the game. For those lazy trolls, suck it! You actually have to play, help your towers, earn the win with teamwork in coop of other players or coop of your towers in solo. You get rewarded for the hard work in loot, items, and map advancement but it is not easy.

The other complaint I have read is that you can not place towers where you please, again, troll babies that cant make all the attackers run up the middle of the map into a line of carnage while they sit back and gripe about the game. Well again, whaaaaaa.... you have to work with your towers or fellow players to achieve a win! Brilliant!

Towers are of plenty and the types you unlock as you play better and master, and the choice is what tower where assits your goal.  Wrong tower, wrong placement, level the wrong one, you may be getting loot and exp all to try again.

Now since the troll babies didnt get a lame game to pick on, here is a third gametype for all you VS(versus) enthusiasts. YES indeed in a very well done VS(versus) in a tower defense game. 
One attacker, several defenders and outwit and outplay each other. May the best brain and coordination win! A simple and tactical blast! Kind of like Evolve but in tower defense. Just brilliant and so well produced. 

This game is marvelous in how it was done on all aspects. Even the servers are fantastic without a hiccup. I had no idea who the heck these guys were, never played a NeocoreGames title before and I am so glad I reviewed and doubted the reviews to this point of the same crybabies.

If you do not have this game, it is a solid buy, plain and simple!! 

I would rate this tower defense game in my top 3 of all time. Would buy a game produced by NeocoreGames anytime. They released a perfected, enjoyable, challenging masterpiece without any bugs or flaws or lag.




Discalimer; The Review Crew's evaluations are based on paying close attention to forum response and activity, system demand, fun of the game genre, position of originality in respective genre, growth of the project in its current state at time of review, graphics as a whole for end user, presentation of the game and display, replayability, patch/tweak progress, beginner friendliness & gameplay direcction, content & depth, attention to detail on small things(polish), lag and multiplayer application if applicable, badge card availability, with a minimum 8 hours of gameplay and interaction with customer base after release. We are not affliliated with any specific brand or entity or on any payroll. All views are based on positive only feedback as we are in no position to criticise anyones craft, just current states of development and progress at the time of our participation. If we offend anyone with our content, it was not us! Our review was hacked!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027544118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3098, 'last_played': 1570311738}
review:
9/10 

This game is one of the best tower defense games I've ever played.  But this game stands out because it requires actual involvement in the defense.  To me, tower defense games have always been fairly simple, you identify the choke points and place the correct towers and every know and again you upgrade or add a tower, but if you play smart you always win.  This game requires your help,  your towers can't do this alone and on more than one occasion I've had a drip of sweat running down my brow as that monster that slipped through is pixels away from the core and has 1000 health points left as I use my speed attack and destroy it only miliseconds away from it counting as a hit.  You have to level your character and towers strategically to the point where you start to develop your own signature playstyle.  Also there's co-op and who doesn't love to murderize monsters with their best friend?

The only reason I'm giving this a 9 and not a 10 is because the game doesn't support camera rotation... which I didn't get annoyed by playing as a mercenary, but when I started a game with my friend playing as a marksman I was annoyed because the marksman is a ranged character and because of the camera angle you can see much further to the north and east of the map, but to the west and south you view range is very limited, which means you have to attempt to use the dots on the minimap and fire off screen and just hope you're hitting something until it comes into view or you get closer.  Since the mage is also a ranged unit I feel you'd have the same fustrating experience on some of the maps.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974144269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2177, 'last_played': 1424456395}
review:
RPG + 디펜스의 요소를 모두 갖춘 게임입니다. 또한, 한글패치는 안된 게임이지만 게임내에서 한글채팅이 가능합니다.
레벨이 오를때마다 스킬 강화 및 타워 능력치를 강화시킬 수 있으며, 보통의 RPG 게임처럼 캐릭터에 여러 장신구를 착용시킬 수 있습니다. 아이템은 메인메뉴 상점에서 사거나, 직접 제작할 수 있으며, 맵 클리어시 보상으로 아이템을 얻을 수 있습니다.
 한편, 게임 내에 정글 유닛이 존재하는데, 이 유닛을 잡게되면 열쇠를 얻을 수 있습니다. 이 열쇠는 맵 클리어시 받게되는 보상 상자를 여는데 필수 아이템이므로, 정글 유닛을 무조건 잡아 줘야합니다. 여러모로 재밌는 요소가 혼합되있는 게임입니다.
단점이 있다면, 코옵할 때 방 잡기가 매우 힘든점입니다. 한국유저가 거의 없는 것은 물론, 온라인 유저가 별로 없는 것 같습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016596439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1019, 'last_played': 1424785071}
review:
Both my brother and I had to go to our GPU control panel and assign our dedicated GPU to it - once this happened the game played perfectly. Deathtrap has a good foundation for an amazing game, gem for sure in it's current state.

Smooth and accurate controls - beautiful presentation - character development depth - balanced gameplay between the need for towers, traps, and avatar skills/experience. The growth of the character is comfortable and fun, allowing one to upgrade character skills/abilities and towers (unlocking new towers, improving passively, unlocking tiers, etc.) My favorite thing about Deathtrap's gameplay is the improvement noticed in the maps after applying skill points - the whole process is very rewarding

Co-op is good and regardless of the mode played in the items dropped/found encourage one to keep progressing. 

I sincerly hope the developers continue to improve and expand because I love RPGs and I love tower defenses; but we are blessed to have what we have with Deathtrap. 

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075983278', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1479, 'last_played': 1644038230}
review:
Deathtrap is a tower defense game with strong action RPG elements. This game is brought to us by Neocore Games, the developers behind the excellent Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing, and this just might be the best game that they've made so far.

At first I thought Deathtrap was just another Van Helsing game with a different name, but as soon as I started the game I saw how wrong I was. This is a true tower defense game that allows us to control our own character too. Before each wave you can run around the map placing all sorts of different traps down to fight off each wave. At first I only had access to a turret and a poison trap that shoots up acid at any enemy that steps on it.

They didn't do much damage at first, but after I upgraded them I didn't go a match without them. Even when I got to higher tier maps I still found myself going back to my good ole acid trap because it did a ton of damage on my enemies.

In addition to laying down traps you can also fight alongside them with your character. The three character classes are your basic warrior, mage, and rogue, but they come with vastly different abilities. My personal favorite character is the rogue while the warrior is my least favorite.

Once you've gotten enough experience points you can level up both your character, and your traps. As you level up new traps will become available for you to try out. Once I got access to a trap that let me make archer units I immediately focused on upgrading them to maximum.

The gameplay in Deathtrap is nothing short of great. It plays like Van Helsing, but the tower defense elements really stand out and make this game different enough to stand out on it's own.

The soundtrack is the best I've heard this year; I really love the opening song at the main menu and stage selection screens. I wish there was more though. There are only a few tracks in the game, but they're all easy on the ears.

Graphically this game looks as good as The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing games. Everything is rich with detail. The character animations are solid, but it's nothing spectacular and the voice acting is a bit on the weak side, but who plays a tower defense game for the voice acting.

If you don't want to play this game alone you don't have to. You can go through the entire game with a friend in cooperative mode or even go head to head in some great pvp action.

If you're looking for some great gameplay set in the Van Helsing world than look no further than Deathtrap. 



The Verdict: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198079482642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1471084074}
review:
Just a very quick first impressions while the game is in its initial (post-Early Access) release.

Basically a vamped version of the Tower Defence portion of Van Helsing 2. Given that this was the most surprisingly enjoyable aspect of VH2 this is a GOOD THING. Game plays like a smoother version of VH2 and the variety of locations, enemies and traps hint at some potentially very exciting assets to be re-used for VH3. This, I suspect, is going to keep me hooked for a long time. Neocore are rapidly becoming a very solid and reliable developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029390738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 2056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1485, 'last_played': 1553367581}
review:
This game is fantastic. It's a great blend of Torchlight and Diablo esque ARPG combat and leveling, with strategic tower defense. It's a lot of fun, has great level design, awesome turrets, defenses, abilities, and unique enemies. It's also Cooperative and Versus multiplayer.

The campaign supports multiple playthroughs and encourages beating them on higher difficulties, and I find myself trying to finish everything. There's definitely a lot of gameplay value here if you're into in depth action tower defense games. It's like a dark fantasty Dungeon Defenders/Orcs Must Die hybrid and I find it a blast.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972608433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1652742604}
review: A great mix of tower defense and rpg elements with great artwork and stylistic choices. For $20, you cannot go wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011604006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 8811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8811, 'last_played': 1429062496}
review: An ARPG/Tower defense hybrid. Think Diablo mixed with a tower defense. You level up, and your get points to level up your towers and traps. Gear drops to upgrade your character. You put points into skills you enjoy using.  When you finish the campaign (a few hours), it unlocks tier 2 of the campaign, which are the same maps, but with twists (different monsters, different traps), then so on, up to tier 4 (other maps become available too). There are many ways to customize maps to make them harder, such as increasing monster speed, which will increase your loot drops. Plays very similarly to the tower defense mini games in Van Helsing 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015094232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2085, 'last_played': 1443687691}
review:
Deathtrap is a tower defense-Arpg hybrid from the developers of The Amazing Adventures of Van Helsing. The closest comparison that can be drawn to it from other games in the tower defense genre would be Dungeon Defenders. Although the character progression and abilities are more fleshed out and force players to make decisions that uniquely define their characters role more than DD does. There are 3 classes, the mercenary, the sorceress and the marksman, each have a different playstyle and trap base type that they favour with a multitude of abilities to choose from as they level up. The mercenary for example is good at playing the role of melee tank and favours mechanical traps (both floor and tower types).

The trap base types are Mechanical Floor, Mystical Floor, Mechanical Tower, Mystical Tower and Summoning, each with 5 traps for a total of 25 different types of traps. Unlike Dungeon Defenders you're limited to where you can place each trap type by predefined trap locations which can somewhat limit the amount of potential builds for each map. There are four main enemy archetypes as well of which, different towers will either be super effective, neutril or ineffective against which forces players to use multiple types of towers and traps to prevent enemies reaching their gate (core).

Overall I find the game to be quite and enjoyable and it has a lot of depth to it with 13 campaign maps which have 4 increasing difficulty tiers which unlock as you progress to maintain the challenge as your character levels. Once the 13 campaign maps have been completed on the first tier 5 additional scenario maps unlock as well. Scenario mode which is similar to the campaign but instead has added challenges that the player can choose from to increase the difficulty as they see fit and increase the xp, loot and gold they receive at the end of the mission. Finally there is also the endless mode which is basically survival with ever increasingly stronger enemies thrown at the player until eventually they are defeated.

Well worth the price of admission.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998501230', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1634939622}
review:
This game just gave me Tower Defence orgasm. Really the best TD I've played in a very long time. It combines RPG elements from (good) hack and slash rpg's with tower defence levels. I started it but I'm already hooked, it is also very extensive in everything. Really mash up you're favourite arpg and the best TD and you get this. A must have for fans of both genres!

To end with a fitting quote: "My god, it's like smoking two ciggarettes at once!"

author: {'steamid': '76561197991689591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1565293228}
review:
Diablo + Tower Defence? Yes please. Having played both Orcs Must Die and Dungeon Defenders, this game was more enjoyable to me than both of those titles. This is mostly due to the great number and variety of unique Towers (Traps) and skills for your hero. The game is not perfect though, as others have mentioned the design/graphics is mediocre at best, and a few traps and skills feel underwhelming. Overall though, a highly enjoyable game.

NOTE: I have not tried any of the multiplayer game modes yet (co-op and versus) so please take this into consideration.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038014212', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1424534746}
review:
Caraca, a anos que esperava um Tower Defense como esse na steam, bons tempos em que eu verminava nos tower defense do warcraft3, estou gostando muito de Deathtrap, por enquanto só joguei solo, estou ansioso para jogar com amigos o modo coop e pvp.

Nota - 9/10 (só não dou 10 pq já tem locais certo para se por trap nos mapas (bom que pode ser variados tipos de traps podendo criar variadas estrategias, mas seria melhor se pudesse posicionar as mesmas em qualquer terreno que n fosse na linha de passagem do inimigo como nos tower defense que jogava antigamente no warcraft, mas isso pode ser questão de costume, estou adorando o game e quem sabe n mudo pra um 10/10 logo logo :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198006934852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1364, 'last_played': 1427281483}
review:
A stand-alone expansion on the excellent tower defense minigame from [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198006934852/recommended/215530]The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing[/url].

Deathtrap plays pretty much as it looks: a cross between Action RPGs like [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198006934852/recommended/41500]Torchlight[/url] and tower defense titles such as [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198006934852/recommended/102600/]Orcs Must Die[/url], with a co-op campaign playable solo or up to 4-players.

Played shortly after release, it could have done with a touch more testing to fix a few minor bugs and glitches, but otherwise the gameplay is solid.

- Skinny from the Fat B*stard [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/skinnyfat#](curator link)[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198026265698', 'num_games_owned': 1701, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 9474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9001, 'last_played': 1451339704}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007554246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 4095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3349, 'last_played': 1435848140}
review:
Достоинства:
-Низкая цена
-Tower defence в стиле Diablo
-Куча продуманных скилов
-У вышек тоже есть улучшения (скиллы, которые берутся до перехода на карту)
-Для разблокировки определенных вышек нужно выполнить определенное достижение, нанести 450к огненного урона, например. (мелочь, а приятно)
-Есть режим совместного прохождения, до 4 человек
-Есть режим PvP с рейтинговой системой (один игрок атакует, другой защищается)
-Мастерская стим с возможностью создания карт
-Крутой саундтрек
-Игра не продается частями (нет DLC)
-Игра регулярно дорабатывается

Недостатки:
-Красные глаза от недосыпа

Итого: Збc

author: {'steamid': '76561197980349438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1174, 'last_played': 1709166666}
review:
If you're a fan of rpg tower defense games like orcs must die you'll probably like this as well.  It's darker/more serious than OMD was but not in a bad way. The voice acting is...well.. the voices are good just the writing for them is pretty cheesy :)

Towers fit into 3 different types and each tower type have to be built on specific key areas on the map tiles.  After the first few maps the areas become larger and less restrictive as far as what and were you can build.

I've only played one character so far but the builds look like you're not forced down any one path and there is an option to reset points if things aren't working for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084272307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5089, 'last_played': 1604238712}
review:
I had initially written a good review about this game because I simply loved it. I've now changed it to thumbs down and not-recommended for one reason only: the devs appear to have a habbit of abandoning their games and leave them buggy. This game is currently unplayable in co-op endless mode, which is the main end-game content. After reaching roughly wave 30, monsters will turn invisible for anyone but the host, making it impossible to continue. Apparently their Van Helsing games suffer from a similar issue as well, proving that they use the same bugged network code for their games.

Other than that, there were also mentioning of additional future content, which I expect we will never see.

I will leave my original review below, but do note that it was written when the game was new and full of promise and before the bug was yet to be discovered. While I do still stand for those words, they don't mean that much when the main end-game content is unplayable in co-op.

INITIAL REVIEW:
"Diablo meets Orcs Must Die! If you like these games, or if you like action-RPGs and tower defense games, then this game is for you. It offers wide character progression through skill development, trap choices and upgrades. Add to this that you get to gear up your character in true Diablo style along with the possibility of leveling all the way up to level 100. There are lots of scenarios, quests and challenges. For you tower defense-lovers there's also endless modes to be had. Play solo, co-op or versus mode. There's a lot of content offered here! This is literally one of the best games released in years!"

author: {'steamid': '76561198069439929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1423450427}
review:
*** Der key wurde für Reviewzwecke vom Developer zur verfügung gestellt***

GODLIKE. Vergleichbar mit Orcs must die 2. Also ein super Spiel. Man kann bis zu 3 Charakterklassen wählen, alle Charaktere sind völlig auflevelbar, man kann ihnen rüstungen anziehen, und das skill + perk menü ist größer als i nvielen rollenspielen. Natürlich kann man auch türme und zauber upgraden und neue freischalten. Das Spiel ist einfach genial. Zudem hat es wie orcs must die einen Coop Modus, sowie Editor Unterstützung. Hier werde ich viele hundert STD Spaß haben. 


PRO:
Sehr großes Spiel
Map Editior
Coop Modus
Grafik
Musik
Viel Freischaltbares
Steamachievments
Steamtrading Cards
Unzählige dinge zum aufleveln
Nicht nur Tower Defense, sondern auch RPG Inhalt

Contra:
Fehlender Controller Support

Fazit:
MUST HAVE! 
Bisher war Plants vs Zombies + Orcs must die 2 Mein Lieblingsspiel, aber ich fürchte das sich das ändern kann!
Wer also ein Towerdefense Spie lder Extraklasse sucht, welches vieleicht ähnlich wie ORcs must Die aufgebaut ist, derjenige ist hier Goldrichtig. Das Spiel ist seine derzeit 20 Euro aber sowas von Wert.

[i]Wenn euch diese Review gefallen hat, dann folgt unserem [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/-German_Gamer_Community-#curation]Reviewprogramm[/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198072453338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1424529028}
review:
Je dois dire que le mélange entre Tower Defense et Hack & Slash est très bien réussi avec ce DeathTrap. Ami amateur de Tower Defense, tu n'a jamais eu envie d'aller massacrer du monstre toi-même ? Et bien maintenant c'est possible ! J'ai jouer seulement une petite dizaine d'heure à l'heure ou j'écris cette évaluation mais je dois bien avouer qu'il m'a fallu que quelques minutes pour me rendre compte que j'adorais ce jeu.

Les pièges sont plutôt sympa, le jeu est joli, la bande son est entêtante. Bref, ce jeu à tout pour plaire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018528658', 'num_games_owned': 854, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2525, 'last_played': 1643045846}
review:
This game is a Deathtrap of personal time, social activity, and personal hygiene regiments. With more DLC planned including additional characters, this game still has a lot of things to look forward to atop an already complete and truly satisfying package. Very much recommended for Tower Defense-hybrid fans of games like Dungeon Defenders as well as anyone who enjoyed the defense of the base portion of The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing 1 & 2.

[table equalcells=1]
	[tr]
		[th]🟦 What I like[/th]
		[th]🟥 What I dislike[/th]
	[/tr]
	[tr]
		[td]+ Solid TD game taken from the devs' own Van Helsing games with RNG loot, extensive skill trees, and extensive trap upgrades[/td]
		[td]- Some maps are way tougher than others (because of trap nodes you have to use)[/td]
	[/tr]
	[tr]
		[td]+ 3 classes, 15+ maps + 4 Campaign stages of difficulty for each (not including variable Endless and Scenarios) and optional side quests.[/td]
		[td]- Some of the character skill options seem frivolous (it's overwhelming at first)[/td]
	[/tr]
	[tr]
		[td]+ Workshop support for user generated maps, Multiplayer Co-Op and Versus modes[/td]
		[td]- A few technical issues still being reported (I didn't experience any myself)[/td]
	[/tr]
[/table]

On the off chance you may have skipped the NeoCore Van Helsing games, the foundations for this game can be found in some of the base defense levels there - this game takes that formula and not only inverts it, but improves upon it - building a new game with tower defense as the focus and ARPG as the secondary objective. The tone of these games is a bit grimdark and snarky, and this carries over into the graphics and the fixed areas towers can be placed. Generally, you'll be finding gaps in your defense and fighting those mobs off manually during rounds before shoring up for the next round and doing again when new types of monsters, or elites, come through. I still feel like some of the options for upgrades are a bit much and could be condensed some, but workshop support can help users adjust their own experience down the road. I had a lot of fun with this one for a while, if it sounds like your thing, check it out.

[table]
	[tr]
		[td][b]Content/Replay[/b][/td]
		[td]High - There's a lot of traps, maps, characters and modifiers for just about everything that could reasonably have math attached to it. Each map also has a star-level grade influenced by your efficiency and the level clear time (and maybe other things). To reach the end, you'll probably have to do some grinding.[/td]
	[/tr]
	[tr]
		[td][b]Pass, Sale, Buy?[/b][/td]
		[td]Sale - As a tower defense game with some ARPG elements, it largely succeeds, but can feel like it needs some polish, difficulty tweaks, and RNG to be in your favor.[/td]
	[/tr]
	[tr]
		[td][b]Overall[/b][/td]
		[td]Score: 4.0 / 5.0 - Above Average, Deathtrap is a solid spin-off game from what was once side quest content itself, with plenty of content on offer.[/td]
	[/tr]
[/table]

[table]
	[tr]
		[th]🖥️ System Specs[/th]
	[/tr]
	[tr]
		[td]Intel i5 3770k | NVIDIA GeForce GTX 980 | 16GB RAM | 1920 x 1080[/td]
	[/tr]
[/table]

[i]Updated: Formatting changes.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198120605557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1424136830}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962624598', 'num_games_owned': 4153, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1423352832}
review:
I came into the game thinking this was gonna be another run of the mill isometric topdown hack-n-slash and boy oh boy was I wrong. An in-depth strategy game with focus on base/path defense mixing the styles of Warcraft/Starcraft-like maps with Diablo-like gameplay.

Gameplay: 9/10
Hand on mouse and QWEReady to kill thousands of monsters trying to get to your base, building turrets and trap and pools of acid all along the way. You level one of several different class types that all have different abilities and weapons to help you wipe the floors wave after wave. And you don't have to do it alone since there's co-op features!

Graphics: 10/10
Simply put, the art style is my jam -- lots of bones and stones. Top quality and scales well. Just...look...at...it...

Sound: 6/10
I can hear the sound of the hordes falling at my feet but I don't hear the bagpipes echoing in the distance. The only part I felt this game lacked was an immersive audio experience. But, we all have our own music collection for that sorta thing. xD

Overall: 8/10
Strategy? Hack'n'slash? Starcraft? Warcraft? Diablo? Like any of that? You won't want to miss this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015243070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1531579888}
review:
J'hésitais à le prendre, mais..

Etant un fan de H&S, il me devait de m'intérresser d'un peu plus prêt à ce jeu.
un joli mélange de Tower défence, le jeu étant construit sur cette base, mais avec pas mal d'aspect d'un H&S, je m'explique:

- Le but premier étant de repousser les vagues d'ennemis qui s'empresseront, coute que coute, de rejoindre le portail de sortie jusqu'à le détruire, et pour cela tout un tas d'arsenal sera mis à votre disposition afin de les en empêcher:

 * Des pièges, beaucoup de pièges, tous différents, que vous pourrez débloquer et upgrader au fur et à mesure que vous avancerez dans le jeu. Que ce soit en prenant du level, car oui, votre personnage prendra du galon tout au long de votre aventure, ou bien en passant sur un niveau de difficulté supérieur, lesquelles étant au niveau de trois, facile, moyen et difficile.
Ces pièges que vous placerezà des endroits stratégiques prédéfinis par le jeu.
Il existe cinq catégories de pièges, tous regroupant différents pièges, ce qui vous permettra réellement de définir votre stratégie d'attaque.
Le tout divisé en 3 palliers que vous débloquerez au fil de votre avancée..
En bref beaucoup d'upgrade et de possibilités.
 *Du stuff, eh oui, car comme dit précédement, c'est le côté H&S du jeu, car chaque fois que vous terminerez un niveau, il vous sera possible de récupérer du butin (aléatoire bien sûr) qui augmenteront vos stats de votre personnage.
Ici tout y est indiqué, votre taux de crit, vos dégats, vos résistance, votre taux de drop, bref je ne vais pas tout détailler, on pourrait le comparer aux stats de D3 pour vous faire une idée..

Vous possédez un inventaire pour stocker vos loot, un shop (équivalent à un marchand) qui vous vendra des marchandises parfois exceptionnelles moyennant finance (l'or du jeu récupérée sur des mobs).
On y retrouve vraiment toute les bases d'un bon H&S en gros pour déboiter vos ennemis.

vous aurez la possibilité de choisir entre trois classes différentes, du bon vieux basique à savoir un cac, un distances magique et un distance physique.

Beaucoup de compétences de base, déblocable par pallier 0/10/20, qui vous permettra réellement de perosnnaliser votre style de jeu avec un tas de skill, tous upgradable.

J'ai été vagréablement surpris par ce jeu, qui mêle stratégie et hasard pour le côté loot, on passe du temps dessus, d'ailleur, le temps passe vite!

La difficulté est au rendez vous, différents jeux vous seront proposés, une campagne, un mode scénario et un mode sans fin.
-La campagne étant la trame du jeu avec ses niveaux de difficultés..
-Le scénario qui vous permettra d'y ajouter la difficulté que vous voulez, plus elle est croissante, meilleure sera votre récompense que ce soit niveau XP ou Loot. (niveau 20 requis)
-Le mode sans fin, serez vous le meilleur? figurerez vous en haut du classement? ...

Bref, on le trouve pour une 12'zaine d'euros sur certains site, el les vaux largement..

Les + :

Graphiquement joli, clair, une difficulté bien dosée, tout un tas de choses à débloquer, le sympathique mélange entre un TWD et un H&S, différents modes de jeu, beaucoup de compétence de base, permettant vraiment de personnaliser son style de jeu.

Un Workshop, donc réellement une grosse variété de cartes faites par la communauté, une durée de vie plutôt conséquente..

Les - :

Quelques bug de traductions mineurs, qui seront certainement corrigés par la suite.
Un choix de classe limités, en éspérant avoir plus de choix par la suite.

On en a pour son argent, on passe un bon moment, franchement, n'hésitez pas si vous êtes fan de ce mélange.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004661129', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1180, 'last_played': 1578545447}
review:
This is a quick review.

What does this game play like?
Kingdom Rush

Do you know what Kingdom Rush is? 
It's a basic Tower Defense game with a Hero.

However, Deathtrap expands upon Kingdom Rush. 

Deathtrap makes your Hero more connected to your Towers or Traps.

Furthermore, there is a loot system that gives you more customization over your hero and an intuitive challenge in what to build your hero out of.

I recommend Deathtrap but for the price of $20.... is pretty steep. I think it's a $10 worthy game until they optimize the reward system more and the sluggish waves.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982864139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2062, 'last_played': 1425486576}
review:
触った程度のプレイですが簡単に書いてみます。

[list]
[*]MAPにはタワーの設置できる箇所が決まっており、かつ4種類あるタワーのどの種類が設置かまで決まっています。
[*]タワー自体の強化をしていくことが可能
[*]TDでお馴染みの速度の変更は、x0.5・x1・x2の選択が可能
[*]ズームイン可能
[*]キャラクターのLV、装備品により強化していくことが可能
[*]装備品によるキャラクターの見た目もちゃんと変化
(ズームインしてプレイする機会が少ないためなかなか見れませんが)
[*]キャラクターの操作感は、Van Helsingをプレイしたことがある方なら見当がつくと思います。
未プレイの方でもTorchlightなどのハクスラをプレイされたことがあればすぐ慣れます。
[/list]

ゲームとしての感想ですが、TDが好きな方にはオススメできる作品です。
しかし、最初に書いた通り、タワーの設置に制限があるので、
タワーを建ててニヤニヤしながら見るのが大好き！という方にはしっくりこないかもしれません。
自分で敵を倒していかないとキツイような場面が自分にはありました。
またタワーによるルートの変更も不可能です。
キャラクター・タワーの成長、Tierや難易度の変更によるやり込みなど
まだ軽く触れた程度ですが、十分に楽しめる作品です。

Co-opに関しては未プレイなのでなんともいえませんが、4人まで対応のようです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198012715870', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1289, 'last_played': 1424519101}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007813977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 13381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3582, 'last_played': 1585432516}
review:
Standard Tower Defense --- Nicht!

Bei Deathtrap geht es nicht nur darum, simpel Türme irgendwo hinzustellen und zu warten, bis die Mobs umfallen, sondern man muss auch selbst Hand anlegen. Deathtrap ist ein bisschen Mischung aus Van Helsing und Tower Defense. Es droppen Gegenstände, Gold, Materialien, denn es gilt nicht nur die Türme aufzurüsten mit - wie Tim Taylor sagen würde - mehr Power, sondern auch den eigenen Character, den man bei der Erstellung aus 3 Kategorien wählen kann.

Die Tower und Fallen können zudem, statt den Schaden zu erhöhen, mit Special Effects ausgestattet werden, so dass sich später sinnvolle Combos ergeben. Die Giftfalle z.B. kann mit der Eigenschaft versehen werden, die physische Resistenz des Mobs herabzusetzen, was dem Guntower nebenan sicher gut gefällt.
Was mich beeindruckt hat ist, dass die Mobs halt nicht nur dem vorgegeben Pfad folgen, sondern auch vom Char weggelockt werden können. So kann man z.B. den Boss, der fast am Kristall ist, von dem wieder weglocken und z.B. über die Fallen ziehen. Also eine Art Aggro-Management.

Es gibt eine Crafting Section, in der man sich mit den erbeuteten Materialien auch - sofern man die Blaupause gefunden hat - selbst Items zusammenzimmern und -auseinandernehmen kann.
Bestimmte Fallen oder Tower werden erst nach Erreichen bestimmter Ziele freigeschaltet.

Die Karten können recht gross und ein bisschen unübersichtlich werden, daher gibt es hier und da Warpportale, mit denen man sich schnell auf der Karte bewegen kann.

Es gibt sowohl einen Coop- als auch Versus-Modus. Im Coop können bis zu 4 Spieler zusammen Mobs kloppen und in Versus-Modus (1 vs 1) übernimmt ein Spieler den Angreifer und einer die Verteidigung.

Und wer das Game in allen 4 Schwierigkeitsstufen durchgespielt hat, der kann sich in dem mitgelieferten, wirklich einfach zu bedienenden, Editor seine eigenen Levels schustern.
Die Grafik und der Sound sind wirklich ansprechend. Leider kann man (momentan) die Maps nicht drehen, was es manchmal (aber nicht oft) ein bisschen unübersichtlich macht.
DLCs sind sicher schon in Vorbereitung, im Hauptmenü befindet sich schon der entsprechende Knopf.

Alles in allem kann ich das Spiel bedenkenlos empfehlen. 
Von mir 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122861001', 'num_games_owned': 1638, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1618896907}
review:
Deathtrap combines the elements of tower defense and RPGs, making gameplay utterly unique. Controls are easy to understand, and the "towers", each of them have their own strength and weaknesses. It balances perfectly. I love how each button is assigned a hotkey for new players to follow.
This is a very good game. I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016237630', 'num_games_owned': 650, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 5658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2472, 'last_played': 1444676769}
review:
[RUS / ENG]

Аддиктивная вещь. И на на РУССКОМ - для раздумающих приобрести, несмотря на указанное на странице игры. 
Интересная смесь Tower Deffence и RPG. Давно хотелось чего-то подобного, пусть никогда и не был поклонником фэнтезийных вселенных. Лично для меня эта игра является в некотором смысле новой высотой, и я благодарен разработчиком за подобную смесь жанров, да к тому же так качественно сделанную (багов, несмотря на статус раннего доступа, пока не обнаружено). 
Приятная графика, не напрягающая музыка, простое управление, масса возможностей для прокачки как самого героя, так и башенок/ловушек. Удобно то, что очки способностей не используются раз и навсегда, а могут сбрасываться и переназначаться (за соответствующую плату, конечно, но денег всегда хватает). И чем дальше - тем больше. Поначалу кажется что карт маловато, но потом открывается масса вариантов, в т.ч. и на всё возрастающей сложности, что позитивно сказывается на реиграбельности (т.к. всегда есть куда стремиться, есть интерес, стимул). Всегда есть челлендж. Кто-то отмечает, что башенки же могут устанавливаться на строго определённые места и считает это недостатком. Я так не считаю, и судить лишь по начальным главам о всех возможностях, в т.ч. установки ловушек, не стоит. Чем сложнее этап, тем всё больше мест установки и многообразней выбор. И конечно же совместные режимы, которые выглядит в данном случае очень интересно.


Addictive thing!
Interesting mix of Tower Deffence and RPG. Long wanted something similar, albeit never been a fan of fantasy universes. Personally for me, this game is in a sense a new high, and I am grateful to the developers for such a mix of genres, and besides, so qualitatively made (bugs, despite the status of early access, not yet discovered).Nice graphics, do not tense music, simple controls, plenty of opportunities to pump both the hero and towers / traps. Conveniently, abilities points are not used once and for all, and can be reset and reassigned (for a fee, of course, but always enough money).  At first it seems that the card is not enough, but then opens up a host of options, including and on the ever-increasing complexity, which positively affects the replayability (because there is always room for improvement, there is interest, the stimulus). There is always a Challenge. Someone said that the turret can be mounted on the same strictly defined place and considers it a disadvantage. I do not think so, and judged only on the initial chapters about all the possibilities, including trap, do not. The more complex stage, the more and more places and more diverse range of installation. And, of course cooperative modes, which in this case looks very interesting.

review: Great game! Pretty simple tower defence game, with Diablo-clone RPG elements in to it. Graphically not so much up to date, gameplay wise very very good. author: {'steamid': '76561198001216533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 4235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4155, 'last_played': 1425243709}
review:
[b]Update![/b]
Rewards and EXP in the so called endless mode are only given away after you lost!
So when the game crashes before you lost you will get nothing! [b]Example:[/b]
Game Crashed at wave 95 (After several hours of gameplay; That wave 95 crash is actually a repeatable bug)
Exp gained 0
Reward 0
The only reward i gained was the electric bill for my electriccompany!

[u][b]and to everyone that is now thinking:[/b][/u]
"Endless mode is only a little part of this game"
Not for me! I have right now 24h gamingtime (actualy it is only around 15h because the game once was 8-9h in mainmenu while i was sleeping) and i think i put atleast 5 hours in this particular game that crashed at wave 95!
21% (33% when you are using my "real" gamingtime) of my gamingtime that i "invested" in this game was useless and funbreaking!

So that repeatable bug destroyed 33% of my whole game-experince!!!

But if you as clueless as 99% of this community you will never reach above wave 20 in an endless mode. So encountering the wave 95 bug is only for people that can develope own gaming tatics without reading any gaming guides.

[b]Rewards at high lvl waves:[/b]
So i tried it again because they made the endless mode alot more difficult. Its true! i "only" managed to get to wave 73 with my [u][b]low level[/b][/u] char... (rank 1 on that map btw the 2nd best player managed only to get to wave 44)  And what was the reward for another 5h gameplay? 2000 gold (thats nothing) and trash items you can buy for 1000 gold at the shop!
Making the waves harder but don't adjust the reward! thats really the worst!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017282794', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1537363365}
review:
Diablo meets TD.
This game. Wow.

This game features ARPG elements with skills and equipments for your own character while managing variety of traps for fixed locations.
I'd say the campaign seems a bit short, but with community maps I suspect this game can survive like L4D2.
The soundtrack is awesome. Could use a bit more variety perhaps.
Could update with more classes as well,

The only complain I have right now is there are too little people playing it and it makes it hard to find public co-op play.

8/10 would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053135080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1423289719}
review:
This game is annoying. Annoying because I love RPG's, and I love Tower Defense games, but it's just too unpolished still which makes playing it (especially with a gamepad) a frustrating experience. Some of the issues that need to be addressed: [list]
    [*]The controller experience is absolutely terrible, especially when navigating various UI screens. The icon that tells you what to press is too small, doesn't stand out enough, and is never in a consistent location which means you end up hunting to find the button that you're meant to press.
    [*]The UI in general is pretty bad, with dialogs and detail popups frequently covering other controls or even in some instances important things like tower range rings.
    [*]There's no way to exit back to the map, so you have to force quit the game if you accidentally select the wrong level.
[/list]
Seriously, it's so bad that it should basically be redesigned from the ground up... if any UI design conventions were followed, they were all the wrong ones. Neocore, do yourselves a favour and hire a User Experience Designer (or if you've already got one, a new one that actually knows what they're doing / doesn't drink heavily on the job).

author: {'steamid': '76561198040401422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1554845333}
review:
Deathtrap is a hybrid tower defense game crossed with an isometric action role-playing game by Neocore, the developers of the Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing series.

The Great:

- Very satisfying trap and level design makes for top notch tower defense aspects
- High production values makes the game feel adn play very well
- Great RPG mechanics make the playing of the level as fun as the strategy (better than just watching your towers do their work)
- Significant layers of interlocking strategies (leveling up traps and player character at the same time) allowing impressive variety in playstyles
- Provides the same compulsive gameplay of other tower defense games with the added benefit of being able to play the levels yourself
- Levels are well designed and rarely if ever rely on cheap tower defense tricks (e.g. sending all the bosses up the previously least used path)
- Steam workshop support will give this game hours of additional playtime possibilities

The Good:

- Optional side objectives make for more interesting moment to moment gameplay
- Difficulty ramping is well-balanced and appropriate
- Good Steam support for achievements, cloud saving, and trading cards

The Bad:

- The campaign is slightly short with it able to be completed in about 5-6 hours which is offset by heavy modding support which should give this game hundreds of new maps to play
- Does not tie itself very much into its sister games (The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing series) which is a missed opportunity for expanding both series

Conclusion:

This is a slightly odd complaint, but I think Neocore could have done better than they did with this.  After two exceptional games in the The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing I and II, I was expecting more of that to come over into this game.  The story, the characters, the world are all too shallow compared to their earlier works.  I beat this game in a day's time which is almost impossible for my schedule, and I got a great game, but I was expecting more.

Still, this is one of the best tower defense games around complimented by incredibly engaging RPG elements for the both the player character and the tower defense aspects at a bargain price.  It would be nearly impossible for me not to recommend.

9.0 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995540826', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1565896557}
review:
Годный tower defence. 
Ещё играя в таверки ван хельсинга мне приходила в голову мысль вот бы разработчики сделали отдельную игру, и не прошло и года, как наткнулся на  сиё творение от тех же самих разрабов.  Что сказать, игра нисколько не разочаровала. Много различных пушек и апгрейдов к ним, возможность прокачивать, обмундировать героя (диабло стаил) и им учавствовать в битве, а также крафт вещей и многое другое. 
Три разных класса, кооператив, НЕ мультяшная графика (ура!), поддержка фанатских карт из steam workship. 
В общем любители жанра обязательно должны ознакомится.

review:
- Если игра вылетает сразу после запуска . 

If you are a win8.x user, then:

Set the MeasuredHardwarePerformance to 0, it can be found at (type "regedit" to the run field )HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\NeoCore Games\Deathtrap\Options

It's a common issue, with win8.x systems, we will try to force 0 value, so you won't have to in the future. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198080647536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 5288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4299, 'last_played': 1429549894}
review:
If you like Tower Defense or RPGs, this game is a must have! 
The only game that is remotely comparable to Deathtrap is Sanctum2, where you can also join the battle after the building phase.
But Deathtrap has much more depth and customizations, you get loot, you can buy and craft items, you get xp and pick skills, just like a "real" rpg. And so far I have only played one of the three character classes...
Each Trap (=towers) has 5 different attributes that can be leveld up, so you have to specialize on something. Theres probably a lot of replayability, especially with the co-op multiplayer part, I havent even tried yet.
The only initial disappointment for me was, that you cannot freely place any trap anywhere. There are fixed positions on which you can place a certain class of trap, and you cannot block paths of the monsters. However, it turned out to be a very good design choice, it makes the game more fluid than this endless boring maze building that you have in almost every tower defense game.
I rarely review a game so early, but even though I've seen only a fraction of the content yet, it was already worth every cent.

EDIT after >50 h gametime:  Still hooked by this game. Probably the best co-op mode of any tower defense out there!  A few things still need to be balanced, but overall the game is huuge. Now, exucse me, I have to get more gold, loot, xp....

author: {'steamid': '76561197972684485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1644486019}
review:
THE GOOD:  Solid tower defence, RPG elements, side quests, level editor, workshop, decent hack'n'slash, well made, easy to learn.
THE BAD:  One game crash (probably my fault), music can get annoying.
A fantastic blend of tower defence, han'n'slash and RPG.  Many small considerations have clearly gone into making this game as good as it can be, and that attention to detail is really noticeable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118706206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1480146393}
review:
ちょっと触った感想
英語はとても苦手なのですがプレイにたいした支障はありませんでした。
ザックリ言えばコミカルさを抜いたオークモストダイ＋ハクスラ
移動や攻撃などはクリック（ちなみに初期設定では矢印キーで移動、設定でWASDに出来ます）で出来るので、その手のゲームに慣れてる人にはとっつきやすいかも

ステージが終わった後や、エリアにこっそり置いてある宝箱を開けたときにジャラっとアイテムやゴールドが出る。
その感覚が私はハクスラの醍醐味だと思っているので結構嬉しかったりします。

肝心のディフェンスステージは今の所可も無く不可もなくと言った所でしょうか（まだ超序盤しかやってない）

このゲームをやってヘルシングのデフェンスステージを思い出したのは私だけでしょうか(笑)

author: {'steamid': '76561197973144977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1423199022}
review:
I play with a controller on my couch, with the TV about 6 or 7 feet in front of me. There's a lot of text in this game, lots of reading. The text is unreadable from that distance at any resolution, there must be a problem with UI scaling. The game is unplayable unfortunately, which is too bad as I was looking forward to it. 

Don't buy this game unless you sit close to your monitor, or have binoculars.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970514210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 5228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1380, 'last_played': 1447289036}
review:
I remember playing Van Helsing 2 and during the tower defense mini game thinking "This should be a whole game."

Neocore have outdone themselves and surpassed my expectations and hopes. Well worth the 15 dollars I spent on it, seeing as I have 24 hours in vh1 (and I played through that completely,) And already have 15 hours in this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014380385', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1429128288}
review:
Как только увидел я надпись Early Access, неистовым ужасом подкралось ко мне чувство неуверенности в сохранении людского рода, но все же рискнул и нажал заветное «В корзину».

И вот через одну кружку чая – ведь именно столько времени нужно, чтоб загрузить 2ГБ отборного кода и вот я  со свойственным скептицизмом  начал погружение в Смертельные ловушки чьего то больного рассудка.

Но ближе к делу – DeathTrap это олицетворение -трех Д.Более похожих на Dungeon Defenders и Diablo. Будоражащая смесь - Графический движок, не уступающий современным Инди проектам и геймплей, так бережно копирующий излюбленные нам игры в жанре Action RPG.

Господа из NeocoreGames выбрали праведный путь и не стали изобретать велосипед, а лишь добавили чуточку фантазии и кооператив для четырех приключенцев в уже годный формат, за что им огромное спасибо.
Так же стоит отметить, Не принуждающее вскрывать себе вены музыкальное сопровождение, плавно сопроводит вас в мир гринда и тактических размышлений, но продолжатся это будет не так долго как хотелось бы. 
Ведь стоит нам только почувствовать кровь на наших клавиатурах, так сразу игра напоминает нам, что находится в стадии разработки и на данный момент доступно Не так много подземелий как хотелось бы. 

Но и этот шаг хитрецы предусмотрели, ведь игра имеет поддержку Steam WorkShop и встроенный редактор уровней позволяющий воплотить в красивый пиксель все, что вы так отчаянно прячете в своих фантазиях. 


======================
Как итог: если вы проявили хоть долю симпатии, к выше упомянутым образам и у вас чисто случайно завалялось 400 рублей и вы прям весь такой успешный бизнесмен который после тяжелого рабочего дня не жену ублажает, а за ПК отдыхает, то этот проект - для вас.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036046196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1472622022}
review: A very fun tower defense, with loot and RPG elements. I would recommend this to whoever's been bored of Diablo 3. For only $20, you won't regret this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010922980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1659, 'last_played': 1441827031}
review:
After playing The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing I & II coop with my <3, Deathtrap was actually a brilliant surprise. The RPG games also by NeocoreGame had a simillar element just like Deathtrap when defending Van Helsing's Lair. Every time we got another quest that would sent us back we hoped it was one of these, so of course the moment I saw Deathtrap on the steam store I had to get it for both of us and since then, even so it was a pre-release game until yesterday, it was one of the best pre-release experiences I had so far. Content was added frequently, I've not seen one obvious bug in the whole time and the map creator is awesome.

I'd recommend it to everyone who already loves the Van Helsing RPGs and enjoys tower defence games. It definitely was already worth the money before the actual release and now even more so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014114016', 'num_games_owned': 972, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 2831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1645, 'last_played': 1424388338}
review:
This game is a combination of ARP (torchlight, diablo, van helsing game people made this one) & tower defense gameplay. It's pretty fun, and allows you to create your own personal maps which can also grant you more xp and gold helping you to build your character between campaign levels.

There are two main progression areas for each character. The character's personal skills and skill levels for combat and buffs, and the character's trap points to invest in different kinds of traps. The trap points are earned by beating official maps at different difficulty levels. Character levels and skill points can also be earned in workshop maps, at least when I played last about a month and a half or so ago (in early access). 

Creating your own map seems intimidating at first but you get the hang of the wave & group creator pretty quickly and placing trap tiles and shaping out the map itself is very easy. Some very cool shapes and types of waves and defenses are possible from the map maker and you can upload/download maps with the workshop easily. I want to see some maps shaped like the subscreen maps in the original legend of zelda peoples. Please do dis.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999394473', 'num_games_owned': 1813, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 4260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1449606826}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025041340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1423158762}
review:
tldr; The game concept would be fun, but the controls just make it so damned frustrating to play.

The game concept is nice, similar to dungeon defenders, really.  The problem, however, is that its leveling goals are so lofty that each individual powerup you place doesn't feel all  that useful.  The biggest issue, though, by far is the controls.  The keyboard controls involve, what I suspect, is having 3 hands.  While you can rebind the keys it doesn't feel much better.  By default movement is the arrow keys and skills are the number keys, and, strange enough, some are bound to the mouse as well.  The controler buttons are not spelled out in the tutorials at all, so it took me a hell of a long time to figure out which gamepad control did what when navigating the menus, not everything is selectable via the joystick, but rather a combination of left and right bumpers and triggers both, a very odd setup to be sure.  Now, when you get all of that down, the targeting is even still much worse.  The melee fighter isn't so bad, but the mage has a hell of a time facing the way you want her to, and her lightning spell, which eminates out towards her facing and hits multiple targets, tends to be ever so slightly off center and instead of getting a whole group, you wind up hitting just a couple monsters.  Her tower buff spell, as well, seems to activate on nothing at all, and feels wasted, or it will activate on a tower i didn't think I had selected (selection happening by running near the towers).

author: {'steamid': '76561198060978988', 'num_games_owned': 713, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1547, 'last_played': 1423373278}
review:
This is just a temporary 1st impression using Marksman up to lv 16/100.

So far, for me at least, this is the best TD game I have ever played. An insane amount of character and trap customization. Char customization comes from exp levels and loot whereas trap customization comes from gaining trap points from completing new stages, completing quests, passives from character skill points, and char gear.  There could be more than I know about because I am only lv 16/100 on Marksman. Multiple Marksman can be spec'd completely differently so it adds a lot to co-op even if players are the same class.  There is also trap synergizing going on. Lots of it! I will write a more detailed review once i have experienced more of the game.

Bottomline.....if you like Tower Defence games then there is a lot to love here. More than I currently can comprehend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992083855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1424470299}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972039165', 'num_games_owned': 1596, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 54842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1687970496}
review: They have taken what was a minor feature (wanted so much to play it more in Van Helsing) and created this wonderfull game.  Easy to pick up, tons upon tons of options for upgrades and the pace feels just right.  So many things to do its making my head  dizzy.  This has to be the best tower defence game ever, all the rest just pale with the features in this game and add to this the wonderful art/palete of Van Helsing

author: {'steamid': '76561198126671655', 'num_games_owned': 1379, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 1054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1435265871}
review:
Deathtrap????????? 

ตัดสินใจซื้อเกมนี้เพราะ เห็นว่ามันเล่นออนไลน์กับเพื่อนได้แค่นั้นเอง แต่ลองเข้าไป ดู โฮส แม่งเตะเอา เตะเอา ผมนี้งงไปเลย แต่ก็ไม่เป็นไร ไม่มีใครอยากไห้เล่นด้วยก็เล่นคนเดียวแม่งเลย  หลังจากเล่นจบไปประมาน สามด่านแล้วโอโห อะไรมันจะสุดยอดปานนั้น ผมนี้ไม่อยากนอนเลย แต่พอดีพรุ่งนี้ไปทำงานแต่เช้า เลยต้องพักเอาแรงก่อน

สำหรับ Deathtrap เป็นเกม ผสมผสานระหว่าง เกมแนว Tower Defense กับเกม แนว Diablo ได้อย่างดีเยี่ยม มีระบบร้านค้า ระบบคราฟ อาวุธ อัพเกรดอาวุธเข้าไปแล้วก็ระบบเก็บเลเวล ที่จริงผมไม่เคยคิดมาก่อนเลยว่า เกมสองแนวนี้มันจะรวมกันได้ ไห้นึกภาพ ว่า กำลังเล่นเกม Tower Defense กับเกม Diablo พร้อมกันนั่นเอง

บทสรุปสำหรับ Deathtrap
-การเล่น ออนไลน์จะง่ายกว่านี้ ถ้าเป็นระบบ แสดงรายชื่อห้อง
-อาวุธใช้เงินทุนซื้อสูงมาก ซึ่งผู้เล่นต้องมีความอดทนละเล่นยาวๆ หน่อย
-เกมนี้เป็นเกมใช้เวลาเล่นนานหน่อยนะครับ ลองเช็คได้จากการทำ Archivement
-การสร้างป้อมต่างๆ ใช้แต้มสูงไปนิด ถ้าเล่นระดับยาก อาจดับ ไปง่ายๆ

คะแนนสำหรับ Deathtrap ในเวลานี้ผมให้ 9/10 ไปเลยครับ สุดยอดมาก เหมาะสมกับราคา คนไทยจับต้องได้........

author: {'steamid': '76561198006878945', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 2397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1521527366}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053308172', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1423152867}
review:
Diablo II is VERY VERY near and dear to my heart. I liked VH1 and 2, and I´ve always quite enjoyed H&S games - And this gme is an amazing mix of the two genres!

Often I play a game for 1-2 hours and then uninstalling it (Steam states I´ve played for 3 hours, but it´s more like 5-6, coz theam us f***ing up, and only lets me play offline IDK why) but besides that...

I find myself wanna play constantly! I bought the game yesterday (4th of Feb.) for full price, and today I saw it was 10% off and was quite annoyed - But Neocoregames has a funny sence of humor with liking to screw me over with discounts right after I´ve bought their games - BUT even that don´t annoy me now, that I´ve played some more.

It has insane ammount of upgrades, and flexible diffs. which means ALOT of playability and grinding (some people like that, some don´t) I normally don´t like grindfests, but in this game I don´t mind that. The combination of ARPG and TD is something rare - and it´s made FLAWLESSLY!!!!

The way the player HAVE to be active not to be totally run over, is what makes it so fun.

I play on a quite midrange gaming PC, and I play on the highest graphics, and it runs som smooth - I don´t notice any lag at all.

The 2 only thing I miss, is that your attacks seems kindda lackluster - They don´t feel that impactful, which is a real shame. My main char. is a mage(Sorc.) and her most powerfull attack feels like a mere mouthblow :/

And it would be really nice if you could overview what kindda traps on there is on the upcomming map, before you enter.

Gameplay: 9/10 - Missing impact-feeling on attacks
Mechanics: 10/10
Replayability: 10/10 - Due to the flexible diffs.


EVEN if you don´t get in on sale,, it´s worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041978146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1048, 'last_played': 1432600689}
review:
(Note - Review subject to change with further play.)

---------------------------

If the idea of a game that's about 75% Orcs must Die and 25% Diablo appeals to you, this is right up your alley.


Pros:

+ Core gameplay is simple and intuitive
+ Solid controller support
+ Flexible difficulty

Cons:
-UI is cluttered, lacking focus points to draw the eye to important information
-Overall visual design is somewhat cluttered (I found it gave me eye strain rather quickly)

Subjectives (could be pro or con depending on what you're looking for):
~ Clockwork/Steampunk aesthetic
~ Player actively participates in combat
~ Lots of upgrades (thus lots of grinding)
~ Steam Workshop support

------------------------------

EDIT: Minor issue -- Achievements are screwy as hell. I got the achievement for beating all the levels... 3 levels in. I also got the achievement for getting each of the three classes to level 10 after only getting one of them to level 10. It's not a big deal and doesn't affect my recommendation, but if you care about such things, take note.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027802238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1561335556}
review:
Often I buy a game because It's concept looks good, or i've seen some gameplay, But generally I've been playing games for a long time and become bored easily or find that the game I bought underwhelms me and I move on after an hour or two, This game is not like that, I love diablo and tower defense games, hack and slash rpg's, these are some of my favorites and this game melds all of those aspects into 1 and does so flawlessly, If you like tower defense or hack and slash even a little then this game is an absolute killer buy. In short its fantastic and worth every penny, easily a 10/10 and I very rarely out of something like 120 games on steam can say I am this satisfied, Its one of those games I gurantee you will buy and then play to death and come back to as well.


Rating 10/10
Replayability 10/10
concept 10/10
gameplay 10/10
value 10/10

In short buy this awesome shit, you won't regret it


p.s. this game is absolutely full featured, no nickle and diming with dlc's like most do, they actually gave us a fully fledged and complete product, but if they did come out with some dlc (which i hope they do) I will buy on the spot without hesitation as i trust this dev and believe they will easily give me my money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058010373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1443336886}
review:
This game is actually brilliant. Being a fan of tower defence games, and Games like Sanctum/Sanctum 2, i have to say that this game is right up there with the other games.

Gamplay
8-10
The gameply is fun, and addicting, each match can last from 10 minutes to half an hour and probably even longer in the harder levels. the gamplay is quite simple. just defend a portal that leads to the real world. waves of enemy are trying to invade the real world using portals and the only way to stop them is by setting up traps and towers, along with firghting yourself. there are currently 3 classes the sorceress who is able to use magic to defend all incoming lanes at once or is able to quickly take down/defend one lane really quickly, the ranger who uses guns and distance weapons * havn't played much of him yet) and a heavily armoured character(can't remember what class he is and again havn't played him much) Each of these classes have differeent skills that you level as you progress. Deathtrap alos has an rpg element as you can roam around the levels as the defending stage is going on and defeat map bosses and gain keys to chest littered throuout the stage.

Graphics
7/10
truthfully, i enjoy the graphics at first glance i did not, and thought they were not that good, but in game the look decent. it complements the game completely. The blood and effects are all quite nice and allow for the gamplay to look better.

Story
2/10
So far from what i know the story is simplistic in nature. the gist is that you are in these ancient ruins ( or something like that, again i havn't played through the begining cinematic/information more then once) to which the humans defended agains monsters centuries beforehand. and as you are in these ruins the monsters apear again and it is up to you to stop them from reaching the portals. ( again i will probably update this review the more i play) 

Overall
7/10
So far it is a brilliant game, i am yet to try the co op experiance but i am sure it will make it even better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963286660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1124, 'last_played': 1424298096}
review:
I was looking really forward to this one, and I still kinda am. The thing is, I can play Dying Light on medium settings with 50-60 FPS, but this game only gets me like 10-20 FPS on lowest, unplayable, not optimized as it should be. My Lenovo Y-50-70 laptop rig: GeForce GTX 860m, Intel Core i7-4710HQ @ 2.50 GHZ, 16 GB RAM, so it should be able to handle this game a bit better. Might change my rewiew if it gets updated in the future. The gaming looks promising though.

------ EDIT -----
I got the game working thanks to the helpful comments, even a guy from their team helped out, thanks guys. So I got to play the game, and I must admit it's absolutely amazing! I would categorise it as a Tower Defense game with a Diablo twist - and I really enjoy it. The campaign is cool, I love the way you level up like a RPG and also the skill system is cool. I haven't played the original game, where TD was a mini-game as I understand, so I have nothing to compare with, but I really like it. I'm not much off a reader, as I work as a dev, and would like my brain to rest when I'm playing games. Some voices could be added to read the long texts or some TL;DR for the sake of laziness. I've played 16 hours in 2 days. Almost got addicted, so I can easily recommend this if you are a tower defense lover.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013328690', 'num_games_owned': 683, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 1885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1110, 'last_played': 1423658244}
review:
Neocore at it's best. 
What they did with Van Helsing and the action-rpg-genre they even topped here.

Deathtrap plays in the world of Van Helsing, art-style, grafics-quality and even sound-design have been way improved.
The whole ambience is just lovely, the melancholic world feels even more enganging than it did back in the VH-series.

The gameplay itself is in my opinion what makes this game an absolute must for action-rpg or tower-defense fans. 
Controls feel tight and responsive, traps, placing, upgrading even gettin ressources just feels "right".
The loot-system and especialy the way you can build your characters is simply addicting, tons of diffrent gear-parts, skills, upgrades, etc. offer countless possibilities.
Enemies offer diffrent challenges which work great, beeing it mass hordes or single elite monsters they feel logic (game mechanics) and refreshing in many cases.
Ontop of all that you get a great coop-mode, the chance to make your own custom maps (and share 'em).

I was not the biggest fan of of tower-def-games, Deathtrap converted me....join the cult ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198041066484', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1054, 'last_played': 1509914023}
review:
tl;dr: Combine a classic tower defense game with a version of Diablo, where there are less item drops. Already runs great in Early Access!


I read about this game in a german news-magazine for video games. It sounded interesting, so I decided to give it a try. This is my short resumee after playing for roughly 8 hours, so this review is subject to change, just like the game aswell!

Gameplay:
Imagine a mixture between classic tower defense games and Diablo. Now imagine only 5% of the loot drops and a lighter character menu. Additionally imagine upgradeable towers, where you first have to unlock these upgrades by spending skill points on them, then you have to buy the upgrades on each map again when placing the tower. There're set places where to build the traps. The gameplay is really well working, insanely fluently and feels great, charging by it this game wouldn't need to call itself "Early Access".

Maps:
The maps all look different and you need certain tactics if playing on hard in order to beat them. The variety is not that big at the moment (like 10 maps or so), but there're more to come. Additionally, there's modding!

Items:
Works like Diablo, with smaller drop chances. Also, mainly bosses and giant enemies will drop items.

Characters:
There are three different classes, a melee-fighter, a sorceress and an unreleased one. You can only customise them by finding different looking gear.

What I didn't check out by now:
-Modded maps
-Coop-mode
-Versus-mode

I hope this short review will help you decide wether to buy Deathtrap or not.
