author: {'steamid': '76561197992813688', 'num_games_owned': 2446, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 2256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1977, 'last_played': 1430403486}
review:
[h1]Van Helsing meets "real" tower defense[/h1]

Another game by Neocore? Tower defense? With RPG-elements? Sounds familiar?
If you remember the cute tower defense-interludium of [i]"The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing"[/i] Part 1 and 2, and did not hate it, you'll feel right at home here.

The progress they've made since initial release are nice. Lots of added levels, lots of traps and the second of three classes.
Already enough content to keep you busy for a bunch of hours.

But...early access?
There's nearly no doubt they will deliver a fully working and polished product. And I'm a very mistrusting dude :-)

[u]The good:[/u]
[list]
[*] Solid performance, many options to tweak it, and non-exclusive full-screen already added. Yay!
[*] Nice soundtrack (so far)
[*] Many more or less different enemies, each with its own strength and weakness
[*] More than enough traps, some to unlock, and each upgradeable in 3 different ways
[*] Skill-System close to that of the Van Helsings, of course a lot less skills
[*] "Campaign"-Mode, Endless-mode, Different tiers, "Scenarios" (campaign with different options to make it harder), so enough re-playability for a TD-game
[*] Most maps have some side-objectives with bonus-loot, or some special traps only valid there
[*] RPG Elements! You can equip your character with stuff which drops from killed creatures. Or you could buy and sell them in between maps. Love it :)
[*] It even has crafting. Very basic but totally adequate. 4 resources which you either get as drops or by salvaging other drops. You can find/buy better recipes for better stuff. Yay!
[*] Most maps have bonus objectives to keep you busy or challenged. Like "kill these neutral", "play without dealing damage yourself", "don't upgrade any trap", "don't use this type of trap" etc.
[*] Even the second or third "Tier" (replaying the same maps on higher difficulty) isn't boring, each map is changed slightly and the waves/paths/monsters are different
[*] Even after level 30 you're still on your way of unlocking traps, always keeps you motivated!
[*] Workshop! Many maps to play and whatever may come too...
[*] Super easy editor! Create your own maps in minutes!
[/list]

[u]The bad:[/u]
[*] The main-fighting music, which plays on every map continuously (yet, may change i hope) becomes annoying really fast :)
[*] Placement of traps is pre-defined for each map, as is the type of that trap on the allowed spots. Kills a lot of the freedom to improve/modify a strategy. Some may like this approach, i hate it.
[*] It's annoying you can't see what enemies will come in the next map (so re-skill your traps accordingly) before you're IN that map. And at that point you then don't see which traps are skilled (so you can upgrade them).
[/list]

Recommended? 
YES! Except you hated the whole concept of the TD-interludiums in the Van-Helsing-titles or you hate RPG-aspects in a TD. Else there's no reason you won't like this one if you like TD.

It's not perfect (but which TD is?), but it got charm, a unique setting and enough re-playability-value for manymanymany hours to play. And it even keeps you motivated beyond level 30 or Tier2 due to unlocking the last traps or getting new items to steadily become better.
This is really a great blend of action-RPG and TD. Well actually it's the only game of this kind :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970873393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1099, 'last_played': 1423330601}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991967353', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1565, 'last_played': 1483732696}
review:
excellent tower defence with lots of options for difficulty that makes replays both refreshing and genuinely fun. as well as having a really rich rpg element.

PROS
+ many different towers to choose from and ways to unlock more
+ rpg aspects, loot, items, character skills/stats, and crafting. the items and crafting are really weak right now in early access but the ground work they have is excellent. as soon as they implement more stuff its really going to shine 
+ 2 different classes of characters (3 total at launch) all able to use all types of towers
+ single player co-op and pvp, the pvp is a very neat and exciting mode something i think i will enjoy a lot more once the full game launches and things become more polished
+ the level pacing vs difficulty, really fantastic how well the dev's have paced your character progess to match with the levels and tower implementation (when you unlock certain types of towers) ive felt at times i was too over powered for a certain level but there was very rarely a time that i moved on to either the next level or next difficulty and felt that it was no challenge at all
+ the diversity of enemies. at first i found the types of mobs to be a bit bland, but as more mini bosses and bosses started to appear with special traits the diversity really exploded. your going to run into some unexpected outcomes from the way some of them interact with each other.

CONS
 i really only have one complaint with the game so far and it seems to be a running issue with this dev's games.. that would be the multiplayer, granted its early access so i assume its going to get a lot better when full launch comes around. but even so i can see a lot of the same troubles van helsing 2 had with its multi in that its a little convoluted not stream lined in the least ya kinda gotta jump through some hoops. if they can do a thing or two to optimise its multiplayer id have to say this is my hands down favorite tower defense.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999542240', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1516136362}
review:
If you ever played Ors Must Die you are going to enjoy this game. Its a mix of tower defence and fantasy action/rpg game, where you can build towers and upgrade your character with skills and items to defeat waves of foes. Despite the fact that it is still in alpha - most of the core features appear to be already in the game.

The levels look amazing and the amount of details is impressive as well. Each of them can be replayed numerous times on different difficulties and with different monsters as well as side quests like killing a special monster in the woods and opening a chest for an extra reward. There are also optional challenges on higher difficulties like only using specific towers or skills.

The monsters appear to be taken from a mix of gaelic/celtic and slavic mythos as well as their previous game King Arthur which seems to have inspired an overall look and feel of this game.

The items can be obtained from boss level monsters, chests, store (uses in game currency, the are no micro transactions here) or they can be crafted by using gems obtained from salvaging items or drops. Its pretty much the same as Diablo or Van Helsing in this regard, except there are less slots for your items.

Skills and traps can be upgraded and there are quite a few of them so you will have to prioritise and select upgrades that fit your play-style.

Overall i was impressed with this game and wanted to play it more but i do have some concerns. Neocore is infamously bad with engine optimizations and all of their games have suffered from low FPS and stuttering even on good rigs, ridiculous amounts of bugs, typos and other issues. This game appears to have quite a few issues as well: there are noticeable slowdowns when a lot of monsters appear at the same on the screen, the sound keeps crackling for no apparent reason, there are typos even in the options menu, there is quite a lot of stuttering when you use your skills on a lot of foes simultaneously and then there are CTD's one if which managed to crash my PC for the first time in 9 or so month's... which is kinda scary. Otherwise i am running it at highest settings and changing them does not appear to have any effect on performance.

I will give this game a positive review for now simply because it appears to be in a better state than most of the other early access games and it is in fact fun to play. However i might just change my mind a few month's from now if i don't see any improvement in performance. Hopefully it wont be another King Arthur 2 disaster.

P.S.

There's also a co-op mode which i am reluctant to try in case it will blow up my PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076408552', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1498332603}
review:
Quando se mistura tower-defense e Diablo, o resultado é Deathtrap, um tower-defense com elementos de RPG que todo amante do gênero deve jogar.

O jogo é bem simples: hordas de monstros virão, e você é o responsável para impedir seu avanço. Você só pode colocar armadilhas em pontos específicos no mapa. Existe uma grande variedade de armadilhas, de chão, atiradoras, invocadoras, etc.

Há três personagens jogáveis: Um guerreiro, uma maga, e um atirador. Cada um deles com suas habilidades e maneiras de jogar específicas. Conforme você for avançando, seu personagem ficará mais bem equipado e com habilidades mais poderosas.

Com o editor de mapas, a re-jogabilidade fica ilimitada, garantindo sua diversão (e também frustração) por horas.

Os inimigos são bem variados, com várias "classes", tem os gigantes, os voadores, e por ai vai. Cada armadilha é forte contra um tipo de monstro, porêm fraca contra outro tipo. Seu trabalho é ver qual será mais efetiva para a horda que virá.

O jogo também possuí um livro, onde fica registrados os detalhes de todos os monstros que você já enfrentou, como a velocidade, contra quais armadilhas ele é forte/fraco.

Os gráficos são muito bonitos, nada que vá exigir um PC top de linha, porêm nada que vá rodar numa calculadora.

A trilha sonora tem um tom macabro (como todo o jogo), que te deixa com sangue nos olhos, ansioso para esmagar o primeiro monstro que aparecer.

O combate e a movimentação são bem fluídos, é até gostoso de atacar.

Com certeza vale todo o dinheiro investido, e irá te prender por horas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060502964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 4532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1512755672}

author: {'steamid': '76561198170990971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1069, 'last_played': 1651107700}
review:
Ola sou novo nesse jogo, e estou precisando jogar co op...qdo estou pra entrar em party.....da lost tds party

author: {'steamid': '76561197978690233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1228, 'last_played': 1424174594}
review:
I wrote my initial review when the game was in Early Access. I said the buy was worth it to me but may not be worth it to other people yet. In short, it's now worth it. This is the updated review.

If you played Van Helsing, you're probably aware of the base defense quests. They felt forced in, and broke up the flow of the game. Here, that kind of thing is the whole game, and it stands pretty well on its own. They kept the gear and skill systems from VH, but made the skills focus on traps and towers rather than making the player character into a death machine them self.

You can still be a death machine though. You probably won't get far completely ignoring towers, but a few well placed skill points will make you more powerful than any tower you can build. You can lock down one path on a map with towers, then go murder everything on another path yourself, if you wish.

The game itself has personality. The voiceovers have emotion, the music is catchy and really presents a feeling of urgency to the battle ahead, and the battlefields feel like blighted woods, ancient ruins, and hidden machinations of lost technology. It all blends very well together to create a world you can just dive into.

There's a ton of replay value, as you'd expect in a game combining RPG and TD elements. There's 13 "Campaign" maps that form the core storyline, with three difficulty levels, most of them also containing a side-quest to go for during the chaos, then four "Tiers" that unlock as you complete the story. Tier IV Hard on these maps will require a fully geared character and a ton of skill.

On top of the Campaign, there's several maps that unlock after you beat the game that are designed for Scenario mode. Scenario mode allows you to take on certain debuffs in exchange for more rewards. You can play Scenario Mode on the Campaign maps too. And finaly there's Endless Mode, which is what it says on the tin.

On top of all of that, you get the Workship/map-editor, coop mode, a PvP versus mode... the game is quite huge. My one complaint of it all is the gameplay can get kind of samey and grinding once you've finished the Campaign, but I'm the kind of person who enjoys building up a character and getting to ridiculously high waves in endless TD games, so this one is right up my alley.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074672646', 'num_games_owned': 6653, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1417978953}
review:
[h1]Deathtrap est un superbe jeu médiéval fantastique de défense avec des tours[/h1]

Deathtrap est un tower defense (jeu de défense avec des tours) avec des éléments de jeu de rôle et le tout dans une ambiance plutôt médiéval fantastique.

Le jeu est en accès anticipé. Je l’ai regardé sur Windows et c’est génial, je l’ai joué sur Mac et là, j’ai pu constater que c’est bien de l’accès anticipé !

Une chose que je peux affirmer sans me tromper, c’est qu’une fois que ce jeu sera en version définitive, il va être génial.

Je suis un grand fan des jeux développés par le studio Neocore Games. Ils ont fait quelque chose d’excellent avec Les Aventures Incroyables de Van Helsing I et II. Et bien, Deathtrap est tout simplement dans cette lignée. On retrouve la même ambiance, la même qualité de travail.

J’ai eu l’occasion de jouer en multi-joueurs à Deathtrap. C’est toujours de l’accès anticipé. C’est bien, même très bien mais ce n’est pas mon jeu préféré de défense avec des tours en multijoueurs. MAIS, comme je le répète souvent, c’est de l’accès anticipé et quand le jeu sera en version finale, je suis persuadé que ce sera beaucoup mieux.

Vous aimez les jeux Van Helsing fait par le studio, vous aimez les jeux de défense avec des tours, vous aimez tout ce qui a une ambiance médiéval fantastique, et bien, Deathtrap est fait pour vous (comme pour moi !).

Pour découvrir l’ensemble des mes impressions sur [url=www.graal.fr/2014/12/08/test-deathtrap-la-version-pour-steam/]Deathtrap[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561197995436761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1448382043}
review:
tl;dr: If you like Tower Defense and you like ARPGs, then you'll really like Deathtrap

From the makers of the Van Helsing series comes Deathtrap which is a hybrid tower defense and ARPG. Veterans of the Van Helsing series will recognize the darker aesthetic right away and even meet some old monster "friends." The gane at this writing is Early Access but is already feature rich. At the moment you can choose between a Sorceress and a Merc. More classes will be added soon as well as new game modes. 

There is a huge amount of skills to upgrade both for your character and the traps themselves. Additionally you can upgrade world effects that do things like damage ALL baddies on the level for a short time. All skills have a cooldown period just as you would find in Diablo, Torchlight, Titan Quest and other ARPGs. Character skills are assigned as usual with left click being your primary attack, right secondary, and keys one through four as additional battle skills.

Before each wave you have the chance to look at the enemy wave information including the path as well as the monsters coming through the Chaos Gates. You must think tactically as to where to build your traps. Building them is as easy as clicking the middle mouse button and placing them. As the game progresses, more traps are unlocked and you can choose what to place. 

Traps are built through accumulating "essence." You can think of this as "mana" for the traps. The traps themselves are quite imaginative and fun. Acid sprays, lightning traps, ice, and even traps that have monsters that kill other monsters!

In addition to all of this and the coming excellent selection of game modes is one of the most intuitive map and monster editors I have ever seen. Making maps is a snap and what's more, they can be easily shared with your friends, enemies, and persons yet unknown on Steam.

It is quite clear that Neocore are becoming a marquee indie developer and the progression from the first Van Helsing game to Deathtrap clearly shows a developer who is maturing and willing to take risks. 

The music has the same sort of Eastern European feel that fits with the visual aesthetic of the game. As for the voice acting, it is serviceable but I wish Neocore had brought back the actress who voiced the acerbic Katrina in the Van Helsing series. Some of her lines were simply classic whereas the voice acting in this game is at this point just some lines repeated at random. They are not frequent enough to be annoying but, some variety would be nice.

Before each battle there are well written descriptions of the land you are about to enter. Again, it is clear that Neocore is building a franchise and creating very interesting lore.

Once upon a time I had ONE favorite tower defense game, Defense Grid. I still love it - especially the voice acting. But, the rich fantasy setting of Deathtrap combined with strong ARPG elements and a nice map and monster editor could possibly have me split my TD itch between Deathtrap and Defense Grid.

I have only 36 minutes in and the ONLY reason I stopped was to write this short impression of the game. A full review would not be fair as the game is not finished. That said, it is worth the price of admission at least for me. I bought this on the strength of the Van Helsing games and I do not regret it one bit. 

I am hooked on this and need to get back to work!

One word to laptop users who have both an integrated graphics card AND either an Nvidia or AMD: make sure to set Deathtrap to run with the dedicated Nvidia or AMD. It plays decently with integrated graphics but has a weird tendency to minimize itself. Running under the Nvidia has been quite stable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053879696', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1421421212}
review:
[h1]ハクスラ系タワーディフェンス[/h1]

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]個人的評価[/th]
        [td]78/100[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]
[list]
    [*]迫り来る敵の波状攻撃をタワーで撃退する
    [*]スキルポイントを使いタワーを強化
    [*]敵がドロップする装備で主人公を強化
[/list]

タワーだけに防御を任せるのではなく、主人公自らも戦うことになる。
この点は『Sanctum』や『Orcs Must Die!』と同じ。

しかし[u]差別化されているのは[b]視点[/b]と[b]雰囲気[/b][/u]。

[h1]視点と雰囲気[/h1]

見下ろし型の視点で、主人公の操作は典型的なハクスラ系そのもの。
雰囲気はダークファンタジー風にスチームパンクを併せたと言うと近い。

重厚な空気の中、迫る敵めがけて斧を振り下ろし、激しい鈍音と共に血飛沫。
魔法を放ち、空を飛ぶハーピーに目掛けて銃座が弾丸を浴びせかけ血飛沫。
孤独に世界で使命を全うし続けるような生き様を気に入るのならば、気に入るはず。

タワーの種類は銃座や電流装置、毒沼や獣の召喚など。

[h1]特徴[/h1]

類似した作品にも、タワーの性能を自分だけの戦略の下にビルドすることはあった。
しかし本作ではさらにビルド面に力を入れることで差別化に成功している。

ワールド画面ではタワーの基本性能を成長させ、戦闘画面ではさらにユニークな強化を行える。
「この砲台は重要位置だから威力も特殊能力も付加しよう」、といった具合に。
他作品ではせいぜい一律に能力付加や個々の単純強化に留まるが、本作は更に奥深い仕様。

また、他のタワーディフェンスと大きく違うのは建てられるタワーの制限。

多くのゲームでは敵の侵攻路にタワーを置くことで、敵を誘導することが可能だが、
本作では[u]「ここにはこの種類が置ける」「敵はここを通る」と初めから指定[/u]されており、
その制限が面白みを損なうことなく機能している。

「このルートでは遅滞戦闘を行わせながら、先にこちらを叩く」といった戦略を考えさせたり、
資金が貯まり次第に「新しく建造するべきか他を強化するべきか」と悩ませてくれる。

[h1]買うべきか否か[/h1]

同じマップであっても難易度やTierを変えることで別マップのように化け、
何度も繰り返し挑戦しながら主人公を強化し、独自の戦術を深めていくことに魅力を感じるのならば、このゲームを気に入ることは間違いない。

言語は英語のみだが、タワーの性能について難解な表現はないので安心。

author: {'steamid': '76561197984626177', 'num_games_owned': 1200, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1423390518}
review:
Avec toute la prudence qui s'impose dès lors qu'on touche à un early access, on peut s'estimer confiant devant ce Deathtrap, qui a déjà beaucoup à offrir, et qui est développé par Neocore, à qui l'on doit les hack'n slash "surprise" The Adventures of Van Helsing 1 et 2, qu'ils ont sorti avec beaucoup d'audace dans un moment où le mammouth de Blizzard accumulait les ventes, concurrencé gentiment par Torchlight 2.
Je connais des personnes qui ont préféré Van Helsing à Diablo 3. Plus de fraîcheur, plus de sincérité dans la démarche du développeur, et puis cet humour, ce sidekick formidable qu'est Lady Katarina, cette ambiance gothique très bien mise en valeur par une esthétique steampunk du meilleur goût. Le premier avait quelques soucis, mais le deuxième a amélioré la formule sur tous les points, en se payant même l'originalité d'intégrer des concepts de Tower Defense au sein même su Hack'n slash.
Vous voyez où je veux en venir, je suppose^^.
Forts de cette expérience, les petits gars de chez Neocore se sont dit : et si on inversait les bases du gameplay ?
Si on passait d'un h&ns mâtiné de Tower Defense à un Tower Defense mâtiné de h&ns ?
Et hop, le concept de Deathtrap était né !
Ainsi, contrairement à Van Helsing, dont il est pourtant très proche par l'ambiance, les menus, le design général du jeu, etc, Deathtrap est un authentique Tower Defense, avec des tours à améliorer, le coeur qu'il faut protéger, les vagues d'ennemis, les lignes rouges pour visualiser les chemins que les hordes démoniaques vont emprunter, bref, le coeur du gameplay d'un authentique Tower Defense.
La différence ? Elle est de taille !
Au début de la partie, vous créez un personnage parmi trois classes différentes. Ce personnage agit directement pendant les phases de défense, comme...dans un hack'n slash !!! Gestion de l'inventaire, des skills, objets rares, tout y passe, on se retrouve avec les figures imposées de tout h'ns qui se respecte.
Alors bien sûr, il faut aimer le Tower Defense, les allergiques au genre ne seront probablement pas intéressés par ce projet. Et encore, à bien y réfléchir, ce n'est même pas sûr ! Le jeu est tellement plaisant par ses visuels, son ambiance, et la tonne de choses à customiser/débloquer, qu'il pourrait bien faire de l'oeil aux réfractaires !
Si Neocore arrive à ajouter suffisamment de contenu (mais ça a l'air bien parti pour !), ils tiennent là une formule qui ne réinvente pas la poudre à canon, mais qui propose un mix de genres abouti et très agréable à jouer.
Décidément, je les aime bien, moi, Neocore =).
J'ai fait une vidéo ici :
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2K-wQ1I_Y-I

author: {'steamid': '76561198001748570', 'num_games_owned': 1499, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1417333396}
review:
Make the gameplay time 4hrs.

Death Trap, a top-down tower defense game from the looks of it, but also plays as horde mode with normal player combat, and with RPG elements like having a talent tree for different characters, and looting items and character armor.

Think Orcs Must Die 2, but top-down, more serious looking with a lot of dark fantasy characters and world, a little bit more in-depth with the skill trees for your character and for your turrets and traps, and having different armor to loot and wear with different stats, which is kind of neat to have and manage through, adding a different taste and perspective to the game type of tower defense and action RPG, with more stuff to do outside of combat.

I wasn't too sure about the game before playing it, thought it was going to be boring and not that good but it actually turned out to be fun, with the nice looking graphics and gameplay, plus the coop with more stuff added that I mentioned above, I had a great time playing it and there isn't much bad to talk about it that I can think of aside from the confusing moment of which when I and my coop buddy was trying to know if we were progressing or not, or if we were playing on the same level, so a better UI notification or something to tell the player of their progression through the game.

If I had to say anything more, I'd like there to be something that would make the game a little bit exciting, I mean everything is fun and all but it's also a little bit bland too, maybe more intense music, or environmental effects and whatnot like birds or interactable objects, something happening that would make the map more living, maybe whether and/or catastrophic effects? Don't know.

For the price that it's asking for, I'm giving it a yellow light with it approaching the green light for purchasing it. It's a good game but needs a little bit more tweaking and a little bit more content, and that's probably be done nearing the game's launch out of Early Access. It's also worth mentioning that the game has a map and 'monster' editor, so community made maps are there.

Shameless [url=http://www.ksalue.com/_/game-shock/death-trap-beta-preview-r680]link[/url] to original post.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976312980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1416974071}
review:
Neocore Games have created a stunning hybrid of tower defence and action RPG with Deathtrap. It has everything you would expect from a tower defence game, but the inclusion of action and role-playing elements make this game a truly exciting piece of work. Despite it still being in Early Access, it is surprising how polished the game is so far. Admittedly, the graphics are not too flash, but this is easily overlooked as you dive in to the gameplay. Each level provides you with a new challenge, which you can take on by yourself or with a friend. The Map Editor is really the cherry on top for this game, allowing players to design their own levels in entirety. There is still some work to be done for Neocore Games, but every gamer has something to look forward to when this game is fully developed.

See the full preview at Noobfeed.com: http://www.noobfeed.com/previews/309/deathtrap

author: {'steamid': '76561198021296989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 11268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8583, 'last_played': 1449374470}
review:
Release Date: Feb. 4th 2015

UPDATE 12/16/2014 - Now that I have explored it thoroughly, it is awesome. The devs are very open to new ideas and suggestions (and very responsive to the community, good job!). Custom maps are great to both play and create. Coop and Versus mode is still in the works yet, some bugs, but still very fun to play with others. The full release of Deathtrap cannot come soon enough.

ORIGINAL REVIEW:
This will be an outstanding game once it becomes more complete. As of right now, it has a solid setup and design to be very enjoyable for many hours.

Since it is still in early access, only certain characters, game modes, options, etc. are available. With that said, from what I have seen and played, it is extremely fun. As for an added note, if you have played The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing II, you will know exactly what this game will be all about. RPG mashed with Tower Defense makes a good combo. I kind of see it like an Orcs Must Die with a top-down 3rd person Diablo-isk view instead. It almost feels it has some Sanctum elements to it as well.

Upgrade towers, upgrade skills, loot, and gear-up; Deathtrap will be a gem to have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103654291', 'num_games_owned': 12512, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1432847459}
review:
A competent, polished and very enjoyable tower defence game with RPG and Hack & Slash elements, classes, traps, variety of enemies that makes it really entertaining.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[olist]
[*]A very nice character progression.
[*]Nice loot system.
[*]The RPG mechanics makes the game more enjoyable, and the combos that you can make provides much more replay value.
[*]Variety of enemies.
[*]Excellent level design.
[*]The Workshop supports maps made by users, adding a lot of content.
[/olist]
[h1]Cons[/h1]
[olist]
[*]No history and a short campaign.
[*]Still have some bugs and multiplayer problems even after Early Access.
[/olist]

author: {'steamid': '76561198086819487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1582681998}
review:
[EARLY ACCESS - ACCURATE AS OF NOV. 20TH]
Deathtrap is ARPG (think Torchlight) meets Tower Defense (TD). I'm about 15 hours into the game and I've beaten all of the current beta content twice -- once as a mage and once as a melee.  Assets are good quality and the game hasn't crashed.  I enjoyed it and recommend.  It's more involved than a flash TD game and less involved than Torchlight.

[PROS]
- Fun gameplay.
- Upgrade system for the towers is tied into leveling up your character.
- To a certain extent, you're asked to try new things to defeat harder problems.
- Playing as a melee is very different than playing as a ranged.
- The budget on "essence" (currency to build towers) is very stingy.
- Creeps diverge from path when attacked and will give chase.
- Using portals to move around the board quickly
- Rekeybinding

[CONS]
- Graphics are not optimized yet and if you have an older graphics card then you'll have problems even when you set it at "VERY LOW".
- It's a Neocore game, so the economy is a mess.  You get TONS of gold and find all the good stuff so there's no reason to save or go find treasure chests except for the thrill of beating their guardians.
- Only one voice actor at present and her dialog (the writing, not her performance) is dreadful.  Sexist and labored.
- Same song plays continuously. I muted everything.
- No 1280x720
- No story yet.

[CURRENTLY DISABLED]
- Crafting
- Alternative mission types
- Leveling past LVL 12
- Class: Ranger

author: {'steamid': '76561198015968558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 19066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4210, 'last_played': 1428866258}
review:
If you love tower defence and if you love Van Helsing, then you'll love new cheesy peas .. er .. Clap Trap, no, i mean Deathtrap. It's Van Helsing and the sewer defence made into a dedicated 'stop the spawn of badness making its way to somehere pretty that doesn't do Quags', with new character classes based on the original game's mechanics.
I am currently loving it and finding it wonderfully bug free. Sure some items don't label properly but that's hardly a game breaker; i can live with smacking an Eater of the Dead over the head with Hammernameitem#324. Infinitely preferable to Error 409 'Windows doesn't recognise Windows and also doesn't recognise Windows. Please reinstall DOS 6.2 and brace yourself for EGA'. I'd happily hit the Eater of the Dead with a lead pipe from the drawing room, and/or Professor Plum, which ever has the highest DPS stat.
Currently I am trying my hand at user created maps for the game, wherein i have learnt i can actually tailor my own critters. I can see I am gonna waste an awful lot of game hours on this - wonderful :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198014839327', 'num_games_owned': 810, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1471372611}
review:
+ tower defense, feels like the best practice is collected from the genre :)
+ flexible devs, community management and keen ear to user suggestions
+ different playable characters
+ skill and trap levelling system, with reset possibilities
+ grinding very possible
+ a lot of eyecandies, nice graphics, greatly scalable, even playable on IGP-s
+ WORKSHOP support, user-friendly level editor
+ even if it is the dev of the Van Helsing series, there is no substantial connection, so absolutely playable without knowing those games
+ interesting new ideas on maps (hidden treasure chests, character buffs), so more tactical options
+ pleasant soundtrack

++ greatly enjoyable and playable even in Early Access, so if you have the chance, support the devs! :)

- nothing in the Cons so far, seems promising, I just hope that the devs can maintain a clear focus and develop the existing aspects of the game, then it will be almost perfect. I hope they won't get lost in the sea of ideas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094191756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 16255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5135, 'last_played': 1615582168}
review:
[b]That was then, and this is now... Original writing is intact[/b]

I've not played this game enough, and now I regret it deeply - even now, I started it again in anticipation of VH3...

[b]What a mistake![/b]

I'll try to be short, both for readers sake and for my playtime. Besides, I haven't reached deepest knowledge of the game - yet...

So, game is aRPG - Tower Denfense hybrid - and both traits are executed:

1. there are times when you'll using your character as a main weapon, and cursing dearly the bad luck of not having items you need desperately.

2. sometimes, you will almost 'please sit back and relax while windows configures your computer' - pun intended to people who installed Win95 nine billion times, as your truly did - and for those who didn't - you mostly watch your well-oiled machinery of towers doing it's thing, and tinker here and there when needed.

[b]Balance:[/b]
The game balances itself. I had hidden doubts. I don't have them anymore. In most cases, you WON'T be able to execute cheesiest tactic in existence in every occasion. Rightfully so!

[b]Difficulty:[/b]

Casual players can have fun, no doubt. Killing things if fun, and useful, since monsters tend to breed too much, and then consume too much resources, and die. That being said, the game is not unfriendly to beginners!

More inclined players won't have an easy task - just tweak a difficulty abit, and your glorious winning character and tactics doesn't work so well anymore. 

Difficulty is increased NOT because the game got boring, rather because it feels different, require much better play, and gives rewards accordingly.

Also, there is a score-board - might look unimportant, but wait until you start to consider yourself a Master. Or The Master. But the score-board might not see it quite the same way...

[b]Multiplayer:[/b]

Errr... I can't review this. I've played very little of it, mainly cause public servers are not as full as deserved. So, make your friend with similar off-time to buy it, once when you get addicted.

[i]When I get my hands on some money,
(I'll kiss it's green skin and) buy a fourpack[/i]

Seriously, as a person who played (whole truth!) ~20,000h (under the sea) of aRPGs and ~4,000 games of Tower Defense games (mainly one, to be honest, but this one captures my heart fastly), *ahem*, and having a bunch of friends whom I played that 'prime Tower Defense', I think we'll pretty much have to do it. For the Greater Good!

[b]Then[/b] I'll put a MP review, oh, what a MP review I'll put!

But if you have regulars, go for it. Based on *cough* vast experience, co-op cannot be bad, and competitive - well, it's a pinnacle of Tower Defense games, at least I see it that way, so it would take at least 2,000 games for me to give an opinion [kidding].

[b]Mistakes, punishment, revenge[/b] 

I made a mistakes in (my life and) skills chosen. No problem, I can respec them. For a price, not too low also. But then again, I can grind money, and use it to correct my faults.

I meant to say bit more, but that sentence pretty much sums it up - every mistake (sadly, just in game) you can correct, but have to work a bit for it. Greater the change, greater the amount. It's not cheesy 'just click a button', but it's not 'lemme start again, oh no, ALL of it again' - a golden standard that should be applied to other games, too (disclaimer - I haven't actually become The Master - but if you're reading this, neither did you).

[b]Temporary conclusion:[/b]
It's worth having. Now i have to go back playing. I've slept only few hours, and probably won't tonight. I'm thinking of taking a leave from work, and that's a rather responsible job, so - PEOPLE WILL DIE if I do it. Well, people tend to breed excessively and consume too much resources...

---------------------
[Old review follows, in all its early access glory - note that I don't disavow anything I've said earlier]
--------------------

Early access - NO multiplayer cooperative or competitive!

Having established this, though it is stated clearly, on to the review:

It is a hero-TD, meaning you have a hero (sic!), which kills (alot) of monsters, coming in a wave. Other meaning of killing monsters are, of course, towers (here called 'traps'). For each kill, you get money, which you spend on customizing and upgrading. It looks as Diablo (hero/skills/loot/leveling) is packed in TD-game (upgrading towers/research tree/customization). Graphics are excellent and so is the sound.

Both hero and traps have extensive upgrade possibilities, and you (probably, I'm playing early preview) can't have all of them maxed out - as you very well shouldn't. This means you can develop your own, unique playstyle. Thats TON of possibilities and potential replay value. Since it's not the only one, we shall call it TON-1.

MP coop *will* become available at some point (read the schedule). I expect that each additional player, with his own unique setup, will make gameplay different - I haven't seen this in work, but expect TON of variations, and we shall call it TON-2.

MP competitive will have players in two team pitted two against two (attackers who manage monster waves and defenders - or so I'm told). I don't have a clue what will be attackers options and how many different strategies and possibilities they will have, so lets say that, if done right, it *can* add a POSSIBLE TON of variations, call it possible TON-3

The Editor: yes, there is one. It's in the early stage. I don't know where its limits will lie, but if done right, player-made content can produce unique, high quality maps, introduce different elements and settings - this is PROBABLE TON of variation, TON-4.

Conclusion:
------------
Based on my many years of playing various TDs, and last five years spent as coodeveloper/developer/balancer for the one of best known and long-lived TDs around (no advertisement, though it is a mod and therefore, free) and having helped on several other well and not-so-well known TDs, here's my judgement:

This game has great potential. It is early preview, so all I saw was one hero in single player campaign and lots of stuff is still locked. I believe that full game will be a TD worthy of having, and certainly fun to play - whether you are an aRPG or TD fan, you'll find something intriguing to this genre mix-up.

But since I've detected TON-1 and TON-2 (totalling 2 tons) of certain variations, and, possibly, TON-3 and TON-4, I think think this will be game worth having and that players will return to it many times. Because of those tons of variations, of course...

Should I buy it?
--------------------
1) If you're interested in helping developers to find bugs, refine balance, propose new features (they're very open to this) and influence game development in general - [b]YES[/b]
2) If you're interested in playing what is on the table, few maps, campaign, one hero - [b]YES[/b] - in just a couple of weeks/months there will be alot more. 
3) If you're going to check MP availability, although it is *clearly* stated that there is not one at the moment, and then whine about it and even write negative reviews, then [b]NO[/b], please don't bother

The game is in the playable state, there is no placeholders or missing graphics (in the part which I've seen, at least) - unlike many "Early previews" who are just a way to support further development. 

Meaning, you can play it right away, with some options disabled. Which is what I am going to do, as soon as I finish this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992220516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 5501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3990, 'last_played': 1432022442}
review:
Now that the game has fully released, and ive played it a good bit since (currently 1 level 20 character) I can say that im pleased with the progress the devs have made. Deathtrap is becoming a beautiful little TD game, however some of my gripes still exist, most notably of which is the clunky and slow combat. tooltips and trap/skill explanations are missleading at times and lacking real detail. Crafting....seems pretty pointless well see at higher levels, my complaints are just that, mine. Deathtrap is a solid game at its core, and while I believe it still needs work I can say that it is now worth your time and money.

-Leaving my old opnion here-

*Got the game and I enjoy it, however pretty much every feature listed on the store page is non existant, and the videos clearly show content that isnt in the build we have. Game shows promise but I dont currently recomend it.

To ELABORATE: 

No i dont recomend the game in its current state for the price they are asking. Yes I did buy it. Why? Because I have faith that the devs will make it worth it, and i love TD games in general. I'll endorse the game once you can craft, progress past lvl 11, play more official maps, get all your traps/skills, play multiplayer without hassle, make combat less clunky, fix passive traits, clarify tooltips, add tooltips, open up the 3rd class, add quests, fix the currently broken traps, I could go on but theres no point. The devs know what they need to do. But till then, in my opnion its not worth the price tag.*

author: {'steamid': '76561198077506853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1543093789}
review:
Great!
I played Van Helsing I and i liked it very much, so i bought Pt II and then...;) i was suprised that there is such a studio as Neocore, and as i heard about Deathtrap, i decided to buy it. Today i finally saw it on Steam, and i just have to say, that it is (in Early Access!) a great game!
Thinking about pros and cons...the mapping seems to be a little small, maybe they'll get bigger. The textures and the story takes place in the Van Helsing-Universe, so if you haven't played it yet (VH), you may have a few questions. The traps and the spells are mostly taken from VH. The invented new traps, but they made it "serious". While giving the traps in VH ironic names like Flame-O-Thrower, they just named them Gun Sentry etc. Kinda miss that. But i love this game and would recommend it everyone who played VH, likes TD games, RPGs and so on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2788, 'num_reviews': 1451, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1414066055}
review:
From the creative minds that brought us the amazing 'Van Helsing' adventure series comes a new breed of tower defense style combat.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZjJ3ZuXiu4s
For those of you familiar with playing 'Van Helsing' you will recall a tower defense style section in the original game where you had to defend your keep from hordes of monsters and demons. It was a very cool addition. Well.... Neocore Games the developers have taken this cool and unique concept and seem to have based a FULL game around it and it's simply brilliant. Unlike other standard TD games... in Deathtrap you're character levels up, gains new items and  weapons and you get to play a major, and decisive role in the game. It even has Monster traps for you to call to your aid! - This has got to be my favourite TD game this year - Superb!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969491000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1431647024}
review:
--Update 19th December 2014 ---

So far, Devs have stuck to update schedule, you now have 2 classes, controller support, coop mode (although no server browser as of yet, but can just use steams "invite friend" to play that way or quick match).

Craftings been introduced, game is progressing according to schedule.  Coop is great fun, just waiting on difficulties and levels to be stretched out a bit to add to replayabillity. No game breaking bugs found between me and fiance.

--------------------------------------------

Currently - Very Early Access review.

As far as early access goes - This is what an early access should be.
Clear dev presence in steam forums / site forums, clear development roadmap with planned dates rather than vague ideas.

Campaign currently is limited  to 3 maps, although these are a well done 3 maps which introduce the game quite well.
Difficulty i would say is about right - It's not dark souls but if you don't pay attention its easy to fail.

Graphically - Pretty outstanding for a TD, similar to van helsing (Funny that...)

No COOP at this stage - early november for this, will update at that point.

Otherwise think of this game as an ARPG TD hybrid, where you have a character to control and upgrade but you arn't working alone against the monsters nor can you just roflstomp them without towers. 

Where this really shines though, other than being relatively bug free for a game less than a week old in early release, is the map creator.

It couldn't be simpler to develop maps yourself, design the waves yourself, and eventually (for dates check the discussions page) do many many more things, and then publish these maps on steam workshop for others to enjoy.

I'll update this as features come in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002734128', 'num_games_owned': 3358, 'num_reviews': 928, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1571687073}
review:
First Impressions:

Had a great experience my first time out.  The game does indeed have a lot to offer, what with sharing your own tower defense maps via the Steam Workshop, multiplayer, endless/scenario modes, multiple classes, upgrading your character's skills, stats, & equipment, and more.  Not all of the above-mentioned features are in place yet, but the game has the potential to be fantastic once it officially launches.  The first three campaign maps are available now (as of 10/22/14) with more to follow down the line.  The combat and overall feel is a bit "Van Helsing-esque", which doesn't surprise me considering Neocore released that particular series.  Can't wait to get back to the game to buff up my sorceress!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lJnhQ3mBqh8

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eGsqWLUGL1s

author: {'steamid': '76561198010214619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1469206856}
review:
Wie geil ist DAS denn? RPG + Tower Defense + Multiplayer Koop + Editor? Für TD-Fans wie mich ein Traum.

Es gibt bisher nur 3 offizielle Karten, ist aber nicht schlimm, baut man sich selbst welche. Das erinnert an Age of Empires 2, dort war der Editor auch so simpel aufgebaut, dass jeder nach kurzer Zeit damit klar kam aber auch jeder spielbare Ergebnisse erstellen konnte. So ist es bei Deathtrap auch. Es lädt bereits in dieser frühen Phase zum experimentieren ein. Deswegen gibt es auch bereits kurz nach Release zich Maps im Workshop, genial!

Grafik und Sound sind toll. Die Steuerung ist gut und einfach. Bugs hatte ich bisher keine. Im Spiel fehlen noch der Multiplayer und zwei Klassen.

Für mich eine klare Kaufempfehlung, auch weil dahinter keine Unbekannten sitzen sondern die Entwickler von den Van-Helsing-Spielen. Sie haben sich viel vorgenommen für das Spiel, ich bin gespannt was noch kommt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970441688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 5251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1427223399}
review: This is what Early Access is all about. Solid barebones concept, that's still fun, and playable, with a clear develpment schedule. While at first glance, it may seem a little too barebones, with only one of the final 5 classes available, and just 3 maps, not to worry, with the Steam Workshop Map Editor (That's actually easy to use) you'll have plenty of time to make and play user generated maps (and make them) while you wait between the 2 week content updates. Don't pass this one up if you're a TD (hybrid) fan, it's gonna be quite a ride as it all unfolds. Good Stuff!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057052564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1024, 'last_played': 1423246570}
review:
Deathtrap is a standalone Tower Defense game with RPG elements taken from Neocore's previous game 'The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing' 

In addition to traditional TD's (Tower Defense), you have a character where you can find weapons/armor and level up your character (RPG elements) while building Towers to defend your base.  If you think its overwhelming, it's really not that much in terms of multitasking, waves are started on your own time so there isn't too much pressure for beginners.

Here is my part 1 video on Youtube (spoilers)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7X7LnnZGxgA

This is the full episode (parts 1 & 2) for people who don't mind the full demo spoilers
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hWVKJLoEADA

- excellent options menu
- smooth character controlling
- graphics are fine
- FPS cap is 60 I believe (while there is an option to have no limit, I did a bit of testing and it's still 60)
- no screentearing with vsync off


---

After putting in another 8+ hours into the full release, here is what i've noticed that changed from the Early Access.

- Ability to change the speed of the waves (1/2, normal and 2x)
- Merecnary is still broken OP (It can tank almost everything without taking any damage at all)
- Map Editor / Workshop may still need to be tweaked as it does NOT give EXP/loot for everyone looking to farm.
- Some achievements are broken (as in you unlock them earlier than you should)
- You do NOT get EXP for re-doing maps even on the hard difficulty. (hopefully a fix)


Here is my full game playthrough part 1 *spoilers* (Also note: the first 8 maps from early access are exactly the same)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6VfOCitrN3c

author: {'steamid': '76561198009007200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 9955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2401, 'last_played': 1625973826}
review:
Edited 08/02/15-
The game is now released and after storming through some full release gameplay I'm updating my review.
This devs have delivered, this game has really impressed me during it's development and the finished product is outstanding.
Game runs beautifully, and looks really nice.
There is a huge range of traps available, and three hero classes.
Has a nice RPG style levelling system and equipment for your hero.
There is a forge items menu and ingame currency shop for equipment.
Traps/towers can be upgraded through the use of 'gears' that you get for completing campaign levels.
The map editor is a great tool, very easy to use and tons of customisation including enemy unit customisation.
Each campaign map has multiple difficulty tiers and challenge scenarios.

If you like defense type games where you make the difference with a hero I couldn't recommend this any higher. Usually I recommend games with conditions, like sale etc. This game just buy it, it really is superbly done.
I would put this is my top 10 games of all time and probably my favourite defense game.

See you in the ruins, either as friends or foes.
Now back to it!


------------------
Below here is my original early access review

Firstly this game does not deserve the title early access. The content that is here is absolutely outstanding, this is exactly how an 'early access' game should play. It feels more like a BETA ready for release.

Graphics- One of the most beautiful TD's I've played, and I do love TD's

Gameplay-Hugely fun combination of traps/towers and your hero lead to a blast of a time.

Map editor- Already a powerful tool allowing customisation of maps, approaching enemies(currently in different group types), pathing, enemy spawns, defense locations and exits. Full workshop integration. Very easy to edit and upload maps.

Hero- One class released currently. The sorceress. The levelling system is very nice gaining XP for finishing maps(including custom maps),  with the ability to improve passive and active abilities. Full inventory system with weapons/armour/trinkets that you keep. A ingame shop feature to spend your gold. The hero is an important part of your defense, you never feel like you just sit back and watch the traps do all the work.

Defenses- Already a massive selection of defenses released. As you complete levels you unlock upgrade points to improve defense levels and add special abilities. Defenses can be placed in type specific locations across the map.

Currently there are 3 'campaign' levels and all the custom maps you want to create or subscribe to.

Summary- The game runs smooth, no glitches, no bugs and no crashes on my windows 7 system. The content that is currently available is very polished and well developed. The devs are active on the forum and have already layed out their update schedule for the rest of the year.

As the game currently stands I would highly recommend it. It plays better than most completed games and if it continues this way it will be THE TD/RPG hybrid to compare all others to. 
Will update below as the game updates.

Any questions regarding the game please ask below or PM me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027195149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 3478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1280, 'last_played': 1423774174}
review:
This game is freaking awesome! Best money every spent. If you are a fan of tower defense and MMO's, you will definitely want to get behind this game as it develops. The combination of towers, traps, monsters, and your own hero make for endless ways to play. This is by far my number one TD game, and trust me, I've played them all. I am only taking a break from the game to review the game! 

The graphics are great, the sounds/music are great, the UI is great, and most importantly, the gameplay is GREAT! 

If you did not already know, this game offers a simplistic tower defense. By simplistic, I am only referring to towers and tower placement. Enemies come from many different entrances, and it's up to you, along with the aid of your towers and traps, to stop them before they reach the gate(s). The game heats up once you have hordes of monsters entering from five different locations! The game has persistent hero level/upgrades, meaning once you level up, you keep that level forever. You can upgrade not only your hero, but every tower, trap, and monster. You can also loot items on the battlefield to enhance your hero! So many possibilities! Honestly, they are endless.

Currently there are two class and quite a few campaign maps. That being said, it is in beta, and that is to be expected. Even so, with the map builder you are able to create custom maps and publish them to steam workshop. You can subscribe to any of these custom maps you like and play them in game. It also seems that you do get loot and experience from these custom maps. 

There will also be much more included in the future, including co-op/vs. modes. This is definitely a game you will want to get behind! Help the devs. to create what I already know, will be an EPIC game!

Easily a 10/10

P.S. this is the first 10/10 I've ever given!

Go buy it now!
